At touch of night, on turn of three, with great haste come back to me" And then to EVERYONE'S surprise, Peter lurched up, grabbing Eugene by the back of the neck and pulling him down into a startled (and deep) kiss, his free hand slid down Eugene's chest, a soft palm dancing lightly along the bulge that was pressing against the leather and fur loincloth...And then with a soft breeze from an unknown source, the blue clouds retreated swiftly back into the interior of the Omphalos, and Eugene opened his eyes. Instead of a pair of dreamy, sparkling brown pools instead there were two brown pinpricks amid a sea of terrified white.

Their lips parted with an audible pop. And then the screaming began.

"FUCK FUCK FUCK GROSS FUCK SHIT WHAT THE FUCK!?" Peter screamed, dropping the prophetic gas device to the floor again as he violently shoved against Eugene, the giant geek not moving as Peter flopped backwards with a girlish 'EEK!' as his boobs threatened to smother him.

"Peter!" Judy hissed in alarm, uncoiling and sliding against the tile, curling up around the feminine form of her boyfriend, who was currently spitting and blowing raspberries as if to banish the taste of his friend from his mouth.

"I HATE THIS GAME! WHY'D YOU DO THIS TO ME JUDY!?" Peter sniffled as watery tears formed in his wide brown eyes.

"I sssaid I wasss sssorry!" The scaled goth whined, reaching out to grab the stricken young adult in a tight embrace, her tail coiling around his body.

"NO! LET ME GO!" The reluctant priestess squirmed against his girlfriend but given how small and weak his body was, and how Judy was now basically one giant muscle, it was a futile effort. He glared daggers past the vipers that were flicking their tongues across his closest cheek and smearing salty eye-water across his face. "HOW COULD YOU!?" He said, pointing a twig-like finger at Eugene's dumbfounded, if hunky, form.

"Pete, dude I...I didn't-It was the gas!"

"I DON'T CARE! JUDY STOP I CAN'T BREATHE!"

The gorgon had steadily been coiling tighter and tighter around her beloved, not just out of comfort because it had felt...right? She blinked behind her haphazard blindfold and relaxed as Peter sucked in a huge gulp of air. Judy stared out of the multitude of snake eyes at him, growing more and more used to the 'double reflection' vision, like how it was when you closed one eye and possibly stood on your head. He was so small now, so vulnerable and confused. She loved Peter, he could be a bit of an ass, especially about his former body but now she just wanted to hold him close and stare into his new womanly eyes....Forever.

Judy felt a taloned hand brush against her blindfold before she shook her head, her snakes hissing in surprise.

"Uh, sssorry, babe. I'm jussst, I'm sssorry you had to do that! It'ssss okay, it'ssss just...It'ssss jussst the game. It doesssn't mean anything!" She slithered about until she had mostly unraveled, her new bulk taking up a rather large portion of the common room, but still kept her arms wrapped protectively around Peter's tiny waist. A single strand of her snake hair reached out and stroked against Eugene's neck before a tiny hand smacked it away. Judy resisted the sudden urge to hiss and squeeze the tiny human in her clutches.

"Tell that to the guy that STOLE MY MUSCLES! What's next, is the game gonna make me fuck him or something?" Peter pouted, still glaring at Eugene who gave an apologetic shrug.

Judy figured it was probably best to not mention that most oracles, at least according to the greek legends, remained virgins, only stepping down from the role AFTER they had sex. She wasn't sure if any of them could handle that particular revelation...Or if t would cause Peter to get some crazy thought in his head.

"So, um, what was that like Pete?" Lindsey asked with a swat of her tail. The long hairs tickled as they whisked along her backside.

"It was bad! That's what it was like!"

"Oh that's REAL descriptive, totally the answer I wanted" Lindsey crossed her bulging arms and her thick lips turned into a frown. She snorted like a horse and tapping a hoof on the tile impatiently.

Meanwhile, Eugene was pondering what the Oracle Peter had said. Seek new apparel? Did that mean armor or something? But all their clothes had changed...What if he went back to his room and put on a new shirt? And what was that about the next object he would hold? The geek looked down at the scattered debris from both his and Judy's lounge chairs, spying a splintered chair leg.

'I wonder...' He thought, bending over and reaching a hand out towards the ruined furniture.

"Well what the hell is it like for a girl having junk the size of my head, Lindsey!? Everything got all blue and shiny and it's like I HEARD the words before I said them and I was moving like a damn robot!"

"You totally didn't look like a robot tho. But you were, like, acting like a such a slut!"

Peter bristled at the insult but couldn't exactly deny it. His description of what had actually happened was a bit of a lie anyway. When the gas had taken hold it seemed liked nothing really mattered aside from getting close to Eugene, touching his muscles and telling him that...Fortune? Prophecy? Whatever it was, Peter had WANTED to do it. "Well whatever. That's what it was like. I saw Geno reach over and grab part of one of those chairs like he's doing right now and-"

There was a flash of white light as Eugene's fingers curled around the tiny chair leg, it's ruined form gorwing large and heavy as it morphed into a large sword almost as long as Eugene was now tall.

"OMG!" Lindsey gasped. All of Judy's vipers curled away hissing from the light, and Peter simply stared at the magic scene.

'That was just like what I saw! Did...I really did see the future!' He thought as his jaw went slack. "Dude..." Was all that came out of his mouth, watching as the light shimmered and danced across Eugene's seemingly naturally oiled muscles. The buxom boyfriend didn't realize he was biting his lower lip as he stared at what had once been his little pipsqueak nerd friend.

The light faded as Eugene slowly brought the sword above his head. It still shimmered with a magical light, but only along the edge of the blade. It had a comfortable weight, heavy yet balanced, and it made a soft whistling noise as he swung it in a lazy arc through the common room.

"This is so cool" He muttered to no one but himself, not noticing Lindsey and Judy wincing with each swing. 'I wonder if putting on new clothes will give me armor?'

"ACTION COMPLETE. CONTINUE TURN ONE" The game buzzed.

The group looked at each other.

"Honey, it'sss your turn" Judy hissed softly, uncoiling her boyfriend's fragile female form towards the game, scooping up the Omphalos since outside his 'oracle' form, Peter seemed rather incapable of any physical exertion.

"Oh. Right. Uhh..." Peter mumbled, looking away from Eugene for the first time in several minutes, still not realizing he'd been biting his lip, and took a tiny step towards the game that had, for now at least, ruined his life.
111211111.title: Oracle Insight

choices: Head into town to find five people and hope for the best.
1112111111.content:
Peter took a hesitant step towards the softly buzzing game as Judy slithered behind him, carrying the Omphalos. He HATED being so small and weak that he couldn't even lift a rock, he HATED being a woman with gigantic sweater puppies, larger than Judy had ever had in her normal form, hanging off his chest and he HATED the fact that he had to play this STUPID game!

But he had to play it, otherwise they'd all be stuck like this. HE'D be stuck like this. Some mewling little woman that only seemed capable of doing anything when high as a kite of god-gas...Or whatever the hell it was that made him see the future and grope Eugene up and down. As they reached the table Peter cast a look over his shoulder and moved his waterfall of silky black hair out of the way to stare at his friend in worry. Now that he was only inches away from the clearly magical and VERY dangerous machine, it suddenly seemed a LOT safer over by Eugene. Especially with that sword and those muscles...And he wasn't quite comfortable with the fact that he was also inches from a snake-lady with instant death vision, even if she had been his girlfriend. Hell, it even looked safe with the burly, unclean centaur than where he was right now.

"Pete?" Judy rasped softly, placing a large clawed hand on his barren shoulder, causing her boyfriend to shake in surprise. Or had it been a flinch? It was hard to tell anymore with the little human female. The strong confident male he'd been just a little while ago seemed to be gone and really it just made Peter look even smaller to her. Weaker. Feminine. Pretty. Like really pretty. Pretty like Judy USED to be. The vipers attached to her head began to hiss intermittingly but she silenced them with a somehwat violet shake of her head.

"Pete, it'sss your turn" Judy released Peter's shoulder and reached down towards the yellow die that was on the game map, grasping it between her talons and pulling...Only for it to not move.

"Uh" She said, casting a blindfolded look at her boyfriend before trying again, only to get the same result. The small yellow cube refused to move from it's place on the table. "It's, uh, not moving guys"

"What? Here, maybe you just can't get a good grip with those terrible nails" Peter said batting aside Judy's claws and plucking the dice off the table, "See? Easy! So easy a WOMAN could do it!" Peter said, sticking a soft red tongue out and then immediately regretting the annoyed look on most of Judy's face.

"Maybe it's, um, part of the magic?" Lindsey called out from behind them, "Like how only Thor can use his hammer in the movies?"

"Oh, I get it" Judy said, turning towards her fellow monster and nodding, "Sssort of a 'only THEY who be worthy can possssssesss the power of Thor' type sssituation"

"Yeah!"

"Well, whatever it is, I'm rolling" Peter huffed, and dropped the dice back towards the table. It bounced and rolled and came to a stop, five black dots shining up at them.

"Oh, nice" Peter said with a grin that revealed his perfect white teeth. And then he gasped, "GUYS ITS MOVING AGAIN!"

Indeed, the small yellow plastic figure that was a gross misrepresentation of the body Peter now possessed was moving across the board, skipping the Action Square on the third tile and landing safely on a blank space.

"WOO! I don't have to do anything!" He cheered, giving a victory hop that he immediately regretted from all the things on him that now jiggled. He stumbled, but felt a scaly weight pressing up behind him. He looked and saw part of Judy's tail curled upwards, preventing him from another comical fall backwards.

"Thanks" He said dismissively, "So, who's turn is it ne-" Peter was eager to move back to the safe area over by Eugene when the music let out a tiny DING, and a blue card slid out of the mysterious machine. It was almost as if the machine was building these ports and interfaces the longer it was running.

"Oh god, what now!?" He whined.

"That mussst be a Challenge Card" Judy said, reaching out and pulling it slowly from the previously unseen slot. She handed it to Peter because she obviously was having trouble looking at things right now. "Here. Read it." She commanded.

Peter took the card from Judy's green fingers, cleared his throat, and read what was printed on the card's surface in bold print.

"A priestess has no need to carry her own riches. Find five individuals among the masses to serve and carry your burdens. Upon task completion, you will be able to move one additional space per turn. Failure to complete challenge will result in moving one less space per roll." Peter flipped the card over and looked for any more text, but it was blank.

"So, uh, what does that mean?" He asked, looking at Eugene for answers, who simply shrugged.

"I think, um, it seems like you need to find five non-players and it'll give you a mobility boost so if you roll a three, you move four. Or if you don't do it, the next time you roll a five you'll only move four spaces. Or whatevs" Lindsey said, clopping forward."I don't think it means us because we're players...So do we have to go out into town and find people?"

"Well, Peter and I will be the only ones able to go out since you and Judy are, well, uh, monsters" Eugene said, scratching his head.

"Hey!"

"It's true! We're already gonna attract a shitload of attention with me looking like Conan and Peter looking like Gal Gadot. And Peter can't carry that rock he's chained to on his own! And what happens when we find five people? How do we convince them to just follow two random cosplayers back to the dorm?" Eugene said, sliding the giant shining sword into the scabbard that had appeared around his loincloth's waist roughly around the moment the broken chair leg had transformed into a giant sword.

"Well guess you'll have to find out, unless you're good with not getting a movement bonus, Pete" Lindsey said.

"Maybe they could BOTH usss sssome fresssh air away from usss monssstersss" Judy hissed in anger. She released her grip on the Omphalos and turned away from Peter, who, not expecting the weight, was pulled down to the floor with a girlish 'oof' as she slithered away and sat angrily on her coils away from the group. She should just show them who was the monster! One look at she'd be able too...

But she shook the notion off. After a few minutes of discussion, Eugene and Peter decided to...
1112111111.title: Peter rolls a 5

choices: Peter, Eugene and 'Peri' go to recruit four more people
11121111111.content:
"Well if I can get an extra roll that means we can beat the game faster" Peter said matter-of-factly, pulling himself up off the floor and brushing his white toga off with a couple of indignant swats at the fabric. He pulled at the gold chain connecting him to the Omphalos and began stomping towards the dorm's main doors...Only to get stuck walking in place.

"UGH THIS STUPID ROCK!" He screamed, turn around and giving it a petulant kick with his sandals, which only succeeded in nearly knocking him over again. There was a hissing cough from the corner as Judy began snickering, a yellow claw pointed at him mockingly. His full lips parts in anger as he was about to rattle off another insult to the hideous creature when Peter's line of sight was blocked by a wall of muscles.

"Here, Pete. I'll carry it for you" Eugene said as he lifted the Omphalos up with a single giant hand, palming it like Peter used to palm basketballs in the gym. The beefy geek effortless tucked the magical stone under his arms, the muscles flexing like well oiled machinery. Really well oiled. Peter closed his mouth and looked away.

"T-thanks, Geno" He said, feeling his face run hot.

"Well it's the least I can do. We'll never get anywhere if you can carry it, plus this is sort of all my fault"

"It really is. Also, is anyone else really thirsty? Because I'm totally thirsty" Lindsey quipped as she headed back towards the common room's kitchen, gently opening the ruined fridge and pulling out one of the crudely disguised six packs that the students had hid in a box of Coca-Cola cans. "Really if you'd just stayed in we could be watching a bitchin' movie right now. Also pick us up some more beer while you're out? These are totally mine now" The centaur pulled a can out of it's plastic ring and with dexterity that her new fingers shouldn't have had, popped open the top and began chugging it.

In a flash similar to how Eugene had gained a sword, the tiny can of beer shimmered and glowed, expanding outward until it was a massive urn held aloft in one hand by the sorority girl, rivulets of what looked and smelled like wine running down into her messy beard. Setting the urn down, the usually well mannered blonde let out a thunderous burp and looked down at the changed beverage in surprise before breaking out into a whickering chuckle. "Uh, nevermind. Guess whatever we use now turns period appropriate! Man, this is really good!"

Peter and Eugene just blinked as they watched their friend take another long, messy drink.

"Um, let's walk. I don't want my truck turning into one of those horse carts" Peter said, looking up at Eugene, who had a look of disgust on his face as he started at Lindsey.

"Itsss called a chariot you bimbo" Judy muttered quietly from her sulking corner.

"Yeah...I don't think I could fit in a normal car anyway right now. But yeah, let's get out of here and do this thing" Without bidding the two former girls as much as a goodbye, Peter and Eugene hustled towards the door side by side. Peter opened the glass doors and moved through first as Eugene ducked as they exited out into the warm summer evening.

Eugene took a deep breath of fresh air as they stared out over the deserted campus.

"So. Where do we find five people, and how do we convince them to just follow us back here?" The towering titan wondered out loud.

"I'll tell you what we should do first, we should go to the mall and get that chick at the store to fix this!" Peter said, pointing a nail in the direction of the shopping center. "Tell her to give you your money back and end the game!"

"Can't" Eugene replied with a shake of his head, his brown, Fabio-like hair flowing in the soft breeze, "It's after 5. The mall closed twenty minutes ago"

"Gods damnit!" Peter kicked a small rock with his sandal, "Well, we could always try the off-campus frats? I know that Psi Iota Mu Phi Sigma still has some guys staying there..."

"Well, good a place as any to start, I guess" Eugene shifted the Omphalos under his arm and then took off walking, long strides almost jerking Peter along before the currently athletically incapable jock whined, slowing their pace to a much more manageable stroll.

"I wonder what Jeremy is gonna say when I show up looking like this, though. Dude's a bit of a horn dog" Peter wondered out loud as he trailed behind Eugene, his eyes absent mindedly settling on the rear of the loincloth, the shifting gluteous muscles pulling the raven haired former man into an almost hypnotic trance. It was a nice distraction from his own jiggling, bouncing bits and Peter off-hand began thinking about stealing a bra from Judy's dresser. Not like that scaly, flat and currently-acting-like-a-bitch bitch needed one anymore with that tacky metal breast plate.

"Don't worry, I don't think he'd try anything with me standing there"

"Thanks. I really appreciate it...Even if this is, like, your fault"

"Yeah. I'm sorry. Hey, you, uh, wanna talk about what happened?" Eugene cast a look over his shoulder to look at Peter.

"Huh? Oh. OH! No. Absolutely not. we're never going to talk about any of this again! And if you do I'll kick your ass. Or something!" Peter blinked rapidly and shook his head, sending his long black mane of hair flying as he pulled himself out of the trance.

"Heh. Fair enough" Eugene chuckled. All things considered it hadn't been TOO awful. For a moment after the game had started he'd half expected to have to fight his friends or some cyclops or something would have come charging out of the game. So far, outside of the transformations, it really hadn't been all that terrible. Definitely not 'full of peril' like the oracle next to him had decreed.

The two walked for a few more minutes in silence, the jingling of Peter's chain the only real sound outside the normal late afternoon ambiance of the town. Even in lock-down there was still the distant roar of traffic as the world continued to spin beyond the otherwise closed college campus. It was pretty peaceful, even if the high desert breeze felt a little chilly on Eugene's bare chest. But that peace was broken as they rounded the corner or the Sciences building and ran smack dab into campus security. Specifically Perry Logan, the security guard who thought of himself as the World's Best Cop but was very much the opposite in almost every way. The man was short tempered and had trouble hiding his dislike of individuals that were not American. He typically only worked during the day when classes were in session, but with half the campus security leaving for lockdown, the ugly man had chosen to work a double shift for more pay.

"Oh great, its Officer Friendly" Peter groaned.

The balding, middle-aged man had just been starting his smoke break when two had appeared. Some Kevin Sobro-lookalike and some chick that wasn't wearing enough clothes. He made it a point to know most of the 'characters' on campus, and he didn't recognize these two at all.

"Fuckin' tourists" He muttered as he threw his cigarette to the pavement and rested a hand on the tazer strapped to his hip. "Folks, hate to interrupt your...evening stroll but this campus is closed. Authorized personnel only."

Peter looked up at Eugene, who had a look of confusion on his handsome face, "Uh, you catch that?"

"Nuh-uh. Did you?"

Perry rolled his eyes. "Great, just great. Listen, I don't know what the hell you're saying, but in AMERICA. WE. SPEAK. ENGLISH." The security guard said loudly and slowly, and let out a sneer of frustrated disgust. Why did he always have to deal with the weird people? FOREIGN weird people? He rubbed his thick moustache for a second and then pantomimed at the nearly naked dude and his (admittingly fucking hot) girlfriend.

"YOU. LEAVE. BEFORE I. ZAP" Perry pointed at his taser and then pointed at Eugene and Peter again, before making a shooing motion. After another moment of confused gibberish, Perry just shook his head. He couldn't ACTUALLY zap them, not unless they attacked him first, so maybe a little physical encouragement would help speed things along so he could get back to his smoke break. HE stomped forward and grabbed hold of the pretty girl's forearm and began pulling her towards the street. The girl had shouted something in surprise while the big man yelled, clearly angry...Perry unclasped his taser and spun around to point it at the big man...

...And then Peri blinked, letting go of her mistress's arm, gasping in horror at daring to touch the Pythia without permission. She collapsed to her bare knees, silken fabric swirling in the breeze as she settled to the rough pavement.

"OH MISTRESS, FORGIVE ME! I knew not what I was doing! I am forever your faithful servant, please, tell this worthless handmaiden what she must do to earn the forgiveness of the gods!"

Peter and Eugene looked at each other in shock. In the span of a moment they had just seen the pushy security morph just as the chair leg had. Just as Lindsey's beer had. The overweight man's body had shimmered as it slimmed dramatically, his hips flaring out, breasts emrging as his guard uniform shrank and shifted into a revealing toga similar to Peter's. A balding pate had exploded with soft brown hair, and a veil had settled over a definitively face. And the security guard's rough smoker voice was replaced by a soft girlish one, and speaking in a language that the two could understand.

"Uh, what the ACTUAL fuck!?" The two transformed students yelled at the same time.
11121111111.title: Challenge Card: Heading into town.

choices: They choose another hunting-ground for servants.
111211111112.content:
Eugene and Peter stared at the new girl, and then aimed their befuddled gazes at each other. Eugene, making sure to keep the Omphalos chain loose by extending his arm, took a step away and Peter felt an unexpected stab of pain in his heart.

It felt bad to have Gene be repulsed by him, to have his rippling, impressive bulk out of arm’s reach. He opened his mouth to say something to the bronzed demigod, to maybe bridge the gap that had developed between them ever so quickly…

And he shut the fuck up when he saw what Geno was actually doing. An electric blue flower, the exact color of the Zeus-device Taser, had fluttered to the floor alongside the prostrating… luggage-girl that the dickhead security guard was now.

“Wow, Pete,” breathed Eugene. “That was… weird. But, uh, impressive! I didn’t, um, I don’t — I’ll be fine if you touch me, right?”

Peter dumbly nodded. “Yeah, I think you’ll be good. We, uh brushed against each other when we left the door, ‘member?” He wasn’t entirely sure if it was a lie or not, but the thought of never touching Gene again felt... bad. “Plus, I, uh touched Jude too. After the card-thing.” That he was sure of. He couldn’t possibly forget having her slimy, disgusting coils all over him.

“Alright. Cool.” Eugene sidled back to arm’s-reach-distance, and Peter felt secure again.

Their attention was once again turned to the feminized form of their resident Sgt. Dickhead, whose veiled forehead was still practically scraping the pavement in her extended bow. Peter would never admit it, but having a superpower that didn’t result in him draping himself over the sturdy, handsome form of Gene was pretty badass.

Also, the new-girl’s tits were smaller than his! Just like a handmaiden should be, less beautiful than their Mist—

Peter scowled and pinched his arm to dispel any sense of possession or pride related to his burdensome funbags.

“I, uh, think you need to tell her to do something.” mumbled Eugene, scratching the back of his neck. “And he was speaking, like, some other language, right?”

“Oh, shit, yeah,” Peter waved a hand at the prone form of the… what should he call her? Or him? “You may rise, girl.” he commanded, waving an arm imperiously. “There are, uh, things to do.”

Eugene stifled a chuckle. “You, uhm, started strong, but the finish was —.”

“Shut up!”

To Peter’s quiet awe, the girl-cop seemed to lower herself further into her apology-bow. “You are too kind, Mistress, but please, you musn’t restrain yourself. Shall I partake in a round of self-flagellation —” Peter looked questioningly at Eugene, who mimed whipping himself — “— alk over burning coals?” She crawled towards Peter’s sandalled feet. “Please, Mistress!”

Peter blinked. People didn’t normally ask him for advice, or commands, or the minutiae or methods of harming themselves. But — besides the last one — this felt pretty alright. People should listen to him. Still, he had to rein this masochist in a bit. He didn’t want her to throw herself off a cliff before she could give him the movement bonus.

Uh, or at all.

“For your penance, um, feeble… What’s your name?”

“Peri, mistress, but there’s no need for you to—”

“For your penance, Peri, you must…” Peter put a nail on his lip, miming deep thought. “Rub your stomach and pat your head! Simultaneously! For ONE HUNDRED AND TWENTY seconds!”

“Mistress, I —”

“IT IS WHAT THE GODS WILL!” Peter thundered. Or rather, yell-squeaked. The little stomp he gave to cement his authority didn’t really feel stompy or authoritative, too. Just jiggly.

The silken robe of ‘Peri’ swirled as she rose from her bow. Her veil shifted rippled with every pat of her head, sniffles of gratitude slowly graduating to full-on joyful crying, which made the tummy-patting a bit awkward to watch.

Eugene coughed. Peter shifted from foot to foot. Both tried not to look at the girl sobbing happily.

“So, uh, we gonna go through with this?” Eugene said, shifting the Omphalos from hand to hand.

“... Yeah.” Peter murmured. “I mean, it’s not like this is gonna last forever. Plus, Psi Iota has some real dickheads. Gonna go in there like Rambo with girl-guns.” He shot finger guns at the distant frat house.

Eugene weighed the morality of turning some frat bros into weepy handmaidens versus the benefits of winning the game, plus the weird part of his brain that said that more soft, small damsels around was a big plus no matter which way you looked at it.

“Alright,” shrugged the nerd. The latter side won out. Hard. “Hey, do you think we’re, uh, talking differently?”

“What?”

“You heard Perry before he went all… this.” A large hand was waved at the mid-penance-sobbing maiden. “Either we have, like, dysphasia or our Broca’s area got blasted by the board game.”

Peter rubbed his eyes and leveled a sour look at Eugene. “You goddamn nerd.” He waved a pale hand at the heroic dork. “C’mere. I’ll… say stuff, and you try to see if my lips are, I dunno, pulling bullshit or whatever.”

Eugene complied, and sidled up two feet away from the oracle. Suddenly, the two were acutely aware of how close they were to the other, and that, frankly, both were paragons of their respective gender.

“A-alright.” mumbled Peter. He stood on his tiptoes and swayed vaguely towards ‘Gene’s bronzed bulk. God, he was tall. “Let’s do this. ‘Ba-na-na.’ ‘Kum-quat.’ ‘Wa-ter-melon.’”

Eugene probably would have made a snide comment about how Peter’s mind was always on food if he wasn’t absolutely and utterly entranced. Everything about Peter was thrown into sharp relief: his long ringlets of dark hair; the immaculate pink skin of his full lips; the way that he could practically see down his toga —

“WHAT ARE YOU DOING TO MY MISTRESS?!” rung out through the warm air, breaking the two out of their shared reverie.

They turned to face the frankly furious Peri, who minced over to stand between the two, extending her arms to protect the befuddled Pythia behind her, and setting an expression on her face that seemed like it was supposed to be threatening, but, ultimately made her look more like an angry Chihuahua.

“How dare you approach her without cleansing yourself, how dare you gaze upon her unveiled —”

“Seriously, Gene, that’s a rookie mistake,” teased Peter who was rather enjoying the sight of someone else getting the third degree for once.

Eugene would have responded with a pithy remark, but he was pretty sure that the former mallcop would probably try to kill him if he did so. He didn’t want her to hurt herself in the attempt.

“— and how dare you tempt her so! The flush on her face, the sheen and sparkle in her sainted eyes! Did you make a wicked pact with Eros, you —”

“Allllrighttt, that’s enough.” interrupted Peter, his face was cherry-red and lined with panic. “Um, it’s all cool, uh… Peri?”

“There’snoneedforyoutoremembermynamemistressthemeresoundofyou—â €

“Yup, yup, sure, whatever,” groaned the prophetic jock. “I, uh, talked with the gods and uh, he’s all right in their books.”

Peri put a delicate hand over her mouth. “Oh! I am so sorry, sir. I did not—”

“It’s alright,” rumbled ‘Gene. They did not need another two-minute apology session. “No hard feelings.”

Peri tilted her head at the unfamiliar idiom, but otherwise got the message. She curtsied to Eugene — who wasn’t entirely sure if that was period-appropriate — and turned to Peter eagerly.

“May I divest you of any burdens, Mistress?”

Peter scratched the back of his neck. “There’s not much I have right now…”

“There’s this.” Eugene waved the Omphalos around with a cheeky grin and set it on the ground.

The current Pythia shot a pointed look at the Herculean geek. “Dude, she might hurt herself, don’t be a —”

The handmaiden hoisted the Omphalos into her arms with a soft ‘Oof’, cradling it like it was her baby.

“—dick.” finished Peter, sullen pout on his face. “How come everyone else but me can lift that thing?!”

“I could carry any burden for my Mistress!” proudly announced the handmaiden.

“We should get going,” Eugene said, trying to pull Peter out of his fourth weakness-realization funk that day. “Judy might have swallowed Lindsey whole by now.”

Peter laughed nervously at the joke before setting out. Judy wouldn’t do that. Right?
111211111112.title: Peter, Eugene and 'Peri' go to recruit ...

1112111111121.content:
The three walked down the campus byways in silence, the two game-players finding it a bit awkward to talk with the eager steward nearby. Peter instead turned his focus to how nice it was to be able to walk without worrying about being jerked back or forward every four seconds, nearly bouncing his tits out of the gauzy toga.

Perry may have been a shit security guard, but he could carry a rock like no one else.

And he’d never admit it, but it was way easier to walk with the guy who had a product partnership with the concept of muscles and an overeager cupbearer than stay in a room with Ms. Horsedick and his (terrifying) snakeheaded girlfriend.

Geno was much easier to look at, too. Easy enough that his gaze would wander over to his sculpted pecs, impeccable biceps, or crazily tight ass if Peter’s focus lapsed…

Peter wrenched his attention back to walking. Peri better not have noticed.

The few drew a few looks from pedestrians as they walked outside the campus. Eugene couldn’t whether it was because they were smokin’ hot, or that they weren’t wearing masks.

Could representatives of the Gods get COVID? Hopefully not.

Peter was half-tempted to go out and high five a disapproving old woman who definitely tutted and scowled at them into servility, but Eugene dissuaded him. Other people would definitely notice the geezer losing forty-five years and eighty pounds, and plus, she might have a family or something.

The Psi Iota Mu Phi Sigma boys’ only family was the platonic idea of partying. When the toga-wreathed boys trod back to their frat the next day, they’d probably be met with raucous cheering and no questions about where the hell they were the last day.

Still, they might object to seeing their bros feminized in a flash of light. The Morphmanji players looked up at the frat house gravely, contemplating their options. Surrounding the brown-glass littered porch was a flat roof, and presumably, a wealth of dorm windows, which equalled more baggage-girls for Peter.

“Do you think that roof could hold my weight?” mused Eugene.

“I’m surprised the dorm floor holds your weight, Geno.” snarked Peter with a flick of his hair. “I should be the one to go up there.”

“How are you gonna move the Omphalos, dude?”

“And what if you hurt yourself, Mistress?”

Peter rolled his brown doe-eyes. “The chain’s long enough if you just, like, set it down a foot away from the edge, man.” He turned his attention to the histronic handmaiden. “And, uh, the Gods said that they’d protect me and stuff.”

Peri’s contrite expression slid into a mask of joy. “I see! My apologies for doubting you.” Another deep curtsy followed.

“There’s another problem,” Eugene hooked a thick thumb at the door of the frat, that was seemingly scribbled over in red oil marker. “That.”

Peter shrugged his pale shoulders with a roll of his eyes. “Oh no frat bros don’t have respect for rented property, whatever shall we do?”

“No dude, I mean, can you read that?”

Peter squinted at the red-marked wood. On second glance, the scrawled ink did look like letters, just in no language he recognized. “No.” he lamely admitted.

“Remember that community forum post from a couple months back? Some town-lady got pissed ‘cuz the Psi Iota guys scrawled ‘Don’t Dead Open Inside’ on their house door.”

Peter nodded slowly, comprehension dawning. “Fuck.”

Gene returned his grave nod. “No English for us, dude.”

The jock scrunched his face into a sullen pout. There went a bunch of options. Fuck, what were they going to do about food?!

“Pardon me, Mistress!” Hero and Oracle both turned to the gung-ho girlservant, her eyes glittering with pride. “I am able to decipher these runes!”

“Really?!” Peter grabbed the shoulder of the handmaiden, whose eyes went hazy with reverence.

“Y-yes, Mistress.” she choked out, voice thick with awe. “These words warn passerby to not enter, because of the excess of corpses insi—”

“Never mind that,” Peter yanked his handmaid and (attempted to pull) Gene into an impromptu huddle. “I have a plan.”
1112111111121.title: Challenge Card: Delphic Devising

choices: They return to a bored Judy and Lindsey.
They're accosted on their way back.
11121111111211.content:
Jeremy woke from his alcohol induced stupor to a rapid, insistent knocking on the door. Rising from the couch amidst much clattering of beer cans, he staggered to the door, stepping over the prone form of his frat bros who were waay morre partied out than he was.

Was this a pizza call? At — he squinted at the grandfather clock in the foyer — five PM? A bit early, but hey, food was food. It was his turn to pay anyways.

He opened the door… to a petite brunette who was nine kinds of cute, her face pulled into a charming pout of concentration that quickly shifted into a gasp when she saw the beleaguered frat bro.

“Very much greetings!” she cheered in an accent Jeremy couldn’t place, throwing her full body into a wave. “I am being a dys-track-shen!”

Jeremy blinked. This was… different. Girls didn’t approach him. Especially cute foreign girls. Also she wasn’t pizza, but he sure as hell wasn’t going to complain.

“That’s real nea— wait, are you the new dealer? Or a cop, ‘cuz you have to tell me if…” He stopped when he saw the girl’s face wrinkled in confusion. He’d have to go slower, it looked like.

“Do… You… Have… A…” Jeremy searched his alcohol-addled mind for a query that could cross the language barrier. He settled for forming his hand into a finger-gun and pointing it demonstratively.

Any concern he might have had was dispelled when the girl mirrored his own mimery, touching her index to his and tilting her head questioningly. If worse came to worst, he’d be postively fucking elated to let this chick arrest him.

Jeremy activated suave-mode, which consisted of him slicking his greasy hair back and lowering his voice half an octave. He threw in a lean against the doorframe to really bring her the smolder. “So, uh, what’re you here for?”

“For Mistress!”

An unexpected answer. Jeremy didn’t let it phase him, though. “Uh, neat. So, like, are you a maid or something?”

The girl broke into a bright smile. “She is best Mistress!”

Still not really an answer, but she was still adorable.

“Cool, cool.”

~~~


Eugene and Peter listened to the cacophonic alien language shouted from the doorstep. It was far easier for Peter to sneak along the white picket fence than Gene, but being too short to be seen was kinda like having a low BMI because your legs got cut off.

They arrived at the corner of the frat, the ideal place for infiltrating. There was a raised patch of ground next to the low roof’s corner, and three out of four angles of sight blocked by the nearby houses.

“You sure about this, Pete?” half-whispered Eugene. “I can try to go up with you, you know..”

Peter tried not to let his flush show. “I’ll be fine, dude.” He looked up at the window and grit his teeth. “Once one of ‘em’s a maid, they can probably carry the stupid fuckin’ rock for me.” He set his face into a frown of determination post-grumble. “Just make sure you put the Omphalos in a good place.”

The almost-Hercules shrugged. “Alright then. Boost on five?”

“Sure.”

The raven-haired beauty braced himself as Geno rumbled a count, ready to step on the interlaced fingers of his friend’s strong arm…

Which was why he let out a squeal when that selfsame arm circled itself around his hips and handily hoisting him into a seated position behind his head..

“Pete!” Eugene turned his face as far clockwise towards the attractive augur as he could without getting a noseful of thigh. “This is supposed to be stealthy.”

“I — you —” spluttered the shame-mantled soothsayer, “You said you would boost me, dude!”

“Yeah, I boosted you onto my shoulders.”

Peter most definitely did not think about how he could feel the rumble of Gene’s voice from his firm seat. “That’s not a — fuck, whatever. Just get the rock up here.”

Peter watched the flex and ripple of the nerd’s arm as it hoisted the prophetic rock, teeth teasing at his lip for no reason at all. With a bit of a scrape, the Omphalos was placed, base down, around the midpoint between two windows.

“Huh. Might use my wish to keep these.” Eugene experimentally flexing a bicep.

Peter nodded his agreement as soon as the words left Gene’s lips, and then was immediately glad that the dweeb couldn’t see his head. “Fuck that, dude. I’m winning with my plus-one movement and wishing for a badass mansion, with a fuck-ton of workout rooms.”

“And what if I drop you here, huh?” teased Eugene, faking a drunken stagger.

“Don’t you dare.” hissed Peter. The mock-wobbling soon approached the shakes of real, oracle-dislodging wobbles, forcing the jock to cling to the rectangular prism of a skull in front of him for support.

It was Eugene who first realized what the twin softnesses pressed against his parietal bone were. It was also Eugene who realized that Peter’s soft skin had the sweet scent of violets.

Peter reached the same conclusion Eugene had shortly thereafter, and disentangled himself with a mumbled apology. Eugene returned the same contrite murmur, and the two went about their next task silently.

Peter was able to clamber up Gene’s raised limbs surprisingly easily, considering his utter lack of muscle tone. His The oracle disappeared from sight, forcing the board-game-owner to listen intently for signs of mission completion.

A light tapping on a window.

A muttered curse.

A light tapping on a window left of the first tapping.

Glass-muffled thumps.

A coo of (what he hoped was) mock-femininity from Peter.

A series of very fast glass-muffled steps.

A creaking of a window.

An unfamiliar language.

Then, he could see the flash of light. And he could hear a very distinct, very clear, and very excited “Mistress!”

“Uh, hey. Could you help me get thi—”

An airy gasp. “And lay my hands upon the sacred Omphalos without anointing myself first? Would the Gods allow such a —”

“Yeah, yeah, they’re super fine with it."

“Then lift it I shall!”

The slap of sandaled feet on vinyl shingles.

A feminine grunt of exertion, the scrape of stone on shingles, and a familiar sigh of disgust.

The slap of sandals and the creak of weight on a windowsill.

“Hey, you guys don’t have any beer in here, do you?

The creak of a window closing.

Eugene shook out a bit of tension in his shoulders. He didn’t need to be nervous. This would be fine. Everything would be fine.

Still, he spared a couple of concerned looks at the window as he padded back to the front of the frat.

~~~


“And she is dancing, like pow! And the gas is going-up-ing, like fyoosh! And —”

Jeremy was nodding dreamily at every word out of the firecracker’s mouth, not really comprehending what she was saying, but generally appreciative of all the bouncing that her gesture-exaggerated onomatopoeias brought.

Sure, she may be waxing broken-English poetic about this ‘Mistress’ character, but she sounded more like some really admired big-sister instead of, like, her lesbian girlfriend or something.

And if she was, so what? He could probably sway them into a threesome with his raw sexual charism— wow that guy was big

Someone who looked like Kevin Sobro mixed with prime-Schwarzenegger with the hair of Fabio strode into Jeremy’s line of sight, his ripped top half completely unclothed, and a Big Fucking Sword sheathed at his hip.

Jeremy risked a small wave of acknowledgment, and the man returned a distracted nod, staring up at the windows of the house. Concern jolted through Jeremy — was he about to get robbed? — but the short unconcerned look the foreign girl shot the bodybuilder relaxed him.

If she wasn’t moving, he wasn’t.

Then the girl moved, pushing past him into the frat with an excited “Mistress!” Jeremy turned to see a gaggle of five togaed girls descending the creaky stairs, all of them surrounding a grumpy looking bombshell with massive tits, who was chained to a rock… for some reason. His conversation partner joined the herd, jabbering excitedly in some foreign language into the black-haired girl’s ear.

“Uh, can I help you? Hey, is that a six-pac—”

The black-haired girl pushed past him — and took a moment to frown at her hand, as if she expected to push through him or something — then hailed the bodybuilder with a tired wave and sulky foreign grumble.

The two continued their conversation heedles of jeremy, but to be fair, he wasn’t too focused on the anachronistic couple, either.

He waved to the girl he’d been talking to for the last twenty minutes with a “Hey!”

She did that cute full-body wave, adding in a “Good-bye-bye!” to boot.

“Do you have, like, a number you could give me or anything?”

She placed a tiny finger to her lips in concentration, shouting “Fifty-two!” at the befuddled wannabe-playboy.

Jeremy watched them trundle towards the campus, shrugging at the seeming-security-violation. Perry’d get them if they were doing anything untoward.

Maybe he’d get some pizza. That sounded good right now.
11121111111211.title: Challenge Card: Furtive Frat (in)Filtration

choices: Eugene tries to find Judy, and better answers.
111211111112111.content:
The trip BACK to the dorm seemed to take much less time to Eugene but it was MUCH less peaceful now with the gaggle of girls that flanked at close distance behind the two, a tittering mass of female flesh and togas that were literally worshipping the ground the oracle walked upon. The Omphalos was nestled comfortably in the arms of Peri who had quickly caught up with the group and had, after a very brief argument had quickly been chosen as the 'leader' by Peter (who was, frankly, already growing tired of the entourage even if it did mean a movement bonus and no longer dealing with the gods damn rock of destiny).

"Ugh, can you guys just be quiet for two seconds!?" Peter groaned as they reached the halfway point, and the fraternity turned sorority went dead quiet for exactly two seconds before chattering once more.

Eugene chuckled, getting a punch to the forearm that, had they both been in their previous bodies, would have landed painfully on his shoulder and possibly sent Eugene flying. Instead it felt more akin to a fly landing on his forearm, while Peter stumbled back wringing his hand and was ENGULFED by VERY concerned toga wearing women showering him with sympathetic noises followed by 'Mistress!'.

"Oh my gods will you all just take the twists out of your panties!?" Peter waved his arms to free himself from the gaggle of girls who all looked at their mistress and then themselves, in confusion.

"What are panties mistress?" Peri asked with a look of innocent bewilderment.

"What? OH FUCK!" Peter pawed at his robe and, for the first time since assuming the role, realized that he was very much naked beyond the folds of the white toga. "DUDE I'M NOT WEARING ANYTHING UNDER THIS!"

"You're just realizing this now? Your uh, fashion choices haven't really been leaving too much to the imagination Pete"

A judgmental gasp of disapproval washed over the handmaidens.

"If the most divine Pythia chooses not to wear these 'panties' then no one should speak ill of her choice!" Peri said.

"Chosen by the gods or not how dare he speak to our mistress like that!" The former Tommy now Talia gasped, covering her veiled mouth, her curly auburn hair seemingly turning a shade lighter from shock.

"Apollo should punish him for such blasphemy!" Marcus now Macaria hissed, pointing a long nailed finger at Eugene, pushing her brown hair out of her green eyes.

"These 'panties' sound terrible anyway!" Cried Lucas now Lucia, as she struck a stand-offish pose, hands resting on hips that 'almost' rivaled Peter's.

"You look as majestic as always, mistress!" Gushed Kevin now Koren, who wore her blonde hair in a set of loose braids down her back.

"Shut up, Koren" Farad now Farah, groaned with a dismissive wave of her dark skin, giving the former (and smaller) frat bro a shove, sending her tumbling backwards onto the campus green.

"Oh my gods" Peter facepalmed "All of you leave Eugene alone. He's, uh, allowed to talk to me that way. Your, ugh, mistress commands it"

"Of course mistress!"

"So you will it, it shall be done!"

"Oh what great and wonderful wisdom you possess!"

"Only the wisest commands flow from your lips!"

"Oh great and powerful warrior, accept my my humblest apologies!"

"By your command, my mistress!"

"Ugh" Peter groaned. When he'd gone about turning all the guys he'd actually gotten a little bit of a thrill. His own personal little army that were worshipping him! It had been fun but the last five minutes of just nothing but the tittering, the gibbering, and oohs and aahs and the word 'mistress!' popping up every five seconds like the seagulls from that one Disney movie with the talking fish he used to watch as a kid. It was extremely grating.

"We're totally raiding Judy's and Lindsey's closets when we get back to the dorm. I can't believe I've been walking around commando this whole time" He muttered, stomping off, the handmaiden harem buzzing along behind him in constant adulation.

"Well, now you know what it feels like for me" Eugene chuckled, taking two large strides before being right back at Peter's side, where he belonged, "No shirt, no shoes, no service"

"Yeah yeah" Peter said with another wave, but a part of his mind giggled at the random thought of Eugene somehow wearing his loincloth as a shirt in somewhere. After all those signs typically didn't say anything about pants...

"So, uh, what are we gonna do about this whole 'English is a foreign language' thing now? I don't know about you but that's freaking me out a little bit" Eugene asked as they approached the dorm.

"Oh don't worry hero, Mistress said I did a good job on our quest! If you or mistress need assistance with these outsiders then it would be the greatest of any honor to translate for you!" Peri said cheerily from just a few steps behind.

"See, I've got my own text-to-speech device. It'll be fine" Peter said as he reached for the dorm's door, only to blink in surprise as five pairs of hands shot out in front of his own.

"No mistress!"

"No I've got it mistress!"

"Don't jest, I'VE got it mistress!"

"Allow me, mistress!"

"Let me, grace of Apollo!"

"OKAY! GODS, I GET IT! YEESH."

Eugene chuckled.

"NOT A WORD, MISTER" Peter let out a womanly harumph and sashayed into the dorm lobby, Peri following closely behind. Eugene moved towards the open door, but it swung shut as the almost comical pile of girls funneled in behind Peter's flowing toga robe, leaving the geek to blink in surprise.

"I don't care. This is still so cool" He muttered as he very, very carefully pulled the glass door open...And then completely ripped it away from the door frame with a crash of twisting metal and shattered glass as a wall of high pitched screams washed over him.

"PETER!" Eugene bellowed, tossing aside the ruined door like it was nothing and charging into the tall building, hand leaping to the hilt of the sword and pulling it out in one swift motion. It even made 'sching!' sound and everything. But as cool and Eugene may have found it, his mind was focused on one thing as he charged through the dorm lobby, leaving cracked tile in the vague shape of large feet as he headed for the common room: His friend who was currently a vulnerable girl. As he rounded the corner and ducked into the common room, the geek stumbled to a stop.

Instead of the somewhat clinical environment he and Peter had left, the large communal room now resembled the inside of some ancient temple! There was a roaring fire in a large pit in the center, the couch and the three other lounge chairs were gone, replaced by elaborate marbled little stools and benches that were covered in lavishly colored drapes and primitive looking pillows. Jars are all sorts dotted the room, and in the center, past the currently screaming pile of women and one very confused and distressed looking oracle, was Lindsey, calming rotating what looked like a plucked chicken over the roaring fire. The only trace of Judy was the end of a scaled tail that was slowly winding it's way into the dark opening there the bathroom doors had been. Near it was the table and the game machine, untouched and modern looking as ever.

Eugene cautiously entered the transformed room, sword at the ready.

"Oh my GODS will you guys shut up!?" Peter cried, and then the weight of the six bodies pulling and pressing upon him, looking to shield him from the terrible creature that seemed rather non-plussed by it all, was too much for his legs to stand, and the entire entourage collapsed to the now straw-and-animal skinned floor with a collective girly 'OOF!'.

"CHALLENGE COMPLETE" The game buzzed, "PLAYER 2 AWARDED ONE ADDITIONAL MOVEMENT SPACE PER TURN"

"Uh, Lindsey? Judy?" Eugene approached the sweating horse-bulk that had been his crush.

"Huh? Whozzat?" The transformed sorority girl slurred, turning around clumsily, a piece of oily looking meat hanging out of her broad mouth, her red eyes dull and unfocused as they searched for the unfamiliar voice. Then they locked on Eugene before darting over to the pile of terrified looking former frat boys.

"Oh, Geeno! Yer back! Dude we can, like, totally keep playin' now!" Lindsey bellowed spewing half-chewed food everywhere as the centaur scrambled to her hooves, knocking over a large clay pot that shattered noisily. After a few uncertain steps forward and a leering smile at Peter that made Eugene's blood run hot, Lindsey made her way over and draped a smelly, hairy, sweaty arm across his shoulders.

"So get this" Lindsey burped, and Eugene waved the smell invisible ball of gas out of his face with a large hand, "So me and schales over there got s'bored when yoo guys left so we started lookin' at the game again an' I decided tuh roll!"

"Wait, what? Lindsey, you were able to roll!? But shouldn't it have been locked until Peter finished the Challenge Card?" Eugene blinked in confusion.

"Gezz so! An'way, So I rolls a 3, right? And it lands on an Akshun Skquare! And the game goes, it goes "Dion...Dee-ooh...The party god! IT goes 'The party god blesses yoo! Show yer 'preciation by throwin' a party! Then POOF all this schtuff shows up! But then it wuz jus' me an' Judy and shee was all grumpy and shit. But now yer back! And y'guys brought girls! Woo!"

The centaur gave Peter and the handmaidens a sloppy grin and a wink before bursting out into laughter despite their terrified stares.

"C'mon lez drink Geno!"

"Lindsey, you...you never get drunk!"

"Cuz you, like, dun't know me very well, heh! C'mon Geeno, les have some fun! Tis s'pposed tuh be a party skool an'ways!" The centaur let go of Eugene and stumbled back towards the fire, scooping up a small earthen jug and chugging it, dark liquid splashing over the floor as Peter and Eugene shared a VERY concerned look at each other.
111211111112111.title: Challenge Card: Complete

1112111111121111.content:
"Party? Lindsey I don't think that..." Eugene said, reaching out for the former girl, but the centaur shrugged off his grip, turning to toss the jar she'd just been chugging towards the former chubby freshman.

"Duh, Geeno! Thas yer prob'em. Yer thinkin'! T'game said party so we gots'ta party! C'mon girls!" Lindsey said, reaching over and pulling one of the handmaidens out of the pile of silky togas and frightened stares. Eugene wasn't sure which one it was, it definitely wasn't Peter or Peri, but he felt the blood thundering into his temples as the girl screamed in terror as Lindsey threw her over his shoulder.

"LINDSEY!" Eugene snapped, hand going once more to the sword on his waist. This...This was NOT cool! In fact, this didn't even seem like Lindsey! He didn't want to have to fight the girl he'd been crushing after but...Eugene took a step forward but movement out of the corner of his eye made him pause.

"HEY! LET HER GO!" Peter screeched, shoving aside the frozen handmaidens, all of them squeaking as they toppled onto one another. The former athlete rose to his tiny feet and and began stomping towards Lindsey, who was currently settling back into place next to the fire, depositing the absolutely petrified and teary eyed auburn girl roughly between between her hooves. The girl recoiled as Lindsey's large penis flopped with a thud against the floor beside her.

"Heeey Petey! C'mere, room fer another!" The inebriated sorority girl said with a phlegmy laugh, patting the scattered hay next to her. But Peter wasn't deterred, stomping on his sandals until he was in Lindsey's face, Peri scrambling wide-eyed behind him, Omphalos in her hands. the other handmaidens were cowering against themselves as they watched their mistress stand up to the horrid, disgusting creature that had taken the most sensitive of their sisterhood captive.

There was a tense moment as Lindsey simply grinned up at the scowling Peter, before the irate oracle raised a tiny hand and viciously slapped Lindsey across the face. The centaur's head snapped to the right and her red eyes went wide in surprise before she burst out into a another laugh.

"Like, Im only doin' what the game sez...toots. Can' roll 'til we party! I wasn...I wasn't gonna do nothin!" Lindsey chuckled, reaching down and wrapping an arm around Talia, who simply whimpered as she struggled to keep her composure.

"Give. Her back. Now. Lindsey" Peter said, ice in his usually pleasant (even when upset) voice. Eugene took a step forward and opened his mouth to speak but the oracular athlete stuck out a palm towards him, not breaking eye contact with the girl that had, little more than an hour ago, been half his size and more or less a stick. But now Lindsey was literally the size of a horse and even drunk had muscles that Eugene thought might give him a run for his money if he really did have to settle this.

The fire crackled and the fatty grease on the chicken popped and sizzled as the two sized each other up...And then Lindsey laughed, releasing Talia and pushing her upwards with a dismissive smack on the rear. The girl let loose a frightened sob and rushed around Lindsey's hooves towards Peter, who grabbed his handmaiden and pulled her in protectively, a hand running down the curly locks soothingly as Talia tried her best not to openly weep onto her mistress.

Lindsey stretched, all six limbs stretching outwards and joints popping like trees in deep winter, 'S'fine. Gezz we're stayin' like this then. S'not so bad really. Kinda like bein' a dude" She yawned before reaching off and tearing a drumstick off the charring chicken and scooping up another jar of what was obviously wine. "Hey Petey, lemme know if y'change yer mind in a'month. Might wanna party then!" The girl cackled before loudly taking a bite out of the chicken, grease splattering and dribbling down her beard as Peter slowly turned away and guided Talia back to her sisters, who reached out and took the traumatized girl while Peri followed dutifully behind.

The scaled tail slithered further into the cavern, disappearing from sight. Eugene gave it and Lindsey a wary look before padding over to the group of former men who were all cooing and soothing and quietly praising Peter.

"Mistress, you were so brave!"

"Truly the greatest of Apollo's chosen!"

"I knew it was going to be fine! Mistress is so fierce and strong!"

"Shut up, Koren"

"T-t-thank y-you muh-my mis-mistress!"

"Yeah. Yeah" Peter said, his quietly letting loose a breath he didn't know he was holding, casting a glance through his hair back at Lindsey, who was already draining another jar of wine. All of which seemed to be appearing out of no-where. After a moment Peter looked at Eugene, and the titanic late-teen could see the fear in his eyes.

"Pete, I uh, I gotta say that for someone with no balls, that was pretty ballsy" Eugene said, reaching out and brushing away a few stray hairs that had decided to cling to the beauty's face. Peter nuzzled against Eugene's large fingers for a moment, closing his eyes and willing his heart to stop racing...Or at least stop racing out of fear...Maybe just a few moments like this to catch his breath...

"Thanks, Geno" Peter leaned into Eugene's handa bit more. It was soft but firm and warm on his flushed and clammy face as the adrenaline drained away, "I just, I HATE guys like that. That's the reason I left my frat. Just a bunch of 'roiders getting drunk and being really rough with the girls that they'd trick back there. Just pissed me off"

"Apollo would be proud, mistress" Peri said, setting the Omphalos down, "No other priestess would have confronted such a beast for their handmaidens"

"Well I couldn't just let it happen. You girls are only here because of me. I, uh, gotta look out for my squad" Peter said, opening his eyes and giving the first of his six followers a small smile.

Peri didn't quite understand what the oracle was saying, especially 'squad', given that they were handmaidens and the farthest thing from a military unit...But she just returned the smile with a bow of her head.

"He...I mean SHE is right though" Eugene said with a hushed voice, pulling his fingers away after a moment, Peter turning to watch with more than a little regret as Eugene's fingers trailed away to rest on those popwerful, bulging knee caps, "We've got to have SOME kind of party, even if we have to fake it. Otherwise the game won't unlock"

"Well don't look at me! The only 'greek party' I know of involved getting fuckin' wasted and then puking my guts out and then ending up naked on the roof the next morning! Somehow, given that farce I had to do just to make my stupid rock work I don't think that's what the gods are looking for here. Maybe"

Eugene looked once more towards the dark, sinister looking entrance into what had been the bathrooms.

"Well, there's one person that would know. Besides, we need her to roll when the game unlocks" He said warily, and Peter followed his gaze.

"Ugh" Peter groaned as a shiver ran down his largely naked back. The last thing he wanted to think about after confronting a sloshed centaur was another monster. Even if it had been his girlfriend at some point.

"I, uh, don't think you should go with me" Eugene said as they rose to their feet. You might actually be safer out here given how mad she was at you when we left"

"Oh she wuz totally pissed!" Lindsey answered between noisy wet chomps of what remained of the chicken, which she was now eating right off the roasting spit. But before the two other players could reply she simply pointed to her pointed, furry ears. "Ima part hu-horse, 'member?"

Eugene and Peter shared a look and then a shrug. It was the least weird thing about all of this right now.

"Okay. I'll go in and get Judy. You stay out here and if, uh, 'anything' happens I'll run out and deal with it" Eugene thumbed towards Lindsey and then patted the pommel of his sword.

"Aight. I guess I can uh, try to do something out here? Maybe I just earned some karma points or something" Peter said with a hopeful shrug.

Eugene took a deep breath and nodded. Peter could take care of himself. After all, he doubted that even if Lindsey got...frisky again, she was probably too drunk to chase them very far. With a smile downwards he took off walking for the cavern opening, ignoring the wave from Lindsey as she slurped down another jar of wine, coming to a stop in a heroic pose that he didn't intend to do. He felt cool air leaking out of the darkness, and somewhere within it something tumbled, followed by a distant raspy breath. He reached into the darkness, his slab-like hand disappearing from sight near instantly. It would be next to impossible to see in there and the lair of the gorgon wasn't one that you wanted to wander into without a light...Wait.

Eugene pulled out his sword, the blade ringing and glowing as he pointed it into the darkness, the abyss giving way to a mess of broken tile, bathroom stalls as...stone?

'Well, whatever. Here we g-' Eugene thought as he took a step forward.

"GENE, WAIT!" Peter's voice rang out, and he turned to see the former linebacker practically tossing himself into Eugene's arms, a startled looking Peri stumbling behind him.

"Just...Be careful, okay? I-We can't finish this without you..." Peter cooed softly, and the smell of violets filled Eugene's nose. He lifted Peter's small chin and gazed into those big brown eyes, so full of concern, glistening as the beginnings of tears began in their corners...

"I'll be fine. It's just a gor-It's just Judy" Eugene said, and then blinked in surprise as Peter darted up and planted a soft kiss on his cheek.

"For uh, luck. Or something" Peter said, turning away to hide the deep red blush on his face why he mentally kicked himself. Why'd he do that!?

"Hey, I'm the hero. I don't need luck" Eugene chuckled, and Peter felt his knees tremble. And then Peter was gone.

11121111111211111.content:
Eugene very much wanted to close his eyes as he passed through the clearly magical barrier and into the darkness, but he fought against the cowardly impulse and soldiered ahead, his path lit only by the glowing edges of his sword (that had once been a chair leg). He stopped a few paces in and turned to look out into the common room again, waving a beffy hand at the worried stare of Peter and Peri, but the two women, one reluctant, one oblivious didn't seem to acknowledge his presence.

"Guess they can't see me..." He muttered, kicking a stray piece of water looked like a sink with his sandal, the piece of debris clattering in the dark stillness and it's echo carrying on far longer than it should have. Eugene watched as, after a few moments Peter took a deep breath, his breasts heaving, and then the somewhat imperiled athlete turned and looked around the common room, with one final glance at the cave entrance before waving a hand and striding back over towards the clustered handmaidens, Peri following dutifully (and closely after him), the former security guard casting a wide eyed look of fear backwards before quickening her own stride.

"Well, guess it's just me now" Peter said with a determined nod, and he felt a chill run down his spine as a hissing laugh began echoing all around him. He spun, sword waving wildly for any sign of his foe...Of his friend.

"It isss jussst you, hero" Judy sneered from the darkness, staring at the hero below her, her eyes fully uncovered as the ragged blindfold hung limply off her nose like a ill-fitting surgical mask, like the ones all the humans were wearing now because of the plague. Her scaled form clinging effortlessly from the stone above. Her raspy voice bounced off the walls of the former lavatory, it having altered along with the common room when the dullard horseman had landed on the action square.Both the womens and the mens bathroom had been slammed together, and the cavern had grown to consume at least the second floor bathrooms as well, giving Judy more than enough room for her lengthy body to finally stretch out to it's full extent.

As Eugene made his way slowly into her lair, the gorgon slithered along silently above, musing on her plans as she avoided the rays of Apollo's light from the magical weapon. She grinned, ducking just low enough for her fang-filled face and forked tongue to glisten in the pale light, and then darting back into the darkness as the muscled demigod turned to look, only to see more crushing darkness. Judy glanced behind her and saw a few stray pebbles lined along the edge of the small crevice. She sent them flying with a wiggle of her muscles and let loose another hissing rasp of laughter as they clattered noisely among the tuins of the bathroom below, and slithering out of sight as Eugene turned to look for her.

But then again, as nice as this cave was, it wouldn't hurt to have a little more. She just needed to figure out what to do with all the humans first. The hero would be easy, just wait until his back was turned then slither down...Afterwards she'd just claim the oracle's eyes for herself and turn all of those pretty girls into the most delightful statues. She'd position them at the doors, and if that horsebrain would listen, maybe Judy could include her in her own plans...And if now, well, she wasn't particular about her food.

Judy slid down over the edge of lip of the small ravine, poised like the snake she was, near motionless and mere inches from Eugene's face. It would be all over soon and then she'd have her justice. A whole tower to herself, to gaze out the windows and feel the warmth of Helios upon her skin. It would be a small justice for the wrongs against her, to finally not have to hide in some wet dank cave like a...like a...

Monster

Judy blinked and suddenly pulled the blindfold back up over her eyes as she realized what she was doing. The word rang in her head like a church bell, she could hear the voices behind them and even in the darkness, she could see the crying 18 year old as she sped away from a large white house in the suburbs, two judgemental, unforgiving faces glaring at her from a picket-fenced yard.

What...What was she doing!?

"Eugene! Eugene I'm right...I'm right here!" Judy cried out, slithering her bulk down into the warrior's path with a mighty crash. The geek shouted in surprise and brought the sword up to strike, his eyes clamped shut. His mighty muscles tensed as he prepared to strike.

"No wait! It'sss me! It'sss Judy! I'm...I wasss jussst playing, okay!? DON'T SSSWING!" She cried out, waving her clawed hands in the air. The snakes in her hair hissed erraticaly, slithering in every direction as they fed off the panic the goth girl was feeling.

Eugene had just begun his downward arc when the gorgon had cried out. He froze and felt the weight of the sword knock off his balance almost in complaint of his hesitation. He decided to take the risk and peeked open one eyelid by barely a centimeter, and than relaxed as he saw the blurry form of Judy stopped so low she was practically touching the ground, her hands straight up in the air in a clear gesture of surrender.

"By Hera, you scared the piss out of me, Judy!" Eugene said, lowering the sword to the ground. And it was the truth, or extremely near to it. Maybe he wasn't as good at this hero thing as he thought...Or maybe Peter's good luck kiss had some oracle magic looking over him. Either way, he was pretty sure that if the gorgon had wanted him dead, the inexperienced hero would already be gathering dust in the darkness.

"Yeah I'm sssorry about that...Don't know what came over me. But sssee! I have the blindfold on and everything!" Judy pulled herself back up to the closest thing she had to a 'sitting' position, which was rather hard to do when properly using chairs as designed was a physical impossibility for her now.

"Apology accepted. Why are you down here anyway?" Eugene said pointing at the darkness around them.

"It jussst felt...right? Like it wasss where I wasss sssupposssed to be. Plusss I couldn't take Lindsssey charging around like a minotaur in a pottery shop anymore. I think...I think sssomething isss happening to usss Eugene! More ssso than what already hasss!" Judy pointed a claw to her writhing, living hair, "I think the game isss messsssing with our brainsss!

"I haven't really noticed anything really different. I just really love this feeling of being strong though!" Eugene flexed his muscles as Judy's snakes, once again her only way to see without hurting anyone, looked on with a frown on her face. Eugene honestly didn't know what the creature was saying...And quite frankly felt like he couldn't trust her anymore anyway. He was pretty sure he'd been inches from death. He still WAS inches from death, if this was all just some clever ruse to get him to drop his guard. Plus why wouldn't he enjoy this? He could FLEX his PECS just like they Terry dude from Brooklyn 9-9 could! How could anyone not think that was cool! Especially when Peter stared at them. He eventually ceased his impromptu display of manliness with a hissing sigh of impatience from Judy. "Well, maybe you're just paranoid!"

"I am NOT paranoid! Eugene, I almossst killed you! I think your sssword isss-" Judy whined, pointing to the glowing blade.

"But you didn't. And now we're talking sooo..." Eugene trailed off. It was hard to keep his focus, staring at her scaly skin and disgustingly mobile hair, "Anyway, I came in to get you. We need to figure out how to throw a good party in the way that the gods will like it so we can keep playing the game. It's, uh, your turn next, by the way" Eugene added the last bit as an after-thought, a mild incentive to get Judy out of the cave without either killing her or knocking her out and dragging her enormous bulk back into the common room and dealing what would happen when she woke up. But Eugene knew one thing if he still had to resort to that option; definitely tie Judy up before waking her up.

The gorgon shifted her full body into what looked like a cocked head turn, "What, you guysss don't know how to throw a party? that sssoundsss lame"

"Well, shoot me or something" Eugene shrugged, "Can we get a move on? Quickly we get back to playing the game, the quicker one of us gets the wish at the end" Judy tightened his grip on the sword, and the many snake heads of Judy shifted towards the action, and then back to Eugene.

"It's not really a request" He growled.

After a moment of thought...
