“HERO! HERO COME QUICK! THE PYTHIA NEEDS YOU!” Peri’s voice echoed through the darkness, and Eugene turned away from Judy, whose threatening hisses ended with a questioning grunt as she looked up towards the mouth of the cavern, a claw pulling away from the weak binding that kept her deadly power sealed.

Demigod looked at monster, all of the previous animosity between the two vanishing as they simultaneously said “Peter!”, and began rushing upwards out of the dank underground abyss, the light of Eugene’s sword guiding his mighty strides while Judy rippled effortlessly over the maze of debris that filled the throat of the cave. And then they were out, the flickering light of the bonfire casting long shadows as they gazed upon the scene in front of them. Peter was floating slightly off the ground, arms out-stretched and his torn robe red and dripping from being doused in wine, his gods-given breasts revealed for the world (or at least the gathered players plus…’guests’). A rather sizable portion of the formerly white robe was hanging from one of Lindsey’s outstretched and gnarled hands, and the centaur herself was openly ogling Peter’s body, her massive horse-cock straight as a rod and throbbing.

But then Peter spoke, his voice once more heavily accented, but not soft and silky like it had been before. This time his voice was loud, powerful, and had a rather masculine reverb echoing off of it. His brown eyes were open wide and glowing with angry looking light, tendrils of magical, clearly divine, energy flickering out of Peter’s eyes as she glared down at Lindsey, who was clearly too drunk to be anything more than amused.

“If thou act a beast, my anger you should fear the least. So given to your craven desires you have provoked the gods’ ire. Blessed you were, and so shall stay but now no woman shall look your way. A more fitting form you’ll find for thee, perhaps a horn or two or three. Cursed you are, from friends be riven and banished, no longer will you have centaur magic. Take delight in your feotid breath, be thankful that you face not DEATH. Apollo strikes thee with his light, now cry foul heathen for his delight!”

As Peter spoke a dark cloud gathered along the common room’s ceiling, rippling with flashes of lightning and thunder. Something seemed to pass over Lindsey’s face and the drunken, leering grin faded away to uncertainty, and then out right terror as the impossible storm whipped itself into a maelstrom of thunder and lightning, a pinprick of light appearing at it’s core.

Eugene felt the urge to race across from the cavern’s opening, to tackle the possessed Peter to the ground and roll him out of danger, but a thick tail wrapped around his legs and he turned with a growl towards the Gorgon looming out of the shadows behind him.

“Let me go, Judy!” Eugene rumbled, grabbing at his friend’s coils, but then the sound and noise stopped, and Peter let loose a shriek as he dropped to the ground, the gaggle of handmaidens rushing forward and dragging their beloved mistress over to the small fort made up of hastily overturned benches and chairs and more than a few pots. Meanwhile the light continued to grow in intensity in the center of the storm before a thematic WOOSH shook the entire dorm building as an arrow of what looked to be pure light shot down from the glowing portal above the stricken sorority girl.

“AaaaAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!” Lindsey roared as her drunken form was struck squarely in the chest, and suddenly a vast pillar of fiery golden light erupted from her broad, hairy chest, growing quickly to consume her entire form as she roared and screamed in terror and pain. Eugene was suddenly VERY afraid that if the gods really did exist (because of course they did, who else would have given him all of this?) then they were smiting his former crush from existence. And without her…They couldn’t finish the game and Eugene wouldn’t get his wish! But in moments the light began to fade and the silhouette of something MUCH smaller than a centaur lay curled in the fetal position as smoke curled off it’s form and that of the scorched…tile? Stone? Eugene was sure what the floor was made out of anymore. And then with another ominous rumble, the clouds overhead rolled away to whatever nebulous realm they had come from. Which was Olympus, obviously, but Eugene didn’t bother entertaining the preposterous idea any longer as Judy pushed past him, her coils releasing the greek geek from her clutches as she slithered towards what was left of Lindsey. Eugene tromped behind the massive snake, careful of his heavy strides to not accidentally step on the gorgon and once again set off her temper. So long as the monster would play nice, Eugene would as well.

There, curled into a tight ball of smoking fur, lay a half man-half...goat looking creature that had two large horns, the ugliest face Eugene had EVER seen (and he'd seen Judy's current one) and a long, but thin, penis that hung out hard and stiff from under a poorly fitting loincloth.. The new creature was also extremely small, it's two legs bent backwards and forwards and ending in two stubby cloven hooves. In fact Eugene wasn't sure if the creature's constant erection wasn't nearly as long as the animal man was tall.It's baby-like arms and tiny hands were clutching at five long connected tubes as it spasmed and twitched in the aftermath of the divine strike. A black card that read PENALTY lay attached to it's chest.

"What...What is that?" Eugene said, pointing at it with his sword. The creature groaned as it's wrinkly eyes fluttered.

"I think...I think Lindsssey jussst turned into a sssatyr..." Judy hissed as she slithered around her former friend. 'Ssso much for a tower guardian...' Part of her mind thought. Another part of her mind suggested that the satyr was small enough that she could probably eat it in a few bites, but Judy ignored both of them.

"That's Lindsey!?" Eugene gasped in surprise, "Pete, you..." Eugene's eyes stretched wider as he realized that Peter wasn't by his side, where he belonged. The hero spun on his sandaled heel and looked at the small crowd of handmaidens as they fan and massaged the oracle, who was groaning softly, a delicate hand on his forehead while her breasts hung out, open for the world to see. He felt a twinge of something but his concern overrode his 'hero' thoughts. "Peter, what...What happened!?"

Peri looked up with worry in her eyes, "Oh hero! When you were in the cave, our mistress was trying to show up how to dance! She called it 'The Shakira Thing" and said that maybe if we all started dancing, maybe the gods would help us with the 'party' she says we need to have!" Peri frittered about, making sure the other handmaidens were doing...Whatever they were doing right. Eugene really had no idea.

"So then the Pythia is dancing, doing the most magnificent moves when all of a sudden that ghastly, beastly centaur gets up and starts dancing with her! And drinking! He was so clumsy, and now he's paid the price!" The former security guard said with a girlish grunt of feminine approval.

"Yes, but WHAT happened, Peri? I saw the light-show, and Peter didn't sound like himself!" Eugene pointed up to the ceiling, "Where did those clouds come from1?"

"Why, Apollo of course! You see, sir hero, the centaur tripped and dumped all of his wine over our fair, pure mistress! And then he laughed like he did with Talia and grabbed Apollo's Grace! And he ripped off her robe! So then..."

"So then the blue smoke came out of the rock and I turned into Super-Bitch" Peter groaned as he pushed himself upright. "Ugh, my fucking head...Is that what it's like to have a god in your brain? I, uh, think I preferred it the other way" He chuckled, wincing at the headache that had descended up his skull. But he was extremely glad that Eugene was okay, and took a little solace in the fact that Eugene was now rushing to his side and worrying about him. He gave Eugene a smile as his tiny hand disappeared inside the titan's, "And hey, you brought the gorgon back! Wonder if we can roll again?"

Peter wasn't really sure what had happened, though. One moment he was staring in outrage as Lindsey paraded around with the remains of his top, and then the next moment it was like he could see EVERYTHING. And then something spoke THROUGH him...It was definitely different from last time, when it had just felt like a compulsion this had felt like a full override. Peter had just been a passenger in his own body. And he wasn't sure what to think about that. On the one hand, magic game...But...Apollo? In his head? Oy vey.

"I'm fine, by the way" A high pitched neighing voice said, and all eyes turned to focus on the tiny creature as it staggered to it's feet, seemingly permanent erection smacking painfully against the floor and showing in the tiny man's beady eyes.

"Ugh" Every other person in the still-transformed common room groaned in disgust. One of the handmaidens...Koren? The blonde one, seemed to throw up in her mouth a little.

"What? Whaaat!?" Lindsey said, arms splayed wide.

"Lindsssey, you're a sssatyr, honey" Judy rapsed, "Sssatyrsss are the dregsss of Dionysssusss'sss court. They make crude, crasssss jokes and have to live with, um, thossse" The gorgon seemed to be the only one in the room unaffected by Lindsey's new grotesque appearance, pointing at the awkward perma-boner that was sticking out of the loincloth.

"Huh? LIKE OMG!" Lindsey cried out, spotting the ungainly appendage for the first time, "First I get one big enough to kill someone and now it's all long and hard! Why!?"

"Because you apparently insulted the gods, specifically Apollo" Peter said, not making direct eye contact with the creature, "So do you guys think this means we don't have to have a party now? Judy, can you roll?"

"Uh, let me sssee..." Judy slithered over and grabbed her green and white dice, dropping it on the game map. It came to a stop and...

Large pots that were filled with spices that were all manner of reds, yellows, oranges and browns, and even more capped pottery shaped like the ones Lindsey had been drinking from. And I'm sure he will know of others than would love to make a pilgrimage to your temple!"

Memories of stomping around these grounds, wheezing with every breath, making sure that no unamerican bas— wait, what was ‘american’? Why was not being it not bad? Why did she have vague memories of trundling around with a tummy so distended it blocked sight of her feet? She wasn’t with child!

Yet, she appended, naughtily smiling before the next memory-tsunami wiped it away.

And, for all of those concerns, why did she have a burning hatred for Psi Iota Mu Phi Sigma? Sure, they broke the rules a lot, not that she really knew what the rules were. But breaking them had to be bad, right?

And the worst of them all, Jey-rum-ee. With all of his loud music, and throwing the bathroom-paper over campus trees, and the stupid way he took care of his body and smiled dazzlingly and made her feel safe and wanted…

Perri stomped a sandalled foot again, then, with a renewed/slightly new purpose to her stride, set off to her destination once more, a shaky frown on her face.

Jeremy stretched languidly on the well-worn frat couch, groaning as heavily as he could with a gut full of pizza. His poor liver’d give out if he drank any more, so he had to drown his sorrows in greasy Italian food instead.

He met a cute girl: big plus.

She might be working for a kinda-Greek-themed maid service, judging by the gaggle of similarly toga-ed girls that had evacuated his frat: A big… grey area, actually.

She was gone: A massive, hunger-stimulating negative.

“Gonna have to run, like, ten miles to work this off,” he muttered to nobody in particular. Did you have to wear a mask when you ran? Ugh, that’d be awful—

A rapid, hope-stimulating knocking sounded on the door. Jeremy leaped up as dextrously as he could — not very — his cheese-clogged heart soaring. He practiced his smolder as he rush-lurched to the door, grasping the bronzed knob and throwing the oak slab open to reveal…

Her. The cute, no-named girl from earlier, freckle-spattered nose scrunched up, cupid-bow lips drawn into a deep frown, and balled fists placed huffily on either side of her hips…

Wait, was she mad? That wasn’t good. In his limited experience with girls — he’d only really grown into his good looks once he started playing club rugby a year and a half ago — they didn’t generally agree to, well, anything when they were mad, be it going out (or in, considering the ‘demic) for coffee, or ‘Mistress’-Jeremy threesomes.

Better start it off safe regardless. “Hey!” he ventured, spreading his arms welcomingly. “Didn’t think I’d see you again… uh, I didn’t catch your name.”

The girl screwed her ice-blue eyes into cutely-menacing slits and growled “Jey-rum-ee,” in a voice far too soft and pitchy to be intimidating.

The frat bro scratched his head. “Uhhh, didn’t think anyone’d name a girl that...” Wait, that was bad. Casting aspersions on her parents was a big no-no. “Hey, that’s my name too! Neat — oh and, uh welcome in.” The last part was hastily muttered as the girl ducked underneath his arm and entered his abode.

She made a beeline for the commons room, his nap-spot that was currently littered with beer-cans and a big, empty pizza box. It wasn’t exactly a den o’ love, and Jeremy quickly tried to smooth over her (potential) disappointment with white lies.

“Yeah, me n’ the guys had a bit of a party, earlier, heh. I was about to clean up…”

Girl-Jeremy stooped over to pick up the greasy box and aimed a harsh glare at the befuddled lad. “This is fire hazard!” she hissed.

Jeremy blinked. This was… less welcoming than before. Did he piss her off or something? Or was she just really concerned about cleanliness?

With a huff and a roll of her eyes, his bipolar crush dropped to her knees and started sweeping the cans into a pile with a thin arm, murmuring unfamiliar, foreign-sounding syllables.

Jeremy, after gawping at the deep neckline of her toga, realized that it might be a dick move to just watch someone clean up the giant mess you’ve made.

Stooping down, he reached for a beer can… right as Other-Jeremy did.

For one moment of glorious hand-contact, images of sappy-romcoms and tropey meet-cutes danced through Jeremy’s head.

Then the girl practically ripped her hand away with a mix of a grunt, squeal, and splutter while retreating to the opposite side of the room, and the frat bro desperately wanted to die.

Man, this sucked.

Peri was fairly certain that her face was hotter than Hephaestus’ forgefire right now. What was wrong with her?

Quite a lot, apparently. Two voices warred in her pretty little cranium; a loud gruff voice that insisted upon women doing women’s work and general aggression towards the befuddled boy a few feet away from her. The other part, though a tetch more positive, was equally unhelpful, consisting of inarticulate squealing over the fact that she nearly held his hand and that she should thank the gods that he remembered her.

She half-wanted to return to Mistress, to receive some sort of guidance and — oh gods, she was supposed to bring him back.

Peri chewed on her lip and risked a gaze over her shoulder. The boy seemed despondent, one arm limply batting around a beer can, head perpendicular to the lacquered boards.

‘Good,’ harrumphed a part of her head.

‘NOOOOOO!’ moaned another.

Peri, for her part, whimpered quietly and drew her head to her knees. This was haard.

"Immersive sounds like VR." Eugene said.

"I don't think this system's quite capable of that..." He hefted the controller, as if his friends couldn't see this themselves. Using the joypad, Eugene moves the selection from 'traditional', to 'immersive', which dutifully started to flash. He'd half-hoped some VR effect, or early 3D would've appeared to show them the world they were about to enter.

"Ready?" he asked his friends, as he moved the controller down to 'start'. As the selection bar hovered over the 'Start Game' option on the control menu, Lindsay shrugged, "Well, ... if it's crap, we can just move on."

A tinny rendition of some John Williams march music started piping from the speakers.

Peter nodded for Eugene to go on, his focus already on the screen. Whatever the game he didn't like to lose. Lindsay was still as unenthusiastic as ever. Painting an insincere smile on her face, prepared to endure anything to spend time with her Peter.

Wondering if he was blowing any social cool he had, a glance to Judy saw her smiling too. A broad smile as wide and genuine as his own.

"Ready!" She answered, seeing his furtive glance. She gave a quick thumbs up, before returning both her hands to the controller.

"Immersive it is." Eugene said, listening for any hesitation amongst the loose knit group.

Thumbing the button, it gave an cheap, chiming tone, the music changed to deliver a brief crescendo.

- - - - -

It was at that point that Eugene discovered quite what 'immersive' truly meant. He yelped, as the controller seemed to sting him. Looking to his hands to see if it was a short-circuit, or a spark that had caused him the pain, he saw them.

They didn't look quite right. Oddly more pixelated, his eyes darted to his friends, or rather their hands. Each of them was looking to their hands in horror, as they started to shift from crude jiggling pixels to a finer resolution, then that turned to smoke, and was drawn towards the screen.

Lindsay started to shriek and freak-out. Her elbows jerking wildly as she tried to toss the controller aside. It remained stuck to her hands, even as they disappeared, even as the effect worked rapidly up her arms. All of them were freaking out, as the pixelation reached their bodies. Only Peter was holding his breath as if about to submerge beneath the water.

Judy was whimpering a quiet prayer to herself. While Eugene was trying to work out how this was a trick.

The machine was indifferent to their reactions. All of them, as their heads turned to smoke and shot towards the screen.

Four controllers, fell unobserved to the floor, as the screams turned into electronic noise before the room fell silent.

1121.content:
After another short discussion (and another slightly futile examination of the faded text on the game's box), the four friends decided that they'd try the 'Immersive' mode for their first run.

"Just go slow for me and Pete, okay? This stuff is new to us" Judy said as she leaned took the popcorn bowl back to the common room's kitchen area. She was slightly disappointed it had vanished so fast...But then again Peter's hands were large enough to be digging buckets on construction equipment. He'd practically emptied the bowl in two scoops.

"Yeah DnD is pretty easy to pick up. Maybe it'll print out character sheets or something? I've got some spares in my room I can grab if we need them" Eugene said as he pushed the big black button that had the word IMMERSIVE stenciled on it. The button slid back into the game machine with an audible click, and there was a whirring sound that emanated from within it.

"Oooh, that sounds like an old VHS tape!" Lindsey said as she marveled at the machine. It was, like, totes tripping all of her nerd buttons. She felt an urge to grab a screwdriver and take it apart like one of her computers and see all the old gizmos inside it...But she also didn't want to ruin Eugene's game.

"IMMERSIVE MODE SELECTED. PLEASE SELECT YOUR AVATAR AND ENTER THE WORD PLAYER AND NUMBER ON THE BACK INTO THE KEYPAD. TYPE START AND PRESS ENTER TO BEGIN THE GAME" The synthetic voice squelched, and the small tray holding the four game pieces slowly rose up until the astronaut, alien, robot and rocketship pieces were within easy reach of the four students.

"Well, who wants what?" Eugene asked, pointing to the figures, "I figure if this is like DnD then they might stats or something..."

"Dibs on the rocket!" Lindsey said, plucking the small yellow ship out of the machine with two sparkling bedazzled nails, "Um, guess I'm player 4" She said after looking on the back, holding it out to show Eugene who tried to be cool about the attention his crush was giving him. The rocket really was retro styled, it was a pointy dart-like shape that had three fine near a tiny engine, and even had two ray guns sticking out the front with three little rings around each sphere topped weapon. The only thing that looked a little out of place for the time period was the small bridge that poked out from the top of the ship and its row of little yellow windows.

"Why the rocket?" Judy called from the kitchen as she fixed herself a cup of tea.

"Cuz it's sooo retro!" Lindsey yelled back, "This whole thing is so totally retro and I love it!"

"Guess I'll take the alien" Peter said, leaning forward out of the couch and gingerly grabbing the tiny green, large foreheaded alien out of the tray. The jock looked at the number printed on the back of the alien, not really giving his chosen piece a detailed inspection, "Looks like I'm player 2 Geno"

"I'll just take whatever one is left, its cool" The goth said as she readjusted her top.

Much like the other game pieces, it was retro styled. The helmet was a bubble that linked directly into a collar of a poofy spacesuit that looked like it had been pulled out of a 1950s pulp comic. On the back of the astronaut was a white number 1.

"Looks like I'm player one" He said.

Yeah but are you like, um, ready?" Lindsey said, giggling at her own joke.

"Well, I guess that means I'm the automaton" Judy said as she set her glass of tea on the table and plucked the tiny robot out of its perch. She stared at it for a moment with her dark brown eyes, the egg-shaped head with antennas sticking out from the sides, hands that topped ribbed tube like arms that stuck out from the front of the robot and its large, blocky feet. "And by process of elimination, also means I'm player 3".

"All right. Give me a second..." Eugene bent over and carefully typed in the information for each of them into the game machine. Despite the somewhat tedious nature brought on by the game's analog and primitive interface, he couldn't help but be excited. How long had it been since this game had been played? He definitely hoped it wasn't a disappointment and a waste of fifteen bucks.

"Okay, here we go!" The geek said as he typed in the word START and with a little bit of dramatic flourish, pressed the enter key on the small keyboard...And frowned as nothing happened. There was just the same whirring noise from inside the machine.

"Did...did it work?" He said, looking around the machine for a newly revealed button or some indication that it was working.

"Maybe its busted" Peter said with a yawn.

"Just give it time to, like, think, okay? Old machines are old" Lindsey offered.

"I think my dad had something old like this when he was a kid. One of the old Nintendos. He said he had to blow on it to get the dust out or something" Judy said, taking another sip of her drink.

"Wish you would have made me a glass, babe" Peter said as he watched his girlfriend swallow a mouthful of the dark liquid.

"Well you didn't ask so bleh" She said, sticking a studded tongue out of her black lipstick colored lips.

The banter, however, was cut short as the machine emitted a deafening fanfare of digitized sound, and the four friends covered their ears.

"BEGINNING STAR QUEST. ALL PLAYERS ASSUME STARTING POSITIONS" The mechanical voice boomed on top of the pulpy soundtrack.

"Need to...turn off...game" Eugene muttered as the electronic anthem carried on, growing more muffled as a ringing filled Eugene's ears. He struggled to lift himself out of the chair, but the world spun and went black as he lost conciousness.
1121.title: Immersion Mode, Avatar Selection & Beginnings

11211.content:
Cold, sharp air filled Eugene's nostrils as his mind slowly regained consciousness. He groaned and pulled himself upright as he blinked his blurry vision, bringing a hand up to his head...Only to grunt in surprise as it palmed a surface that was definitely NOT his head. Instead it was smooth and hard, and come to think of it, most of what Eugene could feel was a large amount of padding as if he was wearing a heavily insulated glove. The world finally swam into vision, and the first thing the young man saw was an arm at least twice the size of his own currently plastered to a wall of slightly reflective glass some inches away. It was like staring at the arm of a huge winter coat, and was covered in a blue suit that had white pinstriping and nodules. Eugene moved his left arm to wave, and the arm resting on the glassy surface waved.

"Oh. Oh no way!" Eugene said, his voice coming out out of a grill near the base of what he could only assume was his helmet, a harsh voice that wasn't his own. With some effort, Eugene rose to his feet and bent over and stared down at himself the best he could; the rest of his suit being the same blue as his arms and covered in straps, nodules and other doodads that looked like a mix between the astronaut suits of the early 1960s and something clearly designed for fiction.

"Dude!" He whispered. He..He was the astronaut!

Suddenly, a door to Eugene's right slide open as a tall, leggy, barely clothed woman stepped into the sparse chamber that Eugene had awoken in. It took the transformed student a moment to process that the creature he was looking at wasn't quite human, despite most of her body looking like that of a supermodel. Or a porn star. For starters, under the white and silver strips of what Eugene assumed to be cloth that barely covered her heaving breasts and hung off her wide hips and down over her crotch, her skin was entirely a shade pale green. Her face was mostly human, high cheekbones, puffy lips, a slightly upturned nose...But then the similarities stopped. Where the ears of a normal human would be were just two bony looking protrusions, sparkling silver chains hanging from each of them, and her wide black eyes that were filled with pinpricks of violet light, and her head was overall slightly swollen, her forehead riding up farther than what looked natural and two antennas stuck out prominently from her green flesh, topped with faintly glowing white orbs. Two tick...tails? Tendrils?...Tentacles? hung down off the back of her head and out from underneath a vibrant mane of hair that was rapidly shifting between bright red, white and blue.

Everests that he'd woken up with, giving one a squeeze while brushing the constantly shifting hair that was EVERYWHERE out of his eyes.

Meanwhile Eugene had finally reached the hatch that he assumed led to Lindsey's bridge. He spun the old fashioned crank latch until it unlocked with a heavy clunk and he pulled the door open with all of his strength, a creaking metallic grind ringing in his ears as it slowly swung open to reveal a room that looked like it had been ripped directly from the original Star Trek show, if only a little smaller.

"Affirmative, captain. Shall I acknowledge it? And they, like, better not shoot me! Tell them whatever they want to get us out of here sooner!" Lindsey said, playing back and forth with her 'other' self.

"Uh yeah. Yeah put it on screen. Maybe this is how it's supposed to play out?" Eugene said, making his way to the floating? Hanging? chair that he felt was HIS seat. But instead it held his weight, and the moment he seemed to settle, the wires...disappeared? He wiggled the chair and it made a soft humming sound as it hovered in the air.

'Oh cool!' He thought to himself, but he had little time to play around as the starscape that dominated the screen blinked away, and was replaced by the looming figure of an alien...that looked exactly like Peter! Only this one was clearly a male, his head was larger, bald, a pair of horns were in place of the glowing antenna and a sinister looking goatee ringed his fanged mouth as two long Fu-Manchu strands of facial hair hung from his smiling mouth...With was filled with pointy teeth. The alien was dressed in an elaborate robe of silver and white that seemed to glow in the over-saturated color of the transmission, and was partially open, revealing a body-builder physique and a chest of jet-black hair.

He pointed a silver-claw tipped four fingered hand directly at Eugene, "Now I finally get to see the vaunted hero of the so called Space Force. Remove your helmet so that I, Nuk'zar the Dread, Supreme Warlord of Jaxonia, Conqueror of the Stars may speak face to face with the famous Captain..."

"...Monica Maxwell!, so-called 'Mistress of Mars'!"

Eugene’s blood froze in his veins. “Uh, what?” he weakly mumbled.

The alien’s star-filled eyes blinked somewhat confusedly. “I-is the translation matrix faulty?” A four-fingered hand was waved someone, and a blue-skinned figure hurriedly rushed to his side, whispering into his pointed ear. “Are you not Monica Maxwell, the primary author of Mars’ legal code and key diplomat in the halt of the Kon’Traxxi invasion?” He leaned closer to the screen, peering at Eugene’s suited form before reclining back with a huff, sending his multicolored mustache aflight. “If you are not, please inform me to that fact so I may proceed with your annihilation.”

“Genie, I don’t think he’s going to keep exposition-ing forever!” hissed the tinny voice of Lindsey.

“I know!” Eugene hissed back, desperately patting his gloved hands around his helmet. “How do you get this thing off?”

“I don’t kn— On the back of your helmet’s seam, second button from the right, Captain,” The ship’s speakers stopped its buzzing for a sec, before blaring out with a harsh electronic trill that vaguely resembled a sulky moan. “This sucks.”

Eugene noticed, out of the corner of his eye, that the alien strongman had waved over the prior assistant, pointing the androgynous figure to do… something. Nuk'zar’s lips were unreadable, and whether it was because Gene was on the verge of a panic attack or the whole alien-language-thing, Eugene couldn’t tell.

His gloved hands scrambled for the back of his helmet, counting one aaand two! Anxiously, he slapped it, hoping against hope for Monica to be some sort of space-age unisex name and for ‘Mistress’ to be a coincidental alien-homophone for something else. Miserable memories of awkward cons and public-speaking faux pas chose this inopportune moment to flash into his head.

He waited for his helmet to unseal… and waited. And waited. Nothing seemed to be happening — but the way Nuk’Zar leaned eagerly forward brought Eugene pause.

He leaned forward as best he could in the bulky suit… which was easier than he was expecting. He must’ve gotten used to the suit.

No, he realized belatedly, he hadn’t, unless the chill on his legs was from an excess of comfort. Heart pounding, he leaned forward, only to choke back a scream that was rather high pitched now that his neck-speaker was seemingly disabled.

Two from the right, realized Eugene.

His bulky white suit was traveling up through a series of confusing folds, mechanical creases, and a whole lotta click-chnks that were extraordinarily upsetting to have roaming up your body. His legs were… weird, too: they were a lot less hairy, and definitely tapered more than he was used to than he remembered before.

He was even able to keep up his denial when he saw the white kitten heels, rationalizing that it was probably to prevent muscle atrophy in low-grav environments, but when it reached his hips, a sense of dread resignation engulfed the geek.

“Ship-computer-Lindsey-whatever, mute the line. Or stop video-audio feed, whatever!” he hissed, Nuk’Zar’s face twisting with indignance.

“Your disgusting primate allure aside, you cannot cut transmissions with —” was all the warlord could get out before the vast expanse of the galaxy stretched across the hull.

“Certainly, Capta—AGH GENIE YOU KNOW I HATE THAT,” moaned the compsci-major-computer.

“I’m sorry but, I’m — I’m a girl, Lindz!”

There was a period of nothing but the electric hum of the bridge before Lindsey responded. “I think that I, like, kinda knew that, but… huh.”

“What do you mean that you knew?!”

Another electronic huff escaped the crackly speakers. “It’s, like, in my computer-brain, I dunno. It’s just, uh, I’m not surprised that you’re Monica Maxwell, chief diplomat of the Sol system and ohmigodyou’restacked.”

The suit’s inexorable progress had indeed reached Gene’s chest, which was downright intimidatingly big. Maybe Judy tier. Maybe beyond Judy-tier. Gene hoped that maybe anything would look big from first-person, but the way they had just, well, bounced out was evidence of their magnitude. It also explained the spot of breathing trouble he had had.

“Ugh. Why does everything here suck,” pouted Gene in a breathy voice that he couldn’t believe belonged to some sort of senior official. He wiggled in his seat to hopefully find an angle that didn’t make his foil-latex whatever dress ride up but only succeeded in bumping his wide hips against the wire loop. “Why would you wear a dress in space!?”

“Well, Captain, Space Force research indicates that, throughout the seven currently known galaxies, that those of sex known to us as ‘Female’, generally wear garments that are more ‘flowing’ and ‘revealing’ compared to their ‘Male’ counterparts, and so a uniform embodying those aspects was promulgated amongst our female diplo—”

“Uh, you can stop, Lindz, sorry.” Gene fiddled with the neckline of his dress, trying to pull it up over the vast expanse of cleavage revealed.

“C’mon, Genie, be more careful.” whined Lindsey, “Well,” she started, with an undercurrent of simulated mischief in her voice, “I guess redheads are bitchier.”

“Wha — OH COME ON!” moaned Gene, who had finally caught the reflection of his now-clear helmet in the ship’s vast window. Waves of red curls pressed up against the edge of the dome, the hair framing a face that, at the moment, was curled up into a pout, full wide lip pushed out into a dramatic pout, wide green eyes glittering with humiliation. “Why do I look like some kinda centerfold?!”

Lindsey paused before letting out a sigh of relief. “Thank god stupid Clippy-me didn’t come back. I think that, like, we’re retro-thingies. I look like Deep Blue, Jude looks like a windup toy, Peter looks like some kinda Trek-y alien babe, and you, uh…”

“I what.” hissed Eugene, who was trying to fix his face into something that looked less alluring.

“Gawd, you’re some kinda space pin-up model, jeez.”

“That’s the opposite of comforting, Compu—” Eugene blinked away the mistake with a flutter of his long eyelashes, “—uh, Lindz.”

“You know, I was kidding about the bitch-thing, but it’s totally true,” Lindsey scowled with a bitter, electronic trill. “I’d roll my eyes if I, like, still had ‘em.”

“Look, I’m—” Eugene tried to take a deep breath to calm down, but it mostly just reminded him how tight his dress was, forcing him to doff his helmet with a hair-flick straight out of a shampoo commercial. “There’s just... I’m pretty stressed out right now.”

“Yeah, me too, Genie!” retorted Lindsey. “I’m gonna, like, dream of electric sheep — and yeah, there’s a space guy who’s pissed at us!”

Eugene paled. “Shit.”

The geek knockout took a diaphragm-centered breath to not stretch out his dress anymore, unconsciously crossed his legs at the thigh, and decided to…

All of her knowledge seemed more focused on general survivalism, and she wasn't sure how filtering the rushing water below into something safely drinkable would help her in this case. "You'll...have to try better...than that, game!" Judy sneered through the struggle of holding onto the moldy ropes as she neared the halfway point.

That was when the collapsing river bank behind her caused the bridge's supports to loosen, a sudden slack catching Judy off balance and she stumbled forward directly into a patch of weakened boards, all of which snapped and fell away underneath her body.

"OH COME O-" She howled as she tumbled into the rushing rapids, feeling the sting of the impact and the sound of water rushing up around her. Than the soaked goth was falling, landing knees first back on the starting platform, waist deep in the sucking mud.

"FUCK this game!" Judy hissed as she fought her way out of the mud, ignoring the live counter over her head as it subtracted a life, bringing her down to four. She stepped up to the even more rickety bridge and began her slow trek once more, the water now just a little bit closer and rising.

First he'd practically skipped across the first few rocks, slippery as they may have been and landed safely on the first of six different shaped boulders that sat astride the river like large fat men taking a cleansing bath. 1143.content:
In a shop that may or may not have existed, buried deep in some nearly abandoned portion of a nearly dead mall, a woman flicked her long hair as she watched the group mull over their choices through the primary security camera feed in her back office. Though the terms 'office' and 'camera feed' were a bit inaccurate, given how the woman could shift and adjust her view point with a wave of her hand, whisking it inches in front of Eugene's face without the overweight boy knowing or seeing anything. And she wasn't exactly using a TV to look through and was instead gazing into a large green portal that was projecting a live feed of the dorm's common room, all unseen and unheard. Magic was just like that, after all.

And the office could barely be called an office because it was barely larger than a normal sized closet, tiny, cramped and just large enough for the woman to sit in without losing circulation to her legs.

"Aaaaand cue the note card" She whispered quietly as she used the magic to nudge one of Peter's subconscious thoughts into the forefront of the athlete's mind. As she watched the athlete's eyes glaze over as he spoke, she pulled out a keyboard and began typing, a small smirk on her face.

---

"So if this is sports stuff, but for a game then it's gotta be like trivia, right?," Pete theorized. "I'm pretty good at that, that's why I got on the scholar bowl team back in high school, I was the sports guy. Also probably why I like hanging out with nerdies like you guys" Peter said, giving a rather dramatic and not at all serious sigh of disgust, followed by a wry grin at the bewildered look on Eugene and Lindsey's faces.

"And here I thought I was only attracted to your muscles" Judy said with a grin.

"Uh, yeah," Eugene finally got out, still flummoxed at this unexpected intellectual facet of Pete's personality. "Uh yeah I don't really see how we're supposed to actually play any sports on this besides trivia. But I wonder what it means by 'Immersive and Traditional'?"

"Traditional is probably the trivia game, Genie" Lindsey said, laying her arms and head on the table and marveling at how retro the game machine looked.

"Yeah but what about 'Immersive'? How would that even work?"

"Well we could, like, just pick it and see what happens?"

But before the group had time to discuss their options, Peter suddenly lurched up from the couch and almost mechanically walked over and lifted up the machine with his hands, grunting at the surprising weight of the old plastic and circuitry.

"Oof! This thing is a LOT heavier than it looks. How'd you cart this thing all the way home, Geno? You've got, like, no muscles and this has to be at least a hundred pounds, easy!"

"Hey! Be careful!" Eugene cried out in annoyance, but his complaint was cut short as he spied...something attached to the bottom of the game.

"Well, curiosity satisfied I guess..." Peter went to place the machine back on the table but was interrupted by a loud "WAIT!" from his rotund and unlikely friend.

"What!?"

"Dude there's something under it!"

"Ooooh, I see it too!" Lindsey chirped, and Judy un-beached herself and joined the group as they stared at the rectangular piece of...paper?

"Uh, much as I like showing off, can I set this down? It's starting to get, like, really heavy" Peter groaned as the device's weight seemed to increase with every passing second.

"Um, 'kay..." Eugene reached up and picked at the tape that covered the piece of paper for a moment before he turned and looked at the curious goth peering over Lindsey's shoulder, and then at the long purple and black nails that topped her fingers, "Uh Judy, little help?"

"My time has come" She intoned far too seriously, while Lindsey giggled at the reference. The two girls had watched Kung-Fu Panda again the other day and Lindsey had been educating the surprisingly sheltered goth on what 'memes' were. The rainblonde scooted over as Judy took her place, a look of concentration on her slightly chubby face as she picked at the sticky adhesive.

"Can you please hurry up?" Peter groaned again as his face began to turn red and sweat began to bead up on his brow.

"Silence, man-slave" Judy hissed, "Half-rations for talking back!"

Peter groaned again and Lindsey erupted into a fresh fit of giggles, while Eugene blushed and looked away from his crush's pretty face, trying not to get too turned on by her laugh, her glittering eyes and, uh, her boobs (even if they were entirely dwarfed by Judy's). A minute or two passed in silence save for the scraping sound of Judy's nails...And then a triumphant "I GOT IT!" rang out as the purple haired sophmore pulled the paper free of the game's base.

"Oh thank GOD" Peter gasped as he, somewhat violently letting the game flop back to the table with a lound CLANG. The athlete could feel his muscles burning as if he'd just spent the last few minutes in the weight room down at the sports complex on the other side of campus.

"Careful Peter!" Judy scolded her boyfriend as he collapsed backwards on the couch, wiping away the sweat on his forehead with a muscled forearm. She handed Eugene the card before she stood and joined her boyfriend back on the couch.

"There is NO way Geno carried that all the way from the mall here, that thing weighs a fuckin' ton! No, uh, offense, buddy" Peter said with a loud exhale.

"None taken" Eugene nodded, a neutral look on his face but inside he felt the sting of the accidental insult. He'd learned to tune out the insults of his weight and general lack of athleticism over the years but hearing his friend say it did hurt a little.

“Genie, what is ittttt,” whined Lindsey, sidling close and propping her elbows on Eugene’s knee — far too close for the geek’s comfort. “You’re all mysterious n’ stuff and I wanna knooooooooow.”

Judy tossed a knowing look at Peter, but the jock was staring wide-eyed up at the ceiling, his nostrils flaring as he sucked down air. The goth suddenly felt a little concerned, either Peter was far more out of shape than he looked, which could have been true given lockdown, but he still looked more than capable of lifting a video game. But before she could voice her concerns, she looked back to see Eugene handing the piece of paper to Lindsey, his face red as a beet.

“Notecard.” He mumbled as jerked his hand away from Lindsey as the two brushed fingers.

The rainblonde seemed not to notice the boy's discomfort as she pulled the card in front of her and looked at it for moment, her eyes squinting in confusion.

"Ugh just read whatever it is already" Peter whined from his position of the couch, earning him a dark look from the sorority girl before she gave a little cough to clear her throat (which sounded adorable to Judy) and began reading.

To whomever this probably concerns,
Heya! If you’re reading this now, you probably have excellent taste, or you just like looking at the bottom of random game boards, you weirdo!
So I’m supposed to keep things interesting or whatever, so I added in some more game for you! Just type 'SPORTS MODE #2, #3', etc and it'll load in some entirely new stuff!
Just give ‘em a type, I’m sure that you might maybe possibly potentially conceivably like them! Have fun!
~U.

P.S. ;)


“Did you have to read ‘winky face’?” asked Judy, a contoured eyebrow curved with doubt.

"Emotional context is important." Lindsey said VERY seriously, nodding her head slowly before another grin cracked through the facade.

“So these are, like, custom game modes?” pondered Peter as he pulled himself back up to a sitting position as his body seemed to recover. “They might be zanier than the default ones it came with?”

“I don’t remember seeing this on the box,” murmured Eugene, lost in thought. “It sounds like it'll load in different, uh, scenarios for adventure sports? The game did come pre-loaded..." Though despite walking through the logic chain Eugene was a little confused as to how much mileage they could really get out of something like sports. It wasn't his favorite topic to begin with and, well, there were only so many sports out there, right?

“We can, like, restart it if they’re boring too, so, go for it, Genie!” cheered Lindsey, pumping an enthusiastic pink-nailed fist in the air.

---

The woman grinned in her office as the group of students chatted about the turn of events. This was surprisingly more fun than what she'd been doing before. All things considered, this REALLY wasn't all that bad! She did feel a little bad about messing with reality to humiliate the jock, but she had felt like being a little mischievous with the boy, having felt a sudden spike of strange jealousy towards the boy. But now reality was restored and luckily things were proceeding fast enough that the group was already forgetting about the weirdness.

Now all she had to do, as the students reached a consensus on what to do, was wait and see if she'd had to put on a costume or not. This was going to be so much fun, and definitely sitting around with nothing to do!

12.content:
"Mystery?" Pete said incredulously, as the other three seemed to focus on that.

"Absolutely!" Judy enthused. "You know, like Hercule Poirot or Miss Marple..."

"Or Harry Dresden or Basil Argyros," Eugene added.

"Or Shaggy and Scooby Doo," Lindsey finished with a laugh. "Come on, big guy, it'll be fun."

"It'll be like Robert Downey Junior in those Sherlock Holmes movies," Judy added. "I know you liked those."

Pete saw the other three were waiting for him to make a decision, and he saw the very hopeful look in his girlfriend's eyes. With a sigh, he conceded. "Okay, we go with mystery."

122.content:
"We could do Immersive. Maybe it'll like a scavenger hunt?" Judy offered after the group had discussed the options (while Peter had more or less checked out, laying his head back and closing his eyes as he fought the urge to just go play some more Madden).

"Oooh, yeah! Like, it'll probably give us prompts as players to find items and then we type in the objects we find and it'll respond like a MUD! Oh I bet there's a procedural algorithm in there!" Lindsey said excitedly as her green eyes glittered with energy, only yo be met with a confused stare from the surprisingly sheltered goth girl.

"...What's a 'MUD'?" Judy asked slowly, suddenly unsure about suggesting immersive and feeling a bit embarassed about the technical terms that the surprisingly bright blonde was tossing out. The first thing that came to mind was going out and diving in a mud pit, and Judy definitely was NOT going to do that.

"Like what!? How can you have, like, not known about MUDs! They're SO fun!" Lindsey gasped in shock. Already the geeky, code-crusader portion of her brain was kicking into high gear, having already been stoked into activity by the retro-styled machine on the table between the four friends. But right as she was about to launch into a detailed explanation of MUDs, there was a cough from Eugene.

"It's just an old text-based computer game, Judy. It plays a lot like Dungeons and dragons but you can just type the stuff in and the game will respond on it's own"

"Oh"

Lindsey pouted as the wind was taken out of her proverbial sails. Usually she didn't mind playing the 'fool' as it helped her stay on the low end of everyone's attention, which was pretty advantageous for sneaking into places under the radar, but something about the way Eugene had just said that, she felt EXTREMELY offended and talked down at. And just when Lindsey had been getting closer to letting down her guard and letting the little fatso loser into her 'inner circle' of friends!

"Can we just play, please?" Peter groaned from the couch.

"Yeah, all this talking is, like, SO boring!" Lindsey said as she nestled back into her bean-bag, a dark look on her face, "Kinda feel like just watching a movie now. Oh, maybe we can WATCH a mystery? Maybe then you won't have to explain things for me"

Seeing the situation begin to deteriorate, Eugene quickly leaned over and typed in MYSTERY on the console's tiny and fragile looking keyboard, pressing enter and earning a shriek from Judy, who had been leaning in to inspect the machine just as two large black buttons labelled 'TRADITIONAL' and 'IMMERSIVE' popped out of the top of the machine like two pieces of toast from a toaster.

"Holy shit! Was it supposed to do that!?" Judy gasped as she flopped backwards onto the couch as Peter's head snapped upwards as he searched for the source of the disturbance.

"I...think so? I think a lot of this is analog..." Eugene muttered as he leaned in to inspect the buttons. They were large ovals, about as large as his thumbnail and made up of thick looking plastic. On the tops there were the words 'Traditional' and 'Immersive' in chipped and faded white stenciling along the top. "I guess this is how we choose?"

"Like, guess so Eugene. You seem like a pretty smart bean" Lindsey yawned with (well done) feigned disinterest as she pulled out her phone as Eugene's face fell.

"Yes, let's pick this one, Gene" Judy said, shooting Lindsey a dark look. Lindsey was pretty chill but sometimes she could get pretty pissy and petty. The goth leaned forward and pressed the 'Immersive' button, the hard plastic sinking back into the machine and locking into place as the machine began to buzz loudly like the old fax machine that had been in her dad's home office when she was little. A burning smell filled the room and Lindsey did her best to ignore anything that was happening while the others wrinkled their faces.

"Is...Is it on fire? Smells like melting plastic!" Peter grimaced as he waved a hand in front of his face while Judy just covered her face entirely.

"I don't know!" Eugene said, his eyes stinging as he moved around the device, searching for some spark of flame or trail of smoke. He really, really hoped he hand't been duped out of fifteen bucks...

But after a few moments the noise and the smell faded away, and with a mechanical clack and a DING! a small tray slid out from the side of the machine.

"SELECT AVATAR" The game blared noisily, causing Judy's hands to spring from her face to her ears.

"Why is this thing so LOUD!?" She moaned.

"Don't know. Probably because it's old or something" Lindsey said, continuing to look as disinterested as possible as she scrolled through her phone, looking at...nothing, really, as she nursed her bruised ego. As Peter, Eugene and Judy leaned in though, she flicked her green eyes upwards and caught a look of the small tray filled with bright figurines. She couldn't help but feel her curiosity begin to poke through her bad mood and she gave a dramatic sigh as she pulled herself up from the bean bag and joined her friends in inspecting the small pile of plastic.

'Must a be 3D printer...Though I've never seen one this old be this...small' The mercurial young adult thought to herself as she inspected the pile of plastic. Either this machine was not as old as it looked or whoever had made this was REALLY ahead of the curve. And the details! Lindsey's eyes wandered across the somewhat messily deposited pile of plastic as her eyes were drawn to the four figurines that were set apart by all the rest, widening at how each little character had more details than modern 3D printers were capable of doing, especially so FAST.

'Yeah, I really want to take this thing apart now' The rainblonde whispered to no one but her own mind as her eyes settled on the four figurines that were raised above the rest on tiny black spars.

A blue, classic Sherlock Holmes styled inspector, long jacket, deerstalker and crooked tobacco pipe all modeled with remarkable detail, a red figure with slicked back hair, a cape and a knife held in one hand, a yellow, skeletal figure with sharp facial features and a twin-tailed coat, and the final figurine was a green figure in what was clearly some sort of evening gown and a exquisite looking brooch above a dangerously low neckline. On the back of each character was a bright number, Blue was 1, Red was 2, Yellow was 3 and Green was 4, clearly indicating their starting position in the game. The strange thing was that there didn't seem to be any defining characteristics beyond their overall silhouettes and the defining objects.

In the pile though, Lindsey spotted a mixture of other characters, such as a gumshoe detective, a racy looking femme fatale, a fat figure with a cigar, and a short, stout looking figure with a stylish hat and a tommy gun. There were many, many others though, but in her mind she'd already come to the conclusion that whatever the pre-loaded games were, the four offered figurines were clearly meant to be played first.

"So I guess we pick one of these? Did the box say we pick a character and type in the number and press start" Peter said, reach across the table and grabbing the box, pulling it upwards and reading over the faded, scratched text, "Yeah, we just pick and play"

"Sounds simple enough. Eugene, it's your game so you choose first, okay?" Judy said with a smile.

"Well he's clearly the smartest one in the room. Just pick Sherlock Eugene" Lindsey said snidely as she leaned back in her bean bag and stared, non-plussed, at the annoyed looks on Judy and Peter's faces and ignored the hurt look on Eugene's.

"I don't see anything on here saying all FOUR players need to participate, Lindsey" The athlete hissed, crossing his muscled arms. The sorority girl just shrugged and placed her phone back in front of her face.

After a moment of tension, Judy coughed.

"Well, uh, if we're playing, let's...pick our guys?"

"Y-yeah! Yeah let's, uh, g-get started!" Eugene stammered as he eyed his muscled friend as the jock loomed over the unimpressed blonde.

"Whatever" Lindsey said, tossing her phone down on the inflated bag of beans as she reached up and swiped a piece from the tray at random. The goth, geek and jock shared a look of concern, anger and dismay as they reached up and grabbed their own pieces before Eugene quietly typed in the information into the game's tiny keyboard.

"The year is 1890. King Edward VII sits upon the throne of the British Empire, the unchallenged ruler of the world"

A female voice spoke as moonlit clouds swept by underneath, a sea of soiled white that split apart to reveal the sea of lights and smokestacks. London.

"IT is a time of great change, but also great poverty. The age of technological advancement on the cusp of a new century. Workers young and old stoke the fires of industry, Horseless carriages grow closer to realization, and great written works are published, though only the wealthy upper class are capable of reading them. The working class toils under coal and soot, living brief, violent lives while the wealthy live in luxury and ease, and the British Empire rules over India and gazes across the ocean at its lost colon,l the United States of America"

The cityscapes blurs and shifts, showing scenes of factory workers, men, women and children of all walks of life struggling to survive amid horrid working and living conditions. A immaculate palace hall filled with well dressed and well spoken members of high society, plentiful food, the luxuries of wealth. A hall of politicians squabbling and looking disdainfully at a large map showing the United States of America. The scene shifts once more, as the British inhabit the exotic palaces of far-off India while the native population is treated and seen as backwards and little more than savages in the dark and ominous jungles.

"Great ships plow the Atlantic, and the locomotive is the preferred mode of transport across vast distances of land, each with their own unique ecosystems defined by social status and financial worth. The wealth of the first class partake of fabulous meals, exquisite cabins, cigar rooms, fine brandy, even entertianment, while the lower classes are pressed together like the cattle they are seen as, suffering in silence, unheard over the sheer power wielded by the upper class"

Visions of passenger ships, colossal vessels of steel and steam cross the dark, cold Atlantic ocean, once more scenes of the impossibly rich living pleasant lives while the unwashed masses are pressed together, some never seeing the sky once on the long voyages. The roar of a passenger train as it charges down the long narrow tracks, mean and women of status sitting in comfortable chairs and sleeping in fine beds while the poor are forced upon hard wooden benches and rarely any place to sleep. The train roars past as the location changes once more.

The story shifts suddenly to a well dressed older gentleman, clearly a lord of some kind, standing in a well furnished study as he stares out a light-soaked window, a glass of whisky in one hand, a cigar in the other. On the table is a tightly bound satchel emblazoned with a personal crest similar to the one that hangs from the nearby wall. There's a sudden crash, the man turns, and his confused face contorts with fear as he cries out, a gloved hand holding a large knife plunging downwards into the old man as he falls to the floor, blood pouring out of his wounds as he reaches weakly for the satchel. The knife rises to the old man's throat and with a swift motion, slices open the wrinkled flesh and the lord goes limp. The knife clatters to the bloody floor, splashing the rapidly expanding pool of blood everywhere while the gloved hand reaches for the satchel and grabs it, the grisly scene fading to black.

"It is here our story begins, as poverty, desperation and survival begin to clash with the have-plenty's, the fortunate and the long-lived. A wealthy industrial magnate, Lord Tiberius Lochley, friend of the royal court and owner of the vast Lochely Steel company has been found victim of murder most foul. The legal details of his estate are missing, and his company, vital to the continued success of the British Crown, teeters on the verge of collapse. His heirs, Lord James Lochley and the Lady Catherine Lochly are the prime suspects after the initial investigation has uncovered precious few clues. With no known witnesses, very few clues and a race against time before the industrial hear of the British Empire collapses, you must find the last will and testament of Lord Tiberius, find his killer, and save the Empire before it is too late!"

"How about Military?" Pete suggested.

"Military? Or you serious?" Judy asked incredulously. "You mean marching around and playing soldiers? Or answering trivia questions about what battles happened where?"

"Hey, military history is pretty cool," Eugene responded. Looking at Pete, he made a motion with his right hand over his chest, then pushed his hand out. "Strength and honor."

Pete grinned as he returned the salute, repeating "Strength and honor."

Pete added, "Ready your breakfast and eat hearty." Eugene joined him as the two said in unison "For tonight we dine in hell!"

Lindsey closed her eyes as she recited:

Ō ksein', angellein Lakedaimoniois hoti tēide
keimetha, tois keinōn rhēmasi peithomenoi.

She then translated, "'Oh stranger, tell the Lacedaemonians that we lie here, obedient to their words.' It's what on the stone marking the burial mound of the Spartans who died at that battle. Or maybe the immersive game is playing Risk or Diplomacy."

It was easy to think of Lindsey as an empty headed cheerleader, or a geek girl caught up in her own world, because Lindsey seemed to enjoy floating between those two personas at random. But then Lindsey would demonstrate that she knew things that didn't involve either one of those personas.

Judy found Lindsey to be a riddle wrapped up in an enigma tortilla, then deep fried in mystery batter.

"Why don't we go with traditional?" Eugene suggested. Truth be told, he didn't want to go with sports at all. When he was a kid, he had been big in swimming, but he had gotten away with that. Plus, he never watched sports at all, and the only sports he had taken in high school was the haly year PE requirement in his junior year, which had been a struggle for him. But the group had chosen Sports (or more specifically, Pete had chosen Sports, and the girls had acquiesced), so Eugene wasn't going to fight it, Pete probably wouldn't play if the group picked another category. Plus, if Pete liked the game in sports mode, he might be inclined it later in its other modes.

"Yeah, I'm up for a little Sports Trivia," Pete said, smiling. He wiped the smile off his face when he caught Judy glaring at him. She was still a little pissed off at the way he had just made the decision for all of them.

The girls just nodded in agreement, Lindsey looking interested but Judy still irritated at Pete. Eugene typed in the word Traditional, and in response, a small drawer opened, containing four hard plastic tokens in four different shapes and colors.

"Choose your tokens, then input your choices," the game intoned

"Ha! Easy one," Pete said, reaching into the small drawer and grabbing the dark brown token shaped like a football.

"If nobody minds?" Lindsey said, reaching for the white token that looked like a pair of pom poms. Lindsey had always been a tech geek, even in high school, but she had also been a cheerleader The contradiction in her two inherent social crowds bothered a lot of people, but Lindsey seemed the thrive on it. When no one objected, Lindsey happily took the pom poms token.

With only two tokens left, Judy picked one up the yellow one that looked like a canoe paddle. A little smile lit on her face. In recent years, she had been butting heads with her conservative parents over her appearance choices. In a lot of ways, Judy was almost as conservative as her parents, But she wanted the opportunity to experiment a little. Nothing drastic. No major lifestyle changes, really. And Judy was definitely avoiding drugs and alcohol. But she didn't want to get pigeonholed either.

But no matter their arguments, the family always had its summer float trips, And for those three weeks, all familial arguments were put on hold. In Judy's eyes, those three weeks were the most wonderful time of the year.

That left Eugene with a blue marker that was shaped like the top half of a swimmer doing the American Crawl.

When Eugene was twelve, he had really been into youth competitive swimming. He had been good. He had been really good. As in, even at that age, his coaches were talking about him being in the Olympics in a few years, when he got to college.

But then disaster had struck Eugene's homelife, and he and his mother had to move out of the gated community there were living in, including the swimming league that Eugene had been in. By the time Eugene was eighteen, he was still able to go to college through a combination of scholarship, grant and savings, but his dreams of being an Olympic swimmer had disappeared years ago.

Still, Eugene secretly kept up with the sport, though he told no one that he did.

Eugene typed in everyone's names and token choices, and the game instructed, "Choose Era." The game didn't list any dates, though, but instead listed five places. The group perused the list and chose:

"Swimmers on your mark! Prepare for the two hundred meter freestyle."

The announcement caught all four players off guard, especially Eugene and Tim. Lindsey and Judy might be stuck in some weird virtual strange body, but at least they were women's bodies, and they had some prewired references.

Eugene and Pete however, were strangers in a stranger land. Eugene, at least, had played first person video games with a female character, though that was hardly proper training for being encased in a female body. Pete didn't even have that background. And Pete had another secret that was about to surface.

One of the things that all four players were about to discover was their new bodies had the muscle memories of excellent swimmers, among other abilities. When the starter gun fired, those muscle memories kicked in.

Well, almost all of the muscle memories kicked in.

Up until age thirteen, Eugene had been a competitive swimmer, and was a very good one too. If his home life hadn't fallen through, Eugene might have gone to college on a swimming scholarship. His coaches all thought Eugene could have developed into an Olympic caliber swimmer.

Unfortunately, not long after his thirteenth birthday, Eugene and his mother had to leave the house in the community with the Olympic pool and training staff. By age eighteen, Eugene and his mother, through a combination of an academic scholarship, grants, loans and savings, could afford to send Eugene to Northpoint University. But the dreams thirteen year old Eugene had once had, had long since vanished.

But somehow, when the starter gun fired, the new body and old memories meshed, and Eugene in his new body almost flew through the water. It would be an exaggeration to say Eugene finished the race before the other three even started it, but not by much.

Second place went to Judy. Judy may have not had Eugene's swimming background, but her family spent summers on the water, whether it was floating, rafting, sailing...whatever. Judy's body didn't react the way Eugene's had, but when the starter gun went off, and she saw Eugene start swimming, she followed suit. Her comfort with the water, combined with her new body's abilities, let her come in second.

Lindsey was strictly a pool party and water park swimmer. She was comfortable enough in the water, but not to the extent that Judy and Eugene were. Plus, when the starter gun had gone off, she had been examining her hands. She was sure that this was all somehow some super advanced virtual reality program, and she was trying to figure out how it worked. So it took her a couple of seconds to realize that a race had started. Plus, she was geeking at how real the water and everything felt.

Pete was never a threat, though. First, Pete couldn't swim. So even with his body's abilities, he splashed and walked around more than swam.

As soon as the four climbed out of the pool, the pool disappeared, and was replaced by a green lawn.

The four students still had the bodies they swam with, which were still dripping wet.

Eugene was still a little freaked out at being a woman, and Lindsey was still geeking out at how "real" everything felt. Judy seemed to be the one who was adjusting to this immersion experience best. She was keeping an eye on her boyfriend, though. If Eugene looked like he was freaking out, Pete looked like he was just a few steps away from going catatonic. 14222.content:
As the four tried to adjust to their new virtual reality, a beautiful brunette was walking toward them. The brunette had light olive skin, which was set off nicely by the white polo shirt and knee length tennis skirt she was wearing. The brunette had long black hair, reaching to the middle of her back, which she wore in a ponytail. Her brown eyes had a hint of laughter in them, laughter which reached the curve of her lips. She was carrying a clipboard with a whistle hanging around her neck.

As the girl got closer, Eugene suspected he'd be having a male reaction right now, if he had male equipment. Then a light went off in his head as he recognized the girl.

"Hey, you're the one who sold me this game," he said excitedly.

"Guilty as charged," the brunette answered with a girn. "How are you enjoying it so far?"

"It's awesome," Lindsey enthused. "Everything feels so real. I mean, I'll be honest, if I had designed my own avatar, I would have probably picked one that looked like me, but I don't have any imagination when it comes to gaming. But I like this avatar," she gushed, doing a pirouette. "So, this game has wifi as well as this amazing virtual reality projection?"

"Something like that," the brunette answered. "So, how did you like your introductory game?"

"Introductory game?" Judy asked.

The brunette nodded. "The easiest way to teach newcomers how the game works is to throw them off the deep end to teach them."

Lindsey laughed at the brunette's joke, and even Judy rolled her eyes. Pete was quiet, eerily quiet. Eugene's head was darting around, his arms stiffly by his side, as if he was scared about where his eyes or hands might end up on the woman's body he was inhabiting.

"So, um," Eugene began, "Will we be playing in these bodies for the entire game?"

"That's what I came to talk to you about. It's why I also froze your boyfriend's avatar while I'm here," the brunette told Judy. "He's a little excitable."

"I think it's having to play a woman avatar, and from what I've seen, it's kind of too realistic for both him and Eugene," Judy said, nodding toward both of the "guys." "And I'll admit, it was kind of funny at first. Pete can be kind of a sexist at times. But I think with how real all this is, and Pete having a problem with water, and well, maybe you could let the guys have guy characters for the rest of this game."

"Yeah, about that," the brunette began. "Let me start by explaining how the game works."

"First, there's the introductory scenario," the brunette continued. "That's where you got introduced to how the game works. Next there will be five tutorial scenarios. In all of these, you'll get a chance to win bonuses as you compete against each other. Maybe even some bonuses that you can take into the real world. Who knows? There'll be some penalties, but nothing bad. More laugh worthy than anything else," the brunette said with a chuckle.

"What's the main game?" Lindsey asked.

"It'll be a series of challenges with other athletes, not just among yourselves," the brunette explained. "The series of challenges will culminate with one big challenge. One of you will need to win that challenge and, at the end of the big challenge, all of you still in the game will need to shout Morphmanji to officially end the game. And whoever wins that last big challenge will get a special reward that will be explained to them at the time."

"Whoa, wait a minute," Eugene interrupted. "What do you mean, still in the game? Can we be knocked out?" Most of the sports related video games Eugene had ever played just went from one event to another. They weren't like other video games, where your character could be killed.

"When you get past the tutorial and to the main game, you'll be given five lives," the brunette answered. "If you fail in a particularly spectacular way, you lose a life."

"What happens if you lose all five lives?" Lindsey asked.

"Let's not get ahead of ourselves, shall we?" the brunette said evasively. "Anyway, I'm here to hand out the rewards for your first competition."

The brunette placed a gold medal on a blue ribbon around Eugene's neck. As soon as it touched Eugene's neck, the medal disappeared, and Eugene transformed back into himself. Actually, it was a version of Eugene, if Eugene had never stopped swimming six years ago. Eugene now had unusually broad shoulders and a wide back, and had the lines of a strong swimmer.

"Your reward for coming in first is that you get to keep this body at least through all the tutorial games, as well as through the first event of the main game. After that..." the brunette shrugged. "Depends on how you do in the main game. But there is a chance that you can take this body back to the real world."

"How can a video game do that?" Eugene asked, touching his face. It took all his willpower not to look inside the swim trunks that had appeared when he got a male body. But he could feel his regular "equipment" was back, and he never felt better.

"Does this feel like a regular game to you?" the brunette asked. Standing in front of Judy, she said, "I'll get back to you in a second."

The brunette produced a bronze medallion on a blue ribbon and placed it around Lindsey's neck. Lindsey turned back into herself. Well, an enhanced version of herself. Lindsey had kept herself in good shape, but her rainbow colored hair had turned back to its original blonde. Lindsey's hair now reached to her waist. Lindsey's breast, though still firm, had increased in size. Lindsey was now wearing a red one piece swimsuit and, looking down, she now knew what it have must been like to be Pamela Anderson in her Baywatch days.

"So you'll have this body for at least the next two tutorial games," the brunette told Lindsey,"And if you get a new body, it won't have a male "equipment." There won't be a possibility of that happening until you get to the main game."

"Bad news and bad news for you, sport," the brunette said, turning to Pete. "You have to keep that body for at least the next two tutorial rounds, and you won't get a chance at a male body until the main game begins."

Pete was unable to move or respond, but his eyes stared daggers at the brunette.

"And finally," the brunette said, turning to Judy, "I can let you keep your new body through the tutorial games, or you can get your regular body, just enhanced, like your friend Lindsey got. And you can keep your enhanced regular body through at least two tutorial games, and not have to worry about getting a male body until the main games start. Your choice."

The brunette pulled out a silver medal on a blue ribbon, but waited for Judy to make her decision before placing it around Judy's neck. Judy thought about if for a few minutes before deciding to

Judy really wanted to get Pete to his old body, or at least a male body. It had been funny watching him have to use a female body in this game. A very realistic female body, if her own experiences were anything to judge by. But she could tell the whole thing was freaking him out to the point it wasn't funny anymore, especially since he seemed frozen in place right now.

"I'd like to get my own body," Judy told the brunette. None of this was real, Judy told herself, even though it sure felt real. But she was curious what her "optimized" body would look like, at least in the games' eyes. Judy didn't consider herself in bad shape. But she had to admit, she could afford to lose a couple of pounds and do some conditioning. Maybe having the game show her the best version of herself would be inspiration enough for Judy to get herself into shape once she got back to the real world.

Judy found herself wearing a red, Baywatch style one piece swimsuit, just like Lindsey was wearing. She also found her hair and changed to its natural auburn color and was now long enough that it hung down to her breasts. Thankfully, at least in Judy's mind, her breasts were their normal DD cup size. But she could tell they were firmer, as was all of her body. The little pooch on her stomach that Judy had been carrying around since her freshman year was gone. So was the little chinese symbol she had had tattooed on the spot between her left thumb and forefinger. In fact, Judy noticed all her tattoos and piercing were gone even both pairs in her ears.

Judy was about to ask the brunette to reconsider letting Pete at least have a male body, when she noticed the brunette disappeared.
