15243.title: More Simulation Options.

152431.content:
"Let's do the Pet one! Pleeeeease?" Judy said with fake puppy dog eyes.

"I don't want to play in some weird pet store! I already HAVE a dog. Or did. Mom and dad didn't really tell me what they were going to with Arisdogle when they were going on the trip."

"Aris...dogle" Eugene said while Lindsey face lit up with a barely constrained fit of giggles.

"Yeah, you know, the famous philosopher? Ari barks and whines a lot when you talk to her so we figured it was a great name. Plus, you know, Greek heritage and all that" Peter said matter-of-factly.

"Wait so you named a GIRL dog after a male philosopher?" Judy turned to look at her boyfriend, giving the jock a incredulous look before her brow scrunched in sudden realization, "Wait, so not only is the dog the wrong gender for the name but because SHE talks a lot? I feel like Lindsey and I should be insulted, Peter"

The athlete's eyes opened wise as he realized the mistake.

"Huh? Oh. OH. Uh, dad was, uh the one who gave her the name! IT WASN'T ME AHHHH" Peter yelled in mock horror as Judy clubbed him with one of the couch pillows. The silly exchange was all Lindsey needed to lose what little composure she had as she collapsed into a fit of high pitched giggling as she fell to her knees and leaned against Eugene, who imply blushed and looked away.

After the laughter had died down and Lindsey had taken a few breaths to calm the approaching hiccups, the group decided to take a vote, with Eugene abstaining as he didn't like either choice.

"All in favor of the Pet option?" Eugene asked, and watched as Judy and Lindsey's hands shot up, "All opposed?"

Peter raised his hand in defeat.

"Pets have it then. Okay, here we go..." Eugene gave Peter a conciliatory look and began typing in the command on the game machine's keyboard, pressing 'Enter', and then leaning back in surprise as two large black buttons popped out of the top of the machine's plastic casing.

"CHOOSE GAME MODE" The machine's synthetic voice blared.

"Oooh!" Lindsey said, leaning in to look at the intriguingly unique device and the two new buttons that read 'Traditional' and 'Immersive' on the tops in chipped white stenciling, "I, um, guess these like determine what mode we play in?"

"Obviously. Oof!" Peter said with a scoff, earning him a elbow to the ribs from the big breasted girl sitting next to him.

"Is there anything telling us what each one is like, Gene?" Judy asked, giving Peter a 'you earned that' stare before putting on her (drilled into her since birth) pleasant smile.

The flabby dork looked across the machine and then at the game's box, "No, just the rules from before. Traditional sounds like a normal board game and Immersive sounds like a tabletop game or something"

"I do think that would be easier for me and Pete...But I also really, really wanna see some cute puppies!" Judy's green eyes were sparkling in anticipation. She LOVED dogs.

"Well, let's vote again? That, like, seems to be a good way to solve things, right?" Lindsey looked at the group, returning her blank stare of sudden disillusionment before their faces became animated again.

"Yeah, let's vote"

The group polled themselves and it was decided that they would play in...

1524312.content:
"Immersive it is!" Eugene said after the unanimous tally. Everyone seemed eager to please Judy, the cheery and polite goth almost never tried to impose her will over anyone on most things of this matter and was very much went with the flow, so while Peter was clearly locked into voting as the supportive boyfriend, Lindsey and Eugene shared a look and a nod. Why not do something nice for their friend?

So Eugene reached over and depressed the large black button, feeling resistance from the spring underneath as he pushed it back down into the compartment it had popped out of. There was a loud CLICK as the button locked in place, and then the machine began making a loud 'honey the dryer is off-balance' clattering.

There really wasn't any room for it in her new tiny dorm room (which the CompSci major thought was cozy, but she definitely missed the GURL house's less utilitarian aesthetic.

As if on cue, the clattering stopped and a tray full of small, primary colored plastic figures popped out of the side of the game machine.

"CHOOSE AVATAR" The game intoned, and the four students leaned in to see...

15243121.title: Animals Avatars.

choices: Eugene tries his best to get adopted.
152431211.content:
With the girls having already called dibs on their animals, Peter and Eugene gave each other a look, the two boys shrugging with indifference as they selected their tokens: Eugene went with the blue cat (his preferred animal but allergies for both himself and his mom prevented them from ever having a one) and Peter pocketed the green fish.

"Glub glub" He said jokingly, making a fish-face at Judy and went in for a kiss, who groaned dramatically and pushed his handsome face away.

"INPUT PLAYER ORDER. PRESS ENTER TO BEGIN GAME" The game ordered, the tiny screen and red bulbs blinking in an almost impatient manner.

"We all good?" Eugene asked, receiving three nods in agreement, "Okay, just a second..." Eugene's fingers poked carefully across the tiny keyboard as he entered in the information, and with a mighty flourish, pressed enter.

He barely had time to yell as color drained from his vision and everything went black.

_

The smell was the first thing that indicated that Eugene was conscious again, a barrage of...everything assaulting his nose, as he flailed around wildly as he suddenly became HYPER-aware of his body and the immediate surroundings. His eyes snapped open and he let out a low groan at the brightness, flicking his tail in annoyance as-

Wait. What tail!?

Eugene let out a yowl as he turned to see a long black tail rising out of his horizontally aligned back, swishing this way and that, twitching and wiggling.

'Oh no. Oh no oh no oh no' He chittered to himself, looking at the rest of his elongated body and suddenly aware he was standing on all fours. There was a movement nearby and he whipped his head towards it...And there, in a pane of holed plastic was the dull reflection of the face of a black cat, pointy ears, wide green eyes and whiskers.

'I'M A CAT!' He wailed, and his tiny fanged mouth opened as a long, deep growl escaped from his throat. Then something BIG passed by the plastic, and Eugene scrambled backwards, flopping over himself in terror as the massive face of an older woman looked in on him, concern in her eyes. Her overly-lipsticked mouth was saying something...But it was all garbled to Eugene. He got the distinct impression that the woman was talking to him...But maybe since he was now an animal, he couldn't understand? That was a common misconception that many pet owners often did, assuming their pets could understand them when in reality it was nothing but gibberish. At best most pets could put together a handful of words associated with actions and positive reinforcement, but there was no real possible way to overcome the language barrier.

'Wait, how...How do I know that? I've never owned a pet!' Eugene said, looking around the small cage in confusion. But before he could get any sort of answer, the cage door was opening and a huge hand was curling in, fingers the size of logs grabbing hold of him and beginning to pull him out. As he struggled, he caught a glance at five...wait, NINE horizontal stripes on his left front leg, radiating up from his...paw.

'Wait WAIT WAIT!' Eugene cried out in a pitiful meow, and he flexed his claws as he struggled to find purchase on anything...But out he came into a MUCH louder, brighter world. The giant woman man-handled his furry body and tucked him securely in her arms, stroking and cooing strange words at him as Eugene was transported from the small, noisy holding area in what was either the back room of a pet store, or possibly a animal shelter...And just as quickly deposited him into a larger room that was filled with seven other cats and a hoard of toys, cat trees, litter boxes and food and water bowls. Beyond a huge glass wall were dozens other humans, some with children, some young students like himself, a couple of old folks. And all of them were staring at him.

Another cat, an attractive orange and white tabby sidled up next to him and sat on all fours, whisking a tail around his shaking legs as it leaned it's head in for a nuzzle.

"Hey, Eugene" A familiar, but decidedly FEMALE voice said softly, and Eugene turned his head towards the other cats, ears laying back against his streamlined head.

"YOU! You're...You're the girl from the store! How-why-what...who" Eugene babbled, and he was distinctly aware that the people on the other side of the wall were pointing at the two of them and talking excitedly among each other.

"That's me! Before you flip out, let me explain what is happening. You're indeed inside the video game! Pretty cool, huh? And you're a cat so that's, like, extra cool!" The girl-cat playfully batted at Eugene, who leaned away.

"Oh, don't be so dramatic. It's easy! Like SUPER easy, easier than the other games you could have chosen! Right now you're in..." The tabby paused her chattering for a moment and looked around at the ceiling in thought, "Let's just call this the tutorial, okay? All you gotta do right now is get adopted to get out into the main take world"

"What!? No! Change me-" Eugene began yowling, but then a thought crossed his mind, "W-wait, where are my friends!?"

"Oh don't worry, I'm giving them the same spiel right now. Lindsey is on the other side of the store in the bird section, Judy is in the dog section, and Peter is in one of the fish tanks. You get bonus points if you can all get adopted together but..." The orange tabby gave the cat equivalent of a smirk and turned away, brushing her long, floofy tail across Eugene's face, sending his new extra sensors in his whiskers sparking off.

"How...How do we out? How do we change back!?" Eugene attempted to press the very strange and probably magical (or possibly technological) entity for more information, but she let out a chuckle that sounded like a very loud purr.

"You know they say about curiosity and cats, sweetheart. I don't do spoilers, but here's tip: Try not to be the last one here by closing time. And when or if you get out of here, you'll know the game objectives when you hear them. Complete those and you rejoin the human race." And with that the human qualities of the cat disappeared, and the orange tabby scampered off, darting towards one of the many bowls of food on the other side of the cat filled area.

'Hey WAIT' Eugene called out, but there was something in him that said whoever the girl was...Or WHATEVER she was, was gone and nothing but a cat remained.

Eugene looked up at the wall of humans, which had turned their gazes towards other, more active and 'cute' cats roaming the area.

"Fuck"
152431211.title: Eugene: Cat, Judy: Dog, Lindsey: Bird, Peter: Fish

Door 2: Learning How To Handle Responsibility
1524313.content:
The group was about to vote on whether or not to play the Pet simulation in either Traditional or Immersive mode when Eugene spotted the small screen on the side of the game's console blinking slowly.

"Wait, hold up" The geek said, peering in close to read what was being spelled out across the wall of tiny red bulbs behind the dark plastic.

"Whatcha doin' Genie?" Lindsey asked, wiggling around and peering in over Eugene's shoulder and causing the dork to stammer a nervous non-explanation, "Huh, I wonder what 'Hybrid Mode' is?"

Judy and Peter looked at each other. Judy REALLY wanted to see if the game was like Nintendogs...But honestly at this point the amount of technical mumbo-jumbo and ALL of the different options the game was providing was starting to get a little too much, even for the normally patient goth. She stifled a companion yawn to Peter's own, if this didn't start going anywhere soon, well, there were other things that the couple could be doing. It was fun trying to ship Lindsey and Eugene but at this point she felt like they could possibly just leave and let the two be nerds over the analog monstrosity that was sitting on the common room's table. But she didn't want to give up just yet.

"Eugene, did the rules say anything about this 'Hybrid Mode'?" Judy offered, trying to be helpful before her patience ran out, pointing a purple tipped fingernail towards the equally huge box the game had come in.

The overweight general studies focused nerd followed Judy's finger and gaze over to the box, and after a moment of just staring at it, suddenly realized what his top-heavy friend was trying to get him to do. "Uh, let me check".

The box itself was largely empty and blank, the only part that seemed to have any print was the underside of the box lid where the rules for the Traditional and Immersive modes were printed...But near the bottom, past the scratched and faded part was a tiny section that Eugene wasn't entirely sure had been there when he had first opened the box. But nevertheless he flipped the box over into the light, squinted his eyes and began reading.

"Hybrid Mode: Some game types come with a Hybrid Mode option. Hybrid Mode combines aspects of both Traditional and Immersive modes together. Hybrid Mode requires a minimum of two players, to a maximum of four. Players will be placed on different teams and must work together in order to advance through the game." Eugene squinted as the next part was damaged by fading and a small strip of torn cardboard.

It was odd that while the machine itself looked more or less pristine, the box had sustained so much wear and tear. Especially, if the woman at the store was to be believed (Eugene had summarized most of the encounter), that the game had simply been 'waiting many years for someone like him to come along'. And mice didn't cause this kind of damage.

After a moment he pieced together as much as he could from the damaged text before speaking again, "Uh, it says something along the lines of 'all players will be immersed but still require dice rolls to move through the scenario and by completing actions and challenges. Everything else in that section is missing...But I guess each Hybrid Mode will also have it's own special rules pertaining to the scenario? I just have to type in 'Hybrid Mode Start' instead of pressing one of those buttons.

"Can we not just play? Seriously? What is with all these rules and modes? Whatever happened to just 'roll the dice and get to the end first'?" Peter said as pulled himself to his feet, "Geno, I really was interested in this, but I don't think game night is supposed to take thirty minutes of reading the rules. I'm out."

Peter turned to walk away and Judy gave Eugene a sympathetic look as she too rose from the couch and followed her boyfriend, "Sorry Eugene but...This sounded like a lot more fun than just listening to you read off a bunch of technical rule stuff"

"Hey! Wait, guys c'mon don't go! Let's just, uh..." Eugene's worries shifted from the game's suspicious damage and obfuscation of the rules to keeping the couple from bailing. He jumped out of his chair and chased after the muscled athlete and the big breasted goth.

Meanwhile Lindsey simply watched the exchange and, in an effort to stave off her own boredom, cure her own curiosity about the machine AND help Eugene from suffering from a social embarassment, slid quietly into Eugene's former spot and quickly typed in 'Hybrid Mode 4 Player Start' on the game's tiny keypad and pressed Enter.

The machine let loose a loud metallic CLANG and began buzzing, and Lindsey felt her head start to become woozy as the world began to spin. NEar the common room doors Judy, Peter and Eugene began to sway on their feet, Judy leaning into Peter, who slid up against the wall, and Eugene who was trying to prop himself up in the door way and failing. As darkness and buzzing over-took Lindsey, she watched as the other three students slowly collapsed to the floor. And then there was nothing.

_

Judy snapped open her eyes in alarm and pulled herself off of Peter, who was shaking his head and groaning groggily. Judy's own head was swimming, feeling not unlike the pressure of a migraine, but was Eugene heaved his significant bulk back onto his feet, the top heavy goth suddenly realized something.

Instead of the common room, they were in a seemingly empty black room. The walls, lights, doors, the furniture, all of it was gone!

"Ohmygod!" She whispered, whipping her head in every direction and fighting off the urge to be sick. But the wave of discomfort was already fading in her head, and she spied Lindsey splayed out spread eagle on the floor behind them. Judy hustled over, suddenly VERY afraid of just dropping off into nothing like the scene in Indiana Jones & The Last Crusade with the optical illusion bridge near the end of the film, but she made it to the rainbow haired girl's location and let loose a sigh of relief as she was still breathing, half-lidded eyes staring up into nothing.

"That was a bad idea" Lindsey muttered as Judy's fierce-but-in-a-cute-way face filled her vision. Her friend's brown eyes scrunched in confusion.

"What was a bad idea? Lindz, where are we!?" Judy said, helping the stickly girl up into a sitting position and receiving a guilty, sheepish grin in return.

"I, um, kinda started the game. Don't be mad! I just, like, really wanted us to have a game night as you guys were like, totally bailing!" As her senses returned so did Lindsey's valley girl accent and over-use of the word 'like'. She hoped she hadn't lapsed out of it too much.

"Well that's just typical, leave it to Legally Blonde to get us all in trouble!" Peter fumed as he stomped over, Eugene in tow, "Where the FUCK are we? Where's the dorm!?"

Lindsey had nothing to offer but a shrug, but before the athlete's reddening face could explode in further anger, there was a synthetic chime as several larger doorways appeared...Along with a curvy woman of Mediterranean descent walking out of the darkness between each white void.

"Wait, you're...You're the girl from the shop!" Eugene cried out in realization. And it really was, only she looked MUCH prettier than in the soft-blue work polo and khakis he'd seen her in before. She had rocked those but now she was wearing a deep green dress that shimmered and shined from some unknown light, looking like someone had managed to turn a jade jewel into a knockout piece of curve hugging fabric.

https://i.imgur.com/vteiocY.jpg

"That's right, Eugene. And thank you, Lindsey, I was afraid that nothing was actually going to happen! You go girl!" The woman gave Lindsey a thumbs up and a wink, which the rainblonde couldn't help but return with a small, nervous smile as the woman strutted forward until she stood in the middle of the small group.

"I'm gonna make this quick and simple, okay? You're all IN the game, which is magical. You chose the Hybrid Mode, but...this particular game doesn't let you pick your avatars or tokens. See those white doors?" The woman turned and pointed a green-tipped nail towards the gaping white voids, "When I leave, you're going to have to walk through one of them. Whichever one you chose is the game you get, and you'll be assigned random roles. Two of you will roll for progression and get actions and challenge cards at random, the other two will have to complete objectives to advance, but you're all on the same team. At least to start with, things can happen, who knows where it will go? Finish the game and you get to go back to your dorm. Or you can stay here if you like"

"Wait, so if we don't play...We're trapped here forever" Judy's eyes went wide in fear as she realized the predicament they were in.

"That's what I said, honey" The woman gave Judy a shrug before turning back and focusing on Eugene, "And when, or if you get out, come see me at the shop. All of you. And bring the game"

And then wink another wink at Lindsey, the woman disappeared in a flash of green sparkles.

"Holy shit" Peter said, breaking the stunned silence.

"Looks...looks like we've got to play" Eugene said after moment of collecting his thoughts, waddling past the group to inspect the small forest of what the woman had called 'doors'.

"But which one do we choose?" He whispered.
1524313.title: Pet Simulator: Hybrid Mode

15243131.content:
"To hell with that! I'm NOT walking towards ANY light!" Peter roared, angry that not only had his night been ruined by all of this...Whatever the HELL this was, but he was now trapped in an endless void, taking very little comfort that he was with his girlfriend and the two nerds.

"It's the only way out! You, like, heard the lady! This is all magic!" Lindsey said, rising to her feet, only to let out a small 'eep!' when Peter charged on her, shoving a finger into her face.

"Don't you dare say a word, Lindsey! This is YOUR FAULT!" Peter's face grew even redder as Judy attempted to pull her boyfriend away from the wide-eyed blonde, even if she was feeling particularly angry towards the other girl at the moment. Peter was entirely right...But getting angry wouldn't solve anything.

"Pete, babe just, let's go over here for a minute, okay" She said, sliding her hand into Peter's and pulling the athlete, who was still staring daggers at Lindsey, away from the geeks of the group.

"I'm sorry..." Lindsey whimpered. She was feeling awful, if she knew this was what was going to happen, she would have never started the game! And now Peter hated her (which was...okay since Peter was a bit of a jerk to her anyway) and Judy was pissed (which was what she regretted most, as Lindsey considered Judy to be a really good and supportive friend, even if she was a bit...weirdly sheltered for her goth getup). She turned towards Eugene, expecting something similar to whack her in the face...Only to find the other freshman studiously inspecting the white portals.

"Eugene?" She said, taking a cautious step closer to the her friend.

"They're right...But at the same time, this is really cool" The chubby young adult said with a slight smile. Sure, this was crazy and scary and weird...But he was far more thrilled with the aspect of being IN a video game, even if it was magic. He was GOOD at video games, and so was Lindsey. Outside of carrying Peter and Judy, and more Judy because while Peter really only played sports game the athlete wasn't...too terrible at shooters like the older (and superior) Halo games whenever the two boys would hang out in Eugene's room...This might not be as scary as it had first appeared.

"You're not mad?" Lindsey's eyes glittered with what she, well, hoped was not false hope that at least someone here in this fascinating, terrifying place wasn't going to make her feel like shit for her attempt at saving Game Night.

"Well, I don't think this was the BEST thing to do...But you had no way of knowing, right? None of us did. And, uh, it's sort of partially my fault for buying the game in the first place right? So me and you, I guess that, uh, make us partners in crime" Eugene realized the awkward implication of what he was saying as he said it, his voice dropping off to nearly nothing a moment too late as Lindsey's face split into a more familiar wide grin.

"GENIE!" Lindsey cheered, wrapping her arms around her fellow fat freshman and pulling him into a surprisingly tight hug, completely abandoning the teasing she had been doing earlier because she liked making boys uncomfortable, "Thank you! This makes me feel, like, SO much better!"

"Uhsureanythingyou'rewelcome" Eugene mumbled, looking away as he both enjoyed and desperately wanted the moment to end before he ruined it with an awkward boner or something. After a few more seconds the blonde released him, and gave him a soft tap on the shoulder, smiling all the while. Judy and Peter, both of them looking no less annoyed or angry, finally returned to join the two in front of the various 'doors', as the strange woman had called them.

"So that crazy bitch said the only way out is by beating the game, right?" Peter gave Lindsey one final glare before turning his gaze to the white portals, "So let's just pick one and get this over with"

"Yeah but which one do we choose? They don't have names..." Eugene said, scratching his head. This seemed like some kind of level selection...Though with everything blank there was no telling if these were all connected levels or if each one was it's own separate scenario to play through. And what about difficulty? Did the game even have that? Would they end up in some kind of animal themed version of, like Dark Souls or would it be more like Animal Crossing?

"Then I guess we'll just have to pick one. Since impulsive bad decisions seem to be today's theme" Judy said, with a pointed look at Lindsey, who looked away from the passive-aggressive girl, "I'm just picking this one"

And before anyone could stop her, Judy took a deep breath and marched into the nearest portal.

"JUDY, WAIT!" Peter yelled, darting after her and vanishing, like his girlfriend, into the white nothingness. Eugene and Lindsey looked at each other in surprise, and then then looked away as the other doors all vanished in a blink of light, leaving only one entrance into the game world.

"Guess I was right" Eugene muttered, and to Lindsey's questioning look, quickly explained his theory on the doors being some kind of scenario selection screen. The other gamer nodded in understanding and, after steeling herself, held out a hand towards Eugene.

"I'm scared...But it's the only way we get out of here. Let's do this Eugene!" The rainblonde said, as she mustered up the rest of her courage.

And Eugene, despite the fact that he too was nervous and scared (though not by the potentiality of death but of holding Lindsey's hand) took the outstretched limb with his own, felt Lindsey give it a squeeze, and together they walked into the light. They vanished from the strange black void and rematerialized within a empty, very new looking house that was filled with cardboard boxes, no furniture, and that there was a moving truck outside.

That was when the four friends spotted each other once more, and Eugene realized that...

152431311.content:
As the new world swam into focus, Eugene immediately noticed that they were no longer in the black 'level select' void...Nor were they back in the dorm. Instead he was standing in the foyer of clearly new house. It was small, but comfortably so. There was a flight of stairs that headed upwards to a small landing with three doors, while openings on either side led to two empty rooms, one of which connected to what looked like the kitchen. There was a partially open door at the end of the foyer, a bathroom, and there appeared to be a door on the stairs as well, though it was closed and either led to a closet or a basement.

The walls of the house were bright white, unadorned by any paint or pictures, and indeed the entire house was empty save for a forest of cardboard boxes of varying size that had 'Kitchen', 'Living Room', 'Bathroom', etc written on them with heavy black marker. There was a small couch that looked slightly threadbare sitting in what he could only assume was supposed to be the living room, looking more like it had simply been tossed in there instead of carefully placed. Out of one of the windows he could see that wherever this house was, it was in a suburb or possibly a gated community, and there was a large moving truck parked in front of what looked like a two car garage.

All in all, it was a pretty decent house, much better than his cramped dorm room or the tiny apartment that Eugene and his mom had shared for years before he'd gone off to college.

But as his visual inspection of the local area had ended, Eugene was aware of two furry creatures in front of him. One was a almost glowingly gold-furred retriever, dark brown eyes wide, ears raised and it's dark nose wet as it's head twisted and turned in every direction as the dog took in the new environment.

Next to the dog was a large, almost fat black and white catthat was in an equal state of observation and distress, it's smaller ears pressed flat and back agaisnt it's skull, tiny fanged mouth agape and it's deep green eyes wider than Eugene had thought possibly as a cable-like tail twitched and wiggled as the cat was clearly attempting to not be overwhelmed.

Both animals had an equal chance of being either Peter, Judy or Lindsey.

"The lady did say things would be randomized..." Eugene said, but then his own eyes went wide and a hand flew to his mouth as he discovered that he was...

He slowly pulled his hand away from his mouth and stared, still wide-eyed, at how small and thin his hand was, the longer, pink-tipped nails topping his tanned fingers...One of which had a god ring wrapped around it.

His gaze traveled up his slender arm... And the he noticed the long brown hair draping into his vision, something he hadn't noticed at first because his original hair had been getting long since all the barbers had closed down because of the lockdown. He pulled at the hair with his new hands, noticing that it was long, silky, and fell past his shoulders. Someting pulled at his earlobes and he released his hair, reaching up to feel a large hoop earring hanging from his ear. The feeling was, on top of everything else, extremely weird. He'd never had his ears pierced, for one he had no interest...And also because his mom had never let him. Eugene followed the waterfall of hair downwards and spotted, for the first time, the small canyon of cleavage that stuck out from his chest, covered in a light blue shirt, some kind of blouse. He gave his breasts a exploratory poke and was somewhat surprised they didn't, well, jiggle like he thought they would. Over-all he probably would have guessed that his new breasts were decidedly average, and something about that made him a little sad.

His exploration traveled further south, past wide hips that were wrapped in white, but comfortable pants, the...void between his legs, and down to the sneakers her wore over feet that had to be at LEAST half the size, if not smaller, than his original feet had been.

"Holy shit!" He muttered.

"Yeah, no kidding!" Another feminine voice said from behind him, and Eugene spun on his heels, his hair flying crazily behind him, to spot a stunning woman with large full lips, wide brown eyes, and flowing blonde hair that was a similar length to Eugene's own.

She was slightly taller, had a deeper tan, and her gray dress was more revealing, her larger breasts far more on display than her own conservative outfit was. Her hips were not as wide as Eugene's felt, but her legs were bare as they stuck out the bottom of the dress and Eugene could help but stare at how perfectly sculpted they were. At the end of those perfect ambulatory limbs were a tiny pair of feet in open-faced sandals that matched her dress perfectly. But as the blonde checked Eugene out...the former male couldn't help but notice a similar gold band on the other woman's hand.

https://i.imgur.com/4scXP68.jpg

Were...Were they married!?

"I'm...I'm Eugene!" He sputtered through lips that were definitely plumper than they'd ever felt before, "Who...Who are you!?"

The girl's eyes went wide in surprise before she said...

15243131121.content:
"I'm...I'm Eugene!" He sputtered through lips that were definitely plumper than they'd ever felt before, "Who...Who are you!?"

The girl's eyes went wide in surprise, a ring-clad hand flying to her mouth as her face turned a bright red.

"I...I'm Lindsey!" She gasped and the two stared at each other in amazement until a impatient sounding bark came from the floor. The two women turned their gazes downward towards the agitated dog and distressed cat. "OMG! That means..."

"Peter?...Judy?" Eugene called out cautiously, and the two animals ears perked up, the dog barking and the cat letting out a long, pitiful yowl.

But before the transformed group could do anything else, there was a loud rapping on the door behind them.

"What the hell?" Eugene swore in his soft new voice, feeling...compelled to turn and open the door, trying to ignore the weird feeling at how much larger the door knob felt, even though his hands were marginally smaller than they had been originally. The door opened with only the slightest of creaks...

...And in barged a gorgeous looking woman in a flowy, flower-printed sundress, holding a large glass dish, her stylish heels clip-clopping loudly on the hardwood floors as she barged into the home that Eugene apparently now shared with Lindsey and their...pets? Eugene didn't want to think of Peter and Judy like that but at the same time something in his brain was already thinking of his two friends as property rather than individuals.

"Oh hello! Welcome to the neighborhood! Congratulations on the engagement, by the by, you girls are just going to make the CUTEST little family! I just wanted to be the first to say hi and I brought you guys a cassarole! Oh you have just the CUTEST little animals!" The woman was a flurry of energy and activity, practically shoving the glass dish into Lindsey's hands and giving Eugene a HUGE huge before crouching to her knees and cooing over the suddenly enraptured Judy and Peter (whichever animal was which).

"Uh..." Was all Eugene could think to say as Lindsey looked around awkwardly, the dish full of food hanging heavily in her hands. Eugene pointed towards the kitchen and the former sorority girl took an uneasy step into the rest of the house, holding the cassarole dish in her hands as if it would break at the slightest provocation, her own heels clipping through the empty rooms.

"Oh this is going to be SO much fun!" The woman said as she finished rubbing her hands all over PEter and Judy before returning to just above Eugene's new eye level and looking him straight in the face. That was when realization kicked in.

"Wait...YOU'RE THE GIRL THAT SOLD ME THE GAME!" He cried out in surprise.

"WHAT!?" Came Lindsey's voice from the kitchen as there was a suddenly heavy clonk and FURIOUS clipping of heels as she sprinted back to the home's small foyer.

"Clever boy, or, well, girl I suppose" The woman's green eyes sparkled with mischief, holding up a finger that suddenly silenced the cries that were about to come out of both Lindsey's and Eugene's lipstick encrusted mouths.

"Now now, we don't want to drag things on more than we need. I'm just here to explain what Hybrid Mode is now that things have...solidified" The woman swished her sundress and giggled, "And I have to say this is the BEST outfit I've worn so far, it feels so...free and cute! But maybe it's just because you girls look so cute together, it's infectious!"

The two shared a worried look as Lindsey palmed her slender neck, silently mouthing words. Eugene just looked at his crush and then at the rings on their fingers. He had yet to see what he looked like but if Lindsey was any indication in terms of looks...

"Anyway, so yes. Hybrid Mode is a lot like Immersion Mode...Which I know you guys haven't played. You inhabit the world and body of your characters...And complete challenges as you're prompted. But instead of fully being tied to prompts, which will be pretty obvious, you'll also have to make dice rolls for some choices to decide things like 'how many do you get' or something similar. Different responses might create new situations. Otherwise you shouldn't find things too different from your old lives. You won't have to worry about COVID, though, so that's a plus, right?" The woman pointed to the matching necklaces that were hanging from Lindsey's and Eugene's necks; gold chains that were connected to tiny, ruby colored six sided dice. "And for our furry friends..."

The woman crouched again and scratched behind the dog's ear with her long nails, causing...whoever the dog was to thump a leg against the floor in pleasure. The woman did the same with the cat, only under their chin, the cat starting to purr loudly in response.

"Our furry friends will be playing their own game in full Immersion mode. No rolling the dice, they can only respond to the prompts that only they can see. And no, I'm not going to tell you who is who, half the fun is figuring it out on your own. Since they're animals, THEY get the five lives that you'd usually get in Immersion Mode, while you two cuties only get the one, much like normal life"

Lindsey and Eugene's eyes widened in surprise, and the dog and cat ceased their pleasure responses as stared at the strange woman, mouths open, the dog's tongue lolling out while the cat's tail twitched.

The woman rose again and gave Eugene and Lindsey, who were still 'muted' another winning smile. "Well that's really all I was here to do, welcome you to the neighborhood and explain things a bit. Sorry about the lack of information on the game box, things are kept vague for bait purposes to get people to play. After all, wouldn't be much fun if we just SAID 'hey you're gonna get transformed if you play' and then no one actually played, right? Anyway You all get prompts, you and Lindsey get to roll for certain ones to determine severity, intensity, etc"

The woman minced to the open door and struck a pose, "Oh, and when I close this door, I leave the game so DON'T try looking around for me. Oh, and just for added ease...Eugene, you're gonna be 'Jean' or 'Jeanie' as Lindsey is so fond of calling you, until you guys win"

Eugene looked at himself and then at Lindsey, who gave a quick shrug, the best she could do while 'muted'.

"Oh and win conditions change as you play along. Other than that, ta-ta! Good luck, and welcome to the neighborhood! Enjoy the cassarole!"

The woman pulled the door closed with a slam and Jean felt her voice return, and heard Lindsey's as the blonde began shrieking.

"OHMYGAWDOHMYGAWDOHMYGAWD!" Lindsey's voice was high and shrill with panic, and Jean felt anxiety welling up inside her endowed chest as she suddenly realized she could NOT refer to herself as 'Eugene anymore. Meanwhile the dog and the cat began howling and yowling on the floor. the noise was too much for Jean's ears.

"BE QUIET!" She screamed, stamping a tiny foot on the floor. The dog's tail tucked itself between two bowed legs while the cat's ears went flat, and Lindsey looked at her with glistening eyes.

"J-Jeanie, what, what are we gonna do!? I...We...Peter and Judy..." Lindsey began blubbering. Part of her was, well, THRILLED at the prospect of FINALLY being in a relationship with another pretty girl...But that girl was Je...Jeani...Ugh, Jeanie! A guy in a girl's body! And her friends were their pets! And, like, who even was she in the game now!? And how did they change back!? It sounded like...like...They had to live thier entire lives like this!

But before any answers or explanations could be given, there was another knock on the door. Lindsey's eyes went wide, maybe the strange woman had come back! Maybe she'd take pity and let them go back to normal! But as the door opened, her eyes fell as instead of the pretty woman there was instead a fat, balding man flanked by two dull eyed looking guys, with blue shirts that read 'Speedy Movers' emblazoned upon them in red. Beyond was a moving truck, where two more guys were standing, their arms crossed.

"Good morning miss. Is this 3112 Elm Avenue?" The fat man said, wiping a sweaty sheen from his bald pate.

"Uh" Lindsey stammered before spying the numbers on the mailbox at the end of the small path, "Y-yes?"

"Good. Slight problem though, your furniture was a little bit larger than we expected so...Gonna take us a couple trips to get it here. Unfortunately means we're gonna have to charge you a bit more, unless you'd like to move it yourselves?"

The fat man froze as he finished speaking, and in fact it seemed as if this whole new, crazy world had indeed frozen. Lindsey turned and started wide-eyed at Jean, who gave her a shrug.

"Maybe this is a prompt?" She offered to Lindsey. It was really the only thing she could think of.

"But, what...What do I like, say?"

"Just tell them what we want? I mean, I'm not gonna lie, I'm kinda on the verge of having a freak out here. I'm a chick! Just...I really don't want to try hauling around furniture like this!" Jean splayed her arms out and there wasn't a trace of any sort of muscle development. And Lindsey couldn't really blame Jean for feeling like that. But if this was...If this was life now and they were new homeowners with who knows what other debt saddled over their pretty gay heads, maybe they needed to be frugal for now?

But what if this was, like, some sort of speech check in an RPG? Ugh this was TOTALLY hard! How could they play a game without knowing all the mechanics!?

She turned to the frozen...characters? NPCs? Whatever the movers were and, after taking a deep breath and trying not to be weirded out by how heavy her chest felt now, with the huge rack hanging off it, summoned the most authorative voice she could and said...

152433.content:
"I'm...not really feeling either of those things right now, guys. Honestly I thought we'd be playing by now, not doing all this...talking and geeking out over some hunk of plastic" Peter said as he stretched, "I think I'm just gonna go back to my room for a little bit". With a yawn the towering mass of sentient muscle turned and made his way towards the common room's exit, heading for the stairwell that would take him up to the fifth floor.

He would have taken the elevator, but while he was capable of using one, Peter had once been stuck in an elevator when he was eight years old and it had left in him a distinct desire to avoid getting in one whenever possible. Plus stairs were better exercise.

"Aww!" Lindsey whined, putting on a fake pout. Honestly she didn't really fully mind if Peter left, he was okay for a jock but he was still a jock and was thus ultimately self-serving and prone to being driven by less than intellectually stimulating actions. Besides, the game didn't specify that it need all FOUR players to play...

"Peter Tzimeros, you get back here right this instant!" Judy yelled, pulling herself off the couch and racing after her boyfriend, her face twisting in anger. This was NOT the plan! They were trying to get Eugene out of his shell and get him and Lindsey to hook up! But once again the big lummox that she was unfortunately pretty fond of was messing things up with his short attention span.

And unfortunately, he was also pretty tall and thus, unintentionally about three times as fast as her short frame. He could already hear his feet slapping against the stairs before she'd even cleared the common room's doorway.

"PETER!" She yelled again, her voice echoing up the stairwell followd by a cessation of steps and a low groan of annoyance. "You stay right there, buster!" She commanded as the short but stacked goth began ascending the stairs.

Meanwhile, Eugene and Lindsey shared a look as they were left alone in the common room. Which suited Lindsey just fine, as fun as it was to have an audience, sometimes it was more fun to...play alone. She got up from her bean bag and stretched her arms with cat-like grace, stretching her arms upwards to the ceiling, bending her back just enough that her (sadly) smaller breasts stuck out and her butt pressed against the curvature of her yoga pants. She forced out a yawn and, through a mostly closed eye, glanced at Eugene as the fat geek's widening eyes locked on her and his face turning a shade of red. She let the stretch linger a moment longer before letting her arms fall back to her sides with a sigh, opening her eyes fully as Eugene was a second too late in averting his gaze and trying to look interested in the machine once more.

She simulated a shiver, rubbing her slender bare arms and make a cute 'brrr!' noise.

"I must, like, be under the air vent or something. Can I come sit by you, Genie?" The rainbow haired blonde said, giving Eugene a puppy dog face and then trying not to smile as he tried burying his head deeper into the game's keyboard and mumbling what sounded like a yes.

"Yay!" Lindsey giggled, and she pulled her bean bag over next to her current toy's legs and slowly, deliberately lowered herself into it, her ass coming within an inch of Eugene's face, who was desperately, DESPERATELY trying to not let the stiffy in his pants show through as he squeezed his legs a little tighter together. But then his attempt failed entirely as the sorority girl LEANED against him, her head rest against his thigh as a skinny arm curled itself around one of his legs.

He tried not to gulp cartoonishly.

"So, like, how many games do you think this thing has?" Lindsey said, turning her attention away from the boy she had been torturing and back to the strange, retro-looking dome of plastic.

"Uh, I, uh don't know it, uhhhh, I mean" Eugene sputtered as he tried to re-focus him mind on something other than the fact that his crush (who just so happened to be pretty hot) was physically touching him.

"I wonder when it was built? Or how many were made? You said it didn't have, like, a label?"

"N-no! It just has the name M-Morphmanji!" Eugene fumbled as he pulled the game's box back up into view. The box wasn't even all that stylized, no obnoxiously large labels or graphics, just a plain brown-tanned box that had '-Morphmanji-' stenciled on the top.

"So weird!" Lindsey reached up and grabbed the notecard from the table and scanned it's contents again, "I wonder who 'U' is?"

Eugene's composure was returning as the topic turned back towards the game and the mystery that surrounded it. "Yeah, I have no idea! I wonder if that was the programmer's name? And if this is from the 80s or something, maybe they were just trying to talk to their partner or something? Who knows?"

Lindsey had already reached that conclusion, and, assuming they actually DID ever get around to playing a game on it, afterwards she totally wanted to see if she could take it apart. There was no telling what kind of custom built gizmos were inside, and old analog retro-tech was SO cool to poke around in, unlike modern technology which was all just big motherboards and all the interesting stuff was how the coding was laid out. And most of time all of THAT was pretty standardized at this point, which is why it was so easy for her to hack. But analog tech? You never knew WHAT you'd get when you popped open the casing!

"Like, totally. Umm...The rules say that the game can be played 'for up to four players', right? So, like, maybe you and I should just play...a game" Lindsey said, giving Eugene's leg the tiniest of squeezes and trying not to giggle as she felt him tense up again.

"U-uh but we s-should wait f-for P-peter and Judy!" Eugene stammered again as hormones tried to override his intellect.

"But Genieeeee~" Lindsey whined playfully. In reality she didn't really care if they waited or not, "I wanna see what it doooooeees!" She pressed herself harder against Eugene's legs and slowly began tracing a path with a single finger on the far side of Eugene's left leg.

And Eugene, meanwhile, was trying not to simply explode (in more ways than one). But after a few moments the hot chick released him from her prison and leaned forwards with a huff.

"Like, let's look for more games on here, 'kay? I was only gonna vote for pets 'cuz Judy wanted to" The rainblonde quickly began typing, moving past the 'PETS' option (even though she was still curious if that was, like, actual animals or the...other meaning of the word, and 'MODERATION' which she still hadn't figured out.

And what was left of Eugene that was NOT silently gasping in relief was utterly amazed at how quickly Lindsey was typing. Even HE couldn't type that fast! But then amazement turned to curiosity as the game console beeped loudly as two new options pulled up on the game's tiny screen.

"Oooh! 'CASINO' mode! Now THAT sounds like fun! I LOVE Vegas!" Lindsey exclaimed, her eyes glittering with excitement, "Me an' my friend Bethany stayed there on our vacation last summer! We couldn't like, actually go in the casino parts of the hotels though but all the shows were, like, super fun! And the lights! Like it was SO much fun!"

Eugene, of course, could only mumble that he'd never been. In fact this was currently the farthest he'd ever been from home, he and his mom never really having the money to go on big trips. That's why he'd gotten into video games, they were really the only 'vacations' that he could take to new and exciting places. Especially when his mom had been sick. Hell, he was only here at the university BECAUSE he'd managed to snag a scholarship run. Otherwise he doubt he would have had the cash to attend one of the colleges around LA. Not without being saddled with crippling debt he'd never pay off, anyway. It wasn't really something he liked to talk about though, and quickly pointed out the other option that appeared.

"And 'CLUB', that could be fun" He suggested, even though he wasn't really into the local club scene. He was still in the process of acclimating to being away from home, the course work and trying to make friends when the Pandemic had forced everything to a dead stop.

"Yeah but, like, 'club' can mean anything! Like is it like a dance club, or a book club?" Lindsey eyed the glowing red word with confusion, "How would you even make a game out of that?"

"I-" Eugene started, but was interrupted as Judy minced back through the common room's doorway, followed by a sullen looking Peter.

"So we're back! And I hope you guys like pizzaa!" Judy said with a smile while Peter rolled his eyes behind her.

"Yeah. Dinner's on me. It's the 'least I can do' for you buying this game for us, Geno" Peter's voice was full of false sincerity as he shoved himself back onto the couch, Judy joining him, but at a respectful distance instead of curling into his arm's like she had previously.

"So are we doing the Pet game?" The goth asked earnestly, and Eugene and Lindsey shared a look.

"No, we, uh, looked for some other games on here" Eugene explained and tried not to feel bad as Judy looked crestfallen.

"Yeah but we, like, found some good ones! There's a 'CASINO' mode and a 'CLUB' mode! Those sound like a ton of fun!" Lindsey chirped.

"Casino? Fuckin' A! Let's do that!" Peter said, his interested renewed. Surely it'd be like, a card game, right? He was actually pretty good at poker, so much so that most of the football teams he had played on both here and back home had stopped playing with him if there was any money involved.

"A 'CLUB' mode? But...That can mean a ton of different things!" Judy said, her voice full of skepticism.

"THAT'S WHAT I SAID!" Lindsey gushed.

"There's still more we can look at..." Eugene offered, hoping to find something he was more familiar with.

After a minute of discussion the group voted on:

After a few minutes of discussion the group decided on playing the CASINO option. This was mainly because Lindsey and Peter had been VERY insistent about it, and because Judy was more interested in keeping her boyfriend engaged and less likely to wander off again). Eugene was less than thrilled, he wasn't very good at card games but maybe in a friendly setting he'd be able to pick up a few tricks from Peter? Plus it wasn't ALL that bad, Lindsey was still curled around his legs and he was actually starting to get a little comfortable with the soft pressure of her body. He'd actually let her take over typing on the tiny keyboard, she was faster anyway and didn't seem as terrified of breaking it as he was. Plus it would save him from having to constantly lean over (which given his...bulk, wasn't the most comfortable).

"CHOOSE GAME MODE" The game buzzed as Lindsey typed in the group's choice. Two large, black buttons with 'IMMERSIVE' and 'TRADITIONAL' popped upwards near the game console's top with a metallic noise and the four students leaned in as they individually inspected the new buttons.

"GAME MODE SELECTION WILL BEGIN PLAY IMMEDIATELY"

"Ugh, kidding me? MORE talking?" Peter groaned as he flopped backwards, giving Judy a dark look, "I swear if we're not playing by the time the pizza gets here, I'm quitting for real"

The repeated mention of pizza caused the group's stomachs to rumble almost simultaneously.

"I'm surprised they're still even delivering. Arn't they, like, supposed to be shut down?" The group's designated typist said as she leaned back once more.

"Well the whole 'essential business' thing is letting them stay open. But I, uh, know one of the guys that works there. Don't tell anyone but he's sort of, uh, doing a little business on the side. He's buying the pizzas himself and then he's delivering them on his own time for a, uh, tip"

"That sounds super illegal, dude" Eugene said as he wondered the legal ramifications this pizza delivery guy could be facing. Plus the potential exposure risk THEY faced.

"Yeah but either we start playing this game or I go and get the pizza and then I WILL go back to my room" Peter said with an authoritative finality.

The group was silent for a moment as Judy gave Peter a disappointed look. After a moment the goth turned back towards Lindsey and Eugene and put on a winning smile that betrayed her otherwise sullen looking outfit.

"So, can we pick a mode, guys?" She urged, making a little wave towards the machine with her hand.

"Well, I wonder what each mode is like?" Eugene pondered out loud while Lindsey continued to peer at the machine, her eyes almost cat-like and glittering with curiosity. The fat nerd reached down for the game box for answers before Peter's large hand waved from the couch.

"Geno, stop. It's just gonna be card games, right? I can teach you that shit. I be this 'Traditional' mode is probably just a bunch of pre-loaded games that we pick through, and 'Immersive' is probably gonna be like, uh, Madden right?"

"Yeah but-"

"Dude, it's no big either way, here, let's just pick..."

The group of students eyed the machine as Peter gave his rather blunt explanation of what he assumed the game modes were going to be. To the athlete, he figured that both modes would simply ask them to get a deck of cards or MAYBE dispense the cards itself along with some poker chips. The game looked like it had some storage capacity on the inside...But given how old it looked, Peter figured he'd probably have to get his own deck of cards and his little collection of poker chips he'd picked up last year before he'd been banished from the campus's competitive card circuit.

Peter listened to Eugene continue to waffle on and waste time. Peter did like the little dude, but sometimes he was SUCH a bore. So instead he just decided to pick for the group. The world seemed to spin around him as he pulled his hand back, staring at it as it became more and more blurry and...fuzzy?

"Huhaaay guh-guyz-uh" He slurred, not realizing his friends were currently suffering the same thing he was, "Did I jus' get schocked 'er somethin'?"

But before he could get an answer, Peter collapsed backwards onto the couch as the world went black. The last thing he heard was the distorted sounds of slot machines and the game blaring out "STARTING SIMULATION: CASINO ROYALE"

The group let out a collective groan as they grabbed their heads, a strange but familiar world coming into focus around them. Lindsey was the first to recover, blinking away the blurriness and the throbbing head pain as the interior of a van finished materializing around them. At first she was VERY concerned that something had gone wrong, that she, they, had been the unfortunate victims of a human trafficking

"HOLY SHIT!" She screamed, causing the other three to groan louder as they rubbed their heads, eyes and temples, "GUYS LOOK!"

"Will you be quiet!?" Peter hissed. Had he been electrocuted or something, his fingers were tingling...But it felt a lot more like a really intense hangover, like the kinds he used to get when he was part of his old frat before he'd had enough sense to leave that toxic environment.

"No, we're, we're in, like, Vegas!" Lindsey squealed back. This...This was impossible, right? Unless it was some kind of VR program but no way, the game was WAY too old to do something like THIS. The blonde pressed herself against the window of the vehicle as she peered out at the towering building in front of her, trying to take it all in despite the dull throbbing of her skull. Judy, Peter and Eugene followed the same, though in various states of, well, post-heavy inebriation. Peter wasn't too bad, having grown familiar with the sensation of having WAY too much to drink and regretting it the day after. Judy's eyes were sunken and red amidst her smeared makeup, her typically immaculately smooth and long silky purple hair now tied up in a loose bun and impossibly frizzy with more than a few party favors sticking out of the rat's nest.Eugene looked the worst, his face whiter than Judy's make-up and a queasy look on his face as though he was moment away from blowing chunks. Lindsey gave the fat kid a sympathetic look (she knew he'd never drank before) before she pressed her face against the interior window of the van and peered back out at the strange, familiar world they were somehow in.

The building looked like a combination of various famous Las Vegas buildings. The giant pyramid casino, Caeser's Palace, some tropical looking outdoor area, a giant fairy-tale castle and three towering buildings that looked like they were covered in gold; the countless windows shining painfully bright in the sunlight.

"Uh, what the fu-" Judy began, but then the the side door of the van was sliding open and exposing the entire group to the warm desert air. The group, save for Lindsey, groaned in pain from the light as a VERY chipper young woman with long brown hair and sporting a black and green valet suit that did very little to hide her bulging assets gave them a huge smile, her perfect white teeth practically glowing between her full lips.

"Good morning! I hope last night wasn't too rough on you, you guys sure do like to party!" The woman said as she reached out a hand. Lindsey was still getting used to the concept of social distancing, so took the woman's out-stretched hand and allowed herself to be gently pulled from the vehicle. She stumbled across the pavement for a moment and felt the warm sun on her shoulders, the dull roar of morning traffic filling her ears as she just stood in amazement.

IF this really was some kind of VR experience...She was definitely cracking open the game the first chance she got. This was AMAZING!

Wait. Lindsey looked down at herself and saw that she was no longer in her pink shirt and yoga pants, but instead was in a wrinkled pink spaghetti strap and jean shorts. And...were her breasts larger? She pulled at her hair, noticing that the rainbow dye was missing. What was going on?

Behind her the woman was offering sympathetic noises as she hauled Judy and Eugene out of the van, letting out a slight 'oof!' as Eugene practically fell on her as he struggled to find his balance. Peter simply grunted as he hauled himself out of the van and slammed the door shut behind him with a little more force was necessary as the group assembled in what was clearly the drop-off lane for the...casino? Hotel? Resort? that was sprawled out in front of them. The woman let out a little sigh and clipped her way in front of the group, aligning herself perfectly with the large gold-lined doors of the casino and held her arms out wide.

"Welcome to the Morphmanji casino and resort! But then again, I don't have to tell you guys that, given the fun you had here last night!"

The group blinked as one. What?

"Oh, sorry, getting ahead of myself! You see, this is the game. As in, you're IN the game. That's Immersive mode! You get to actually experience the, well, experience as real life! And to make it feel authentic, you've all been smacked with hangovers and given randomized events to coincide with your 'first night in Vegas'! Oh, and you've all, except for Peter, been given a little boost to your ages. Can't let minors into the casino, after all!" The woman was beaming at the group, as if this all made perfect sense when it absolutely did NOT.

'That must be why my boobs are bigger!' Lindsey thought as she stared down at the tiny peaks and the shallow canyon between them. It actually felt pretty cool! She'd heard more than a few mean girl comments about her being a stick in high school and even at the sorority but she'd learned how to brush them off. You didn't need to have curves if you spent time in front of a computer. Or rather, you learned HOW to avoid getting curves from sitting in front of a computer. But yeah, this was actually pretty bitchin'!

"Wait...I know you!" Eugene called out from the other side of the small line, "You sold me the game!"

"What!?" Judy and Peter said in unison, bleary eyes going even wider as they shot back and forth from Eugene to the woman, who just chuckled.

"Guilty! But before any of you panic, let me explain. And no, Peter, trying to strong-arm me only ends badly every time you try it, so...Don't? this is supposed to be a fun place!" The mysterious valet pointed a finger at Peter, who was already in mid-stride towards her, his hangover pain shrugging off the last of his rather finite patience. The jock frowned and continued his march towards the woman, who simply sighed in disappointment and pointed a green-tipped finger towards him, causing Peter to freeze in place.

"Every time, Petey. You'd think that SOME version of you would have learned by now... Anyway, here's the way you play. Think of this as a 'working vacation', during your party last night you all partied very hearty, as such you've incurred some rather significant debts that you're going to have to pay off. That's your objective, and if you look at your arms..." The woman pointed at the underside of her own forearm and then at the group, who all, save for Peter who was still frozen, looked at their own and gasped.

There were five black bars on their skin, each with different number amounts that were WELL into the thousands of dollars. At the bottom was a collected total of each day.

Lindsey's was nearly $22 thousand dollars! That was almost as much as her tuition!

"Those are your 'lives'. You get five in-game days to pay off that money with anything you earn, however you decide to earn it gambling or odd-jobs...And hopefully make some on the side! You can trying playing as a team or you can try to work it all off on your own! And as a bonus, whatever you make after you pay off, you'll get to keep when you go home! That sounds pretty cool, yeah?"

The woman's enthusiasm failed to carry over to the hungover students.

"Oh, but if you don't...Or fail any of the encounters you come across, well, the 'house always wins'...." The woman said ominously." The woman moved dramatically to the side as the doors of the casino swung open, the sounds of gambling flowing out into the street. It was very...cinematic, in Lindsey's opinion.

"Now if you'll excuse me, gotta go pick up the next group at the airport! The game starts now!" The woman chirped, and hustled back into the van, speeding off before the group could ask any questions. Peter gasped as he unfroze, stumbling forward, looking down at his arm and then back up at his friends.

"What the FUCK is happening!?"

After a brief collective freak-out at the door, the group reached the same conclusion: This was 'real' and that the only way out was to play the game. They then...

152433121.content:
"I can't believe this! This has to be fake right? Games don't...Games do DO THIS!" Judy's voice wavered on the verge of shrieking as the woman's van disappeared from view as it merged into the VERY realistic looking traffic of the otherwise fictional Las Vegas. She threw a panicked look at the intimidating sum total of '$16,000" that was tattooed on her forearm, along with the black bars that, according to the strange woman, were how many days that she had to earn said $16 grand before something, most likely bad, happened to them.

Not to mention the game was already CHEATING! Judy fought the dizziness that she felt as she looked up at her friends; Lindsey in her wrinkled,, somewhat ill-fitting shorts and pink spaghetti straps, Peter in a deep blue one size too small t-shirt that had 'I Las Vegas' on it, and Eugene in rather unflattering black shirt that had a...stain of some sort on the front of it, and shorts that looked painfully small on his flabby bulk and a...fanny pack? hanging off his waist.

"This, urgh, has to be some kind of super good VR or something" Eugene groaned as he shielded his eyes from the bright morning light, "There's no way we're actually IN Las Vegas". He looked down at his own forearm and ominous looking $7000 that was etched into his pale skin. His nose burned as he inhaled his own body odor, the rank stench of a LOT of sweat (some of which he still felt dampening his new shirt) and something slightly more foul that most likely matched and was the source of the large stain on his chest. He wiggled his toes in the ill-fitting flip-flops he now wore and silently stared at the extremely dated looking fanny pack that was straddling his waist. And was he even fatter now, on top of being older?

'That's just great. Totally what I needed' He thought darkly to himself before Lindsey's WAY too chipper voice cut through his train of thought like a missile.

"But we totally are! Like, there's NO VR system on the planet that can simulate the feeling of wind on skin! And, like, smell! Maaaaaybe give you headache from being strapped on your face too long but I’m really, really sure we’re here!” Lindsey said before she reached over and gave Eugene a pinch.

“OW! What the hell!?” Eugene shouted, but the former rainblonde, now just blonde pointed to the red mark on Eugene’s bulging arm.

“SEE!?”

“Ugh, I just should have kept playing Madden” Peter groaned quietly, staring in disbelief at the $55,000 price tag that was emblazoned on his arm. That…That was an impossible amount of money! At best he’d only ever won a couple grand in the card circles on campus, mainly the frats in his freshman year before he’d been banned.

But before the group could continue to inspect themselves there was the sound of an engine revving as a red, VERY expensive looking car turned of the street and began it's way up the short drive towards the door as a dark standard looking car pulled in close behind it. The group was forced to move from the pavement and towards the casino doors as it revved it's engines once more as it slowed to a stop, and Peter couldn't help, even with the pounding headache, stare at the car's shiny curves. And then at the equally shiny curves that stepped OUT of those curves.

She was tanned and tall, impossibly leggy with a rear that looked like it could kill just by aiming at a guy, a platinum blonde whose styled hair hung down around her barren shoulders as two HUGE breasts, larger than Judy's DDs by at least a cup, probably two, pressed against a silver dress that glistened in the morning sun as if the woman was clothed in nothing but diamonds. Jewelry hung off her neck, dangling against her breasts, off her ears, and her tiny hands were decked with gold rings. The look of clear wealth was rounded out by a pair of heavy gold bracelets that seemed a size too small, gripping her wrists tight as she stood there in the morning light fidgeting with them. Her eyes were bright blue and her lips were plump and red and there was a look off...bewilderment about them as she stared at the casino's surroundings. Almost as if she was looking for some kind of exit?

"Damn" Peter and Lindsey breathed as they tried to keep their eyes from popping out of their skulls.

But then another figure rose from the driver seat. He was tall, his skin was tanned, an expensive pair of sunglasses sat on his large nose and his black hair was greased and slicked back. He wore a suit that looked almost as expensive as the car. He strutted around the front of the car and seized the blonde by the forearm, and her face forced a pearly-toothed smile her eyes did not return.

"C'mon doll" The man muttered, his voice VERY stereotypically Italian-American sounding as he moved towards the casino doors, "Hey watchout we're walkin' here!" He snarled at the group, and the group of slightly older students scattered to the side.

"Fuckin' tourists..." The man muttered angrily as he proceeded past the group, the woman's panicked looking eyes locking on Peter and Lindsey as she silently mouthed something with her ruby-red lips. And then she and the man were inside, vanishing into the crowd of people that were moving through the casino's lobby. There was a slam of a car door behind them, and the displaced students looked as a HUGELY muscled man rose out of the featureless black car and with more speed than anyone that large should have, quickly slid into the sports car and the two vehicles sped off towards the parking garage.

"Well, that was weird..." Eugene grunted as the group rejoined at the entrance of the casino.

"Yeah..." Lindsey said, her eyes locked on the gold-encrusted doors.

"Dude did you SEE that chi-" Peter said excitedly to Eugene, but a VERY loud cough from a VERY annoyed looking Judy kept the athlete from fumbling even further into trouble territory, and he blushed and groaned at the rush of blood making the throbbing in his head pound harder.

"Listen, we...need to play to get out, right? Do we all have the same number?" Judy said after a moment of glaring at her boyfriend, holding out her forearm and showing the $12,000 that was stenciled onto her pale skin.

There was a chorus of 'no' as the three others held out there arms; Eugene and his $7000, Lindsey and her $22,000, and Peter with his colossal $55,000. They glanced around and then EVERYONE stared, open mouthed, at the huge number on Peter's skin.

"So wait, this all...This all adds up to a hundred grand" Eugene said, doing a quick calculating moment with his fingers as he quickly tabulated the combined totals, "So we need to collect THAT much to get out of here?"

"Why are they different? Why do I have the highest one!?" Peter pushed the tattooed flesh, hoping against hope that maybe it was just like a press on, but with no luck.

"I bet it's, like, a difficulty system" Lindsey nodded, "We all have super different numbers, but Genie has the smallest! So I bet it's based on our individual skills at gambling"

"Great so even though I have the smallest number, I'm actually completely screwed" Eugene chuckled darkly, earning him a sympathetic noise and pat on the head from the slightly more bouncy blonde.

"Yeah...I mean I know how to play cards but gambling? I, uh, I've never really felt comfortable with trying it out" Judy said with a blush and looking down at her sandal'd feet. Gambling was, after all, sinful and thus she'd never been exposed to it before escaping to college. Her own crestfallen embarassment earned her a head pat of her own from Lindsey.

Lindsey herself was trying not to be too worried. She could play cards and was actually how she and Peter had originally met, a card game during Rush Week. The sororities had already scooped her up but she'd decided to just explore the rest of the campus and had been drawn into one of the 'freebie' games that the frats were putting on, and Peter had been there, looking bored, and had proceeded to crush her rather effortlessly when she'd thought he'd be an easy target. And he hadn't even been PART of the frat! They'd just invited him there to trick pledges into signing up. But now? With such an amount of money on the line and...whatever might happen to them if they didn't earn it all by the end of the five days...The blonde was definitely worried.

"So...What do we do now?" Eugene asked, and silence, save for the distant sounds of gambling and the city ambiance, fell over the group as they mulled their options.

"It's simple" Peter finally said, taking a step towards the gilded entrance, "We're in this together. You and Judy both suck, sorry babe, so we stand a better chance trying to earn this cash as a group. If we go alone we're just going to flounder, but staying together as a team, maybe we can make this work and get out of this crazy place" His voice was deep and strong, authoritative and inspiring as the jock summoned his 'team player' personality and hoped like hell it worked on nerds just as well as it did on the football team. He cast a quick look behind him to see if it worked. Judy was staring at him with a mixture of awe, admiration, lust and anger, having been a little turned on by his hero moment despite the off-hand insult. Lindsey and Eugene seemed similarly impressed, their heads nodding and small, determined smiles on their faces.

'Still got it' The jock through with a grin. He turned fully back to his friends and waved one of his large hands.

"C'mon, let's get this show on the road. Quicker we get the cash, quicker we go home"

And with that, the athlete led the group forward into the casino...And the were immediately accousted by a group of angry looking men being led by a spindly, balding old man that looked VERY displeased with them.

"Ah, good, you've returned" The man said after a moment of silent glares, "The management would like to inform you that..."
