1524331211.content:
The group entered the large, faux-gold plated doors and for a very brie moment, Eugene was thrown off by the fact that no one was wearing a face mask or immediately sanitizing the door handles.

'Guess there's no covid in the game?' The now-older teen thought as he trundled behind his group of friends, trying to not feel too guilty about trapping them here. He just really questioned why he had gained even MORE weight though, did the game base their (hopefully) simulated appearances on stereotypes or projected appearances three years into the future? He didn't particularly enjoy being close to what he guessed was 300 pounds...But Lindsey's new body, particularly her ass, was about to damn near give him a heart attack or a boner. Possibly both.

"Oh wow, look at this lobby guys!" Judy gasped ahead of him, and Eugene tore his gaze from the shifting glutes of his crush to the world around him and also felt his breath catch in his throat.

Everything was so...expensive looking! Crystal chandeliers hung from ornately molded ceilings, the floor was black marble inlaid with gold and there were two large fountains that were gurgling and gushing upwards in artistically engineered arches of liquid. There were alcoves on either side of the lobby that were occupied with a row of four door each, several of them opening with a ding as individuals poured in and out of the elevators. In front of them, flanked by two flights of stairs that curved upwards and two passages that were labeled 'CASINO' in carved wood, was the welcome desk, the hotel logo (which was, somewhat predictably, a huge gold 'M' with the infinity symbol curling out of it) was attached to a wall of dark marble as water flowed almost seamlessly around it in an endless waterfall. The beautiful woman in the dress they had seen just a few minutes earlier was ascending the staircase on the right, her slender arm locked tightly within the arm of the rude man, and they were both flanked by tall, black suited men.

It was quite possibly the fanciest place Eugene had ever been. It honestly reminded Eugene of the fancier parts of the 'First Class' section in that old movie his mom loved, Titanic, but obviously more modern and with a decidedly American take on it.

But despite the aesthetics of the casino, Eugene and the groups attention shifted towards the spindly, balding old man in a tuxedo that was approaching him, and the four burly men in black business suits that were following close behind. The two groups came to a stop between the two fountains and after a moment of awkward silence, the older man coughed and stepped forward. From here, Eugene could see the title 'Concierge' on the small badge he wore.

"Ah good, you've returned" The Concierge said, his nasally voice carrying more than a little distaste as he looked each member of the group over, wincing at Eugene's apparently foul appearance before continuing, "The management would like to inform you that, due to your...entertainment in the presidential suite last night, you've all be assigned to new rooms while we repair the damage"

The tuxedo wearing official snapped his fingers and one of the hulking brutes behind him stepped forward, reaching into his coat for something and suddenly Eugene was picturing that gnarled hand pulling out a blackjack stick or worse, a gun and threatening them, but was relieved to see four small envelopes instead be handed to the smaller man, who in turn handed them to the group. Eugene wasted no time in tearing his open and tipped the contents into his chubby hand; two hotel keycards, a letter and a hundred dollars in casino chips. And what was more amazing was that the moment the chips hit his flesh, the $7000 tattooed on his left forearm ticked down to $6900.

"Wow!" The overweight geek gasped.

"Indeed. The management values the four of you as customers, despite your...exuberance last night. The rooms are now standard, and you will be among the normal guests as opposed to our more elite clientele. These rooms are compliments of Management and will not reflect on your bill...Unless you damage them, of course. And at no extra charge, we've gathered your belongings and deposited into your assigned rooms. The chips are, due to the hotel and casino being separate corporate entities, there to encourage you to visit our gambling floors over those of other...less reputable casinos." The Concierge made a disgusted face once more, as if the thought of the group using the other casinos in Las Vegas was repulsive to say.

But the moment passed as the small man recovered and continued on,"The paper contains the binding legal agreement you have made with Management."

"What's wrong with, like, the other casinos?" Lindsey asked from the other side of Peter.

"Miss, I don't partake in unprofessional gossip about our competitors" The man said curtly without acknowledging the hypocrisy of his statement.

"But like-"

"If you have questions, feel free to make your own inquiries elsewhere. Now, since my services here are concluded, you may feel free to make use of our facilities however you desire. Please note that, as per your agreement with management, that if you have not accumulated enough money to pay off your debt by the end of your scheduled stay with us, you will be held accountable and expected to pay said debt off before you will be allowed to check out. Any further damages to the hotel or casino will be added to your fee totals, and while the Management is willing to look the other way for certain behaviors, if you continue to cause issues, you may face a ban from our establishment. If you have any further questions about your arrangement with Management, feel free to ask at the front desk, or to call using the special number on your documentation.Thank you for your time and patronage of the Morphmanji hotel and resort" The man finished what was obviously a more thorough run-down of the simulation's rules and gave the group a curt nod, snapping hi fingers in the air as his own group turned and began walking away. But then he paused and turned back, his eyes locking with Eugene.

"Oh, and might I suggest that, before you go about your business, you visit your new rooms and put on some more...fitting clothing? And possibly a shower?"

But then the man was gone, and the group was left staring at Eugene, who was simply turning red with embarassment (and a little bit of anger at being singled out).

"Ugh, SUPER rude!" Lindsey said, sticking her tongue out at the backs of the retreating official.

"Yeah. But he's got a point we don't look exactly, uh, fresh. Especially Geno. Sorry dude" Peter shrugged, and Eugene felt his mood grow a little darker at his best friend's off-hand insult.

"Peter!" Judy gave her boyfriend a harder-than-normal punch to the arm.

"What? I mean As much as I want to start earning our way out of this insanity, we all smell like beer, sweat and, uh, 'tossed salad'. Especially Geno. It might not be a bad idea to go freshen up."

"Oh! Maybe it's like, walking over a medkit in a game or something! Maybe we have like a debuff or something, and once we go to our rooms, we'll totally feel better and stuff! And like, have our stats restored! That way we'll be able to gamble better! OH OH! And I bet all of our stuff is, like, special inventory as well! I wonder what we all have?"

"Lindz, I didn't understand a word of what you just said, sweetheart" Judy shook her head in confusion. They sounded like video game terms but that was a field the almost-preacher's-daughter girl was completely unfamiliar with.

"I do. Yeah, sounds like a good idea, uh, Lindsey" Eugene said, grinning despite his embarassment, and the messy-haired blonde gave him a grinning thumbs up, "But remember we ARE on a time limit". Eugene held up his arm to show the top bar, which clearly indicated the current day, was already noticeably smaller than the other four.

"Shit. I forgot about that" Peter grumbled as he, and the rest of the group, inspected their own arm bars.

After a few moments the group decided to...

Now babe, I love you, but time is money, and we need money to survive" Peter gently placed a hand on his stunned and betrayed girlfriend and firmly pushed past her as he walked towards the casino entrance, opening one of the large gold doors and vanishing inside, his towering bulk quickly getting lost among the rest of the casino crowd.

Lindsey and Eugene both gave her a apologetic look as they pushed past the betrayed goth and vanished into the casino as well.

"Fuckin' stupid" Judy swore before she too entered the casino.

"Let's do the 'club' one. I'm not really all that good with card games" Judy said after a few minutes of discussion (and holding Peter's arm hostage because that way he couldn't just get impatient again and storm off). It was a bit of a lie, given that she'd spent far, far too many Sundays playing Bridge (which was seen as 'morally clean' in the eyes of God) at church with the old ladies or with her parents and grandparents. And uncles. And aunts. And the pastor. And pretty much anyone that went to their church and was allowed in the house.

Judy shuddered at the memories, all that wasted time...

But she also knew that Eugene wasn't really a card player. She'd tried to teach him Bridge a couple of times but the freshman had failed to really 'get it'. She didn't really want watch Eugene get embarassed, especially in front of Lindsey, because she knew that Peter was pretty vicious when it came to playing cards. There was a reason why he'd been kicked off out of every competitive card circle on campus, after all.

"I could, like, TOTALLY handle a night at the club!" Lindsey said, doing a half dance with her torso, arms raised in the air and her bracelets jangling as she waved them around, "I've been getting, um, cabin fever! And stuff!"

"But...It's just a game! I don't see how it'll do anything other than just play some crappy disco music or something!" Peter whined, "If we do casino we can..."

"Oh hush, it's a vote" Judy said matter-of-factly, "Plus this means we won't get the cards all greasy from the pizza"

"Yeah! And, like, you would ALWAYS be able to tell what cards are which. 'Cuz of the grease marks an' stuff!"

"I...Like it better than playing cards all night" Eugene said quietly, hoping that no one heard him.

"But!" Peter cried out, but was silenced as Judy placed a long, dark-tipped nail against his lips and stared deeply into his brown eyes.

"Majority rules, babe" She said, sticking her tongue out before giving Peter a quick peck on the cheek. She turned to Lindsey, who was poised like the Chesire Cat over the game machine's keyboard, a huge, toothy grin that would challenge the fictional feline's own. Judy gave the rainbow haired blonde a quick nod.

"I love democracy" Lindsey croaked, making her voice as deep as she could as she quickly typed in the game choice. Eugene chuckled at the reference (and a little bit at the clueless expressions on Judy and Peter's faces as the movie meme reference sailed over their heads).

The moment that Lindsey finished typing in the command, there was a loud buzz and two large, black buttons popped out of the top of the console, the words 'Immersive' and 'Traditional' stenciled on them in faded, chipped white text.

"CHOOSE GAME MODE" The game's voice squawked.

"Really? Guys, c'mon-" Peter began, but Judy gave his arm a (slightly painful) squeeze and he rolled his eyes, shutting up before he ended up truly in the dog house.

"I wonder what that means?" Judy said innocently as she poked her nails into the more tender flesh on the underside of Peter's deliciously muscled arms. Sometimes her man just needed a little more...physical reinforcement.

"Yeah, like, how do you, um, do a 'traditional' club? Like Immersive I totally get 'cuz it'll prolly be like what Petey said but traditional?"

"Maybe it'll be like a board game version of going clubbing?" Eugene offered the only thing he could think of, having otherwise drawn a blank.

"Heh, watch this game actually be magic and if we choose Immersive we actually get transported to a night club and have to complete objectives to get back, and traditional is more like that old Dance Dance Revolution game they have at the Student Center" Peter chuckled mockingly. Of course it was probably going to be EXACTLY like he said, this thing was probably nothing more than some 80s karaoke machine, at best it would maybe do a little light show.

"Oh, be serious you meanie!" Lindsey stuck her tongue out at the jock before tilting her head back and looking at Eugene's wide-eyed, and upside down stare as she put what little cleavage she had on display for him.

"Like, what do you think we should play, Genie?"

"Uh...Um, let's, uh, take a vote?" The awkward geek stammered as he tried to do the right thing and not stare down at his crush.

"Democracy always works!" Judy said with a laugh.

The group went around in their rough half-circle and voted on what they wanted, not really paying much mind to the previously mentioned possibility that the word 'Club' could have drastically different meanings beyond just being a nightclub, with the winning mode being...

"They actually did, but I've never seen one THIS small..." Lindsey's eyes peered beyond the figurines and into the dark interior of the machine, trying to discern some kind of understanding of it's mechanics. IT actually kind of reminded her of this old old old OLD movie she had watched called *batteries not included that had these super cute little flying robot aliens that had a bunch of gizmos and gadgets and could, well, do anything. This couldn't be like that, could it?

1524332112.content:
“H-here, Pete,”

The jock perked up his head just in time to catch the green pair of sunglasses. He shot a grateful look at Eugene, who shrugged in response. “T-thought you might want that one.”

“That’s cool of you, Geno, but…” In one smooth motion, Peter stood up — his girlfriend squealing as she was bumped to the side of the chair — and plucked the little pair of headphones from the table, and placed it on the game board. “I’ll take the DJ! Wub-wub-oontz-oontz.”

Lindsey raised an eyebrow as Peter onamatopoeia’d his way through an pseudo-EDM song. “Never would-a pegged you for a music, dude, Petey.”

“Ugh, but he is,” groaned Judy. “He puts on his ‘mix’ every single time he goes to the gym. It’s torture.”

“Don’t fault me for having good taste, Juju,” crooned Peter, still bobbing his head to the song in his head.

“I g-guess I’ll take the bouncer then.” Eugene delicately placed the sunglasses onto the gameboard as everyone refrained from making any rude comments.

“I wanna be the bartender!” cheered Lindsey. “Mixing drinks and changing lives!”

“I kinda wanted to be the dancer anyways,” Judy confessed, placing the heel on the starting space.

Lindsey masked a snort. “You don’t have the proportions for it, like at all.”

Judy stuck her tongue out at the rainblonde. “Rude.”

“I woulda gotten slapped if I said that…” grumbled Peter.

Judy giggled and planted a chaste smooch on her boyfriend’s cheek. “One of life’s double standards, babe.”

After Judy ever-so-kindly moved Lindsey’s piece for her, the group of friends waited for something to happen…

And waited…

...and waiiteed.

Lindsey let out a long sleepy yawn and stretched her feet over Gene’s lap, hiding a grin as he turned cherry red, “Is there something, like, wrong with it?”

Peter flipped through another Google page in an attempt to find out what the hell they were playing. “It’s old as hell, maybe it’s broken.”

“You’re such a downer, babe,” said Judy, rising up from her seat, leaning over the metal game board. “See, there’s a green button right he—”

As the goth lightly depressed the button, a great WUB, unlike any sound heard before by the collected group, or maybe even human ears. The residents of the commons were scattered like bowling pins made of meat, scattered around the metal epicenter of the blast.

Eugene, who had the fortune to land sideways on the couch, made to practice the little bit of first aid he could remember from Health class, but a sudden, pulsing heat filled him, like his heart and stomach and liver — and, well, all of his organs — were being microwaved. In tinfoil. The white stucco ceiling dissolved into a dark fuzz as he… swelled.

Lindsey, behind the capsized bulk of the easy chair, felt her clothes slither over her like snakes, as her not-so-sizable chest flattened even further, her denim capris smoothing out and stretching across her lengthening legs...

Judy, trapped underneath the small tunnel between the chair’s, was treated to the lovely sound of her joints and bones cracking and snapping, though no flash of pain emerged from her limbs. She groaned lightly as her clothes tightened…

Peter, lying face-first on the ground, tried to bellow for help, for Geno to do something, for anything to happen, but was only able to let out a harsh rasp from his lips. Lips that were slowly starting to feel… larger. He tried to reach for the phone five inches from his face, but his arms felt like tissue paper wrapped around iron girders. Peter’s eyes widened in horror as the retina display melted into a black pubble of shadow and inched across the carpet towards him, like a plastic slug…

15243321121.content:
Eugene came back to reality with a shuddering gasp, one that was far, far easier to muster than normal. The ceiling, the only thing he could really manage to look at with how damn sore he was, was ruined, only two or three light-tubes still intact, casting a ghostly yellow-white pallor across the room.

“Jesus,” he mumbled. In a voice that wasn’t his.

A sense of desperate panic gripped Eugene, and he mustered up all the strength he could to flop his right arm onto his chest. But instead of the stomach flab and half-moobs he’d been trying to prevent — to no avail — his hand found hard, striated mass, a mass that rippled as he moved his arm.

His hand — which was goddamn huge, by the peripheral-vision-glimpse he got of it — roamed across a shirt filled with pecs, abs, and even a little bit of bi-and-tricep, on his other arm. A perverse, dark sense of confidence filled him. This was him. He was — unless he had some kinda nightmare for a face — hot. Maybe hot enough to get Lindsey to —

Some rustling sounded next to him, and Eugene managed to crane his neck to the left, where the devastated lounge lay. Spots still danced around his eyes, but he could make out a… kinda rounded object? Blackish, semi-shiny — aw shit was that the LA-Z-BOY?!

Eugene twitched the side of his mouth he could into a frown. He liked that chair. It was in the corner, which was nice for avoiding conversation during the non-pandemic-days, and it was juuussst worn enough to be ultra-comfy without being whywashethinkingaboutchairs.

His friends were (maybe) hurt, and he was thinking about his owncomfort. With a mighty, paralysis-defying grunt, Eugene placed a hand on the ruined armrest and pushed...

Aaand it fell onto the floor. With a weird, electronic boop? And, uh, that was wayy softer than the chair was, and kinda warm?

A sense of dread comprehension dawning, Eugene slowly rose to his feet and squinted down at the collapsed object, his eye’s rods finally adjusting to the low light:

A bright yellow bulb, striped through the middle with dark plastic, sat atop a pale swanlike neck. Below that, the mysterious figure’s body was entirely encased in dark leather, from splayed-out arms to slim, stilettoed ankles.

But, most worryingly to Eugene was the round, hip-level hemispheres, the left one upon which a large sweaty handprint rested.

Eugene paled and found an utter lack of saliva in his mouth. He just goosed, groped, whatever… who was it? He peered closer and saw a smattering of styrofoam pellets around her wide hips, the innards of Lindsey’s favored perch.

The buff nerd ran a moistureless tongue around his parched lips. Hopefully, his crush would forgive the inadvertent pawing. That is, if she wasn’t in a coma. He should move her — that kind of posture had to be murder on the neck.

Lightly slipping his hands underneath the most appropriate areas — the hard fabric that composed her corset and her shoulder — Eugene delicately flipped the cyberpunk bartender like a delicate pancake, then immediately blushed at the light wobbling of her chest, which was definitely larger than before.

This game — because it had to be the game that did this — was a pervert, concluded Eugene.

Averting his eyes to the ceiling, Eugene bent down levered his thick arms underneath Lindsey’s shoulder blades and the back of her knees, lifting her with surprisingly little effort.

Still looking upwards, Eugene turned around perfectly, lightly kicking the couch’s base to confirm it was still there… before a familiar electronic bloop sounded from his arms.

He looked down, and gawped at Linds’ helmet, the black glass of the visor lit up like a red LiteBrite, the pointillistic dots forming a large ‘?’. Slowly, her head turned from side to side, presumably taking in the devastated commons, before lazily facing towards Eugene.

“Hey,” Eugene murmured, his shaky lips spreading into a small smile.

A lot of things happened at once:

The question mark quickly slithered into a vibrant red exclamation point, and all of his cargo’s leather-clad limbs started thrashing at once.

“Hey you ca—!” was all Eugene managed before a booted toe caught him in the chin, sending him reeling for a moment. He maintained his grasp on her for a few seconds, but was unable to enjoy the feeling of her chest squishing against his own through the pain, inadvertently releasing his grip on her .

Sparks danced in Eugene’s eyes as a whump and a boop sounded from a few feet aways from him, two projectiles thumping against his thigh before his vision focused. In front of him sat Lindsey, chest heaving, legs askew, a ‘(；ﾟ Дﾟ)’, flashing on her visor. Eugene spared a glance at his feet; two heeled boots rested a bit behind him, presumably thrown by the frightened sorority girl.

https://images2.imagebam.com/95/37/20/a3...

Eugene raised his hands and tried to look as non-threatening as he could. “Hey, relax! It’s just, uh, me.” The visor flashed to (◜o⌓o◝) as Eugene bit back a swear. “I-i mean, it’s Eugene. Just, uh,” He flexed a rippling bicep and half-smiled. “more muscly.”

She recoiled at this, scooting back on her hands until she bumped against the back of the couch and, consequently, bumped her hands against her rear. Both hands were quickly ripped away from her hips as if burnt, and slowly, shakingly raised to her visor, which displayed ‘...’ in red lights.

Eugene took a step towards her. “Y-you alright?” he rumbled, but she didn’t seem to notice as she traced the outline of her body, from wide hips to slim waist, before grasping and gently pulling down her front-facing zipper’s pull tab…

“alrightithinkthatsenough,” Eugene rumbled in his new baritone, taking a few steps towards her, only stopping when Lindsey tried to flatten herself against the couch once again.

“Sorry!” he blurted. “Sorry. I’m just not used to… being so big.” He chuckled sheepishly and Lindsey’s visor changed to ‘>:@’ as she flipped him the bird. “I, uh, probably deserve that. Do you, um, need a hand?”

Eugene proffered a thick mitt to his newly buxom crush, but Lindsey chose to struggle to her feet by herself. But when the helmeted hottie put her weight on her right ankle, her leg crumpled like a papier-mâché pillar, a harsh electronic screech emanating from her helmet.

“Ah, are you alright?” murmured Gene in an effort to make his voice less bone-shaking. Lindsey just rubbed her ankle in response, ‘(x)_(x)’ displayed on her visor. Eugene frowned. One-way-communication was difficult. “Do you uh, think you could take that off?” The geek waved a hand at her helmet.

Lindsey’s hands abruptly moved away from her bum leg and snapped to her helmet, quickly feeling around the edges of the helmet for some sort of seam, an spirited investigation that slowly but steadily tic-taced down her zipper...

Eugene once again inclined his gaze to the ceiling, heat flushing his cheeks. “No dice, huh?” was shot at the stucco. “Alsouhyourzipper.

A brief pause, then a mortified synth-arpeggio, followed by a quick zwip. Determining it was safe to look down again, Eugene did so, and was greeted with an indignant ‘>>>>:((((‘ visor and thin arms crossed across a well-zippered chest.

This wasn’t going well.

152433211211.content:
Restraining to urge to curl into a ball and die, Eugene once again extended a hand. “Here, let’s get you somewhere to rest. Your, uh, ankle isn’t broken, right?”

The emoticon’d visor was swiveled left to right in the negative, and the attached hand firmly grasped Eugene’s own. Once again the nerd quietly marveled at his own strength. Before, he would have to sling her arm across his shoulder to offer any support, but now, mere bicep-power was enough to support the entirety of her weight.

Lindsey also seemed to be astounded by the peculiarities of her new body, but in a way that Eugene politely pretended not to notice: one hand lightly poked her left boob as a ‘D:’ flickered on her visor.

Halfway through their trip, a chair groaned. Like, a human groan. The duo’s shock was exacerbated by the chunky sandals poking out from the armrest, or, more specifically, that the sandals seemed to be attached to legs.

Eugene stooped down as best he could while keeping his forearm level for the enleathered Lindsey and, with a single piston of his biceps, overturned the chair.

Underneath, with her eyes closed delicately, was a figure clearly recognizable as Judy, just… longer. Like someone pulled out her legs and arms with a Play-Doh machine, and maybe added a bit to her spine. And, uh, also skimpified her clothes: her now-fairly-proportional chest was swaddled in a halter top and skirt transmogrified into a pair of capris.

Before he could formulate a way to wake her up without freaking her the hell out, Lindsey writhed her way out of Eugene’s grip, leather creaking as she limp-crawled towards Judy. Eugene wisely made himself scarce as the girl shook the unconscious goth’s shoulder with unmatched fervor.

‘:D’ displayed itself proudly as Judy’s eyelids flickered once, then twice, then stayed up, blearily focusing on the ceiling. “Whuzzat?” she weakly mumbled, craning her neck up, her gaze falling upon the beaming Lindsey.

It was like her eyes tried to escape her skull with the way they goggled, an mess of syllables escaping her mouth as she shoved her helper backwards onto her ample tuchus, the only coherent parts that Geno could make out being “SEXYDAFTPUNK!”

“Whoa there, Jude!” said Eugene, trying to non-intimidatingly bound towards the two, because boy that chair leg that Judy was wielding could definitely do some damage.

Thankfully (in a way), Judy tossed her makeshift weapon at Eugene with a terrified yawp, enabling the geek to explain the situation from a safe, nonthreatening distance.

Lindsey gesticulated wildly at the taller goth, but was mostly ignored after Eugene explained her mutism.

“Gosh…” Judy breathed, taking in her new… everything. “Looks like you’re not the only one that got an upgrade, Lindz.” She shot a cheeky smile at her friend, who curled her hands into fists at the comment, red ‘DX’ glimmering on her face.

“I kinda wonder what Peter looks like n—OW!” Eugene’s musing was cut off by a sharp THWACK to the leg, courtesy of Lindz.

“Trouble in paradise, Gene?” Judy jabbed. The goth was appreciating the five inches of height with a celebratory strut around the devastation. “I thought you’d be — BABE?”

Eugene blushed. “W-what?”

“Ew, not you — Pete’s here!”

Lindsey clawed at Eugene’s leg as he bounded by, but was left on the floor, electronic vibrato trilling.

He followed Judy’s black-nailed point to a pile of askew couch cushions, out from which a squarish arm peeked.

Not as big as mine, Eugene noted with silent glee. Apparently the board game had no need for buff DJs. Judy wrenched aside the pillows with little effort, and unveiled… Peter?

Compared to Judy, the jock was way different. His brown-buzzcut was now a short blonde coiff, rounding out a face that looked more ‘pretty-boy’ than ‘jock’. He was pretty skinny now too, and the white shirt and suspenders deal he had didn’t really do much to enhance his physique. The little frou-frou bowtie didn’t really do much to enhance the DJ look. All in all, made him look more like a barten—

Oh.

Oh no.

Eugene stared at the yellow-helmeted Peter behind him, who had finally risen to her - his?- feet, stumble-stomping towards them both with fists balled.

“Fuck.” was all he could say, as Lindsey, the real Lindsey woke up behind him with a yell that was half-soprano, half-guttural.

“Goddammit.”

Well, not all.

"SELECT AVATARS TO BEGIN GAME" The game buzzed once more, almost impatiently.

"Guess we need to pick something..." Eugene muttered as he eyed each section of the tray. Of course the obvious choice were the four offered figurines on the central little stand, but there were a ton of smaller sections all divided out like a pie chart that had their own handful of figurines, each clearly designed for a specific type of 'club'.

"DIBS ON THE BOUNCER!" Peter yelled out, reaching forward with his long footballer fingers towards the machine, but then groaned as a sharp smack knocked his hand out of the way.

"Oooww!" He groaned, rubbing the appendage as Judy gave an indignant little huff and leaned forward in his stead, not fully paying aware of the fact that the motion had accidentally given Eugene a face full of her substantial cleavage; the geeky, lovable little fatso nearly twisting his head off as he looked away...Directly into Lindsey's chest where the sorority girl had silently crept in closer with Eugene realizing it.

"Oh, why monsieur!" She giggled as Eugene merely sputtered in embarassment.

But the cute little interaction was lost to Judy who was focused on the pieces in the tray. Specifically one set of pieces. While she HAD taken a liking to night clubs, seeing the book figurines had suddenly hit her in a spot that the sheltered goth had thought was scabbed over and made her feel homesick. She had LOVED the book club her mom had put on every month, and she was very much aware of the rose-tinted goggles clouding her vision, as when she'd become older and realized certain...truths about things and her family and their friends. They had ended up being little more than gossip sessions about who in town was being 'sinful' and who should be excluded from certain functions because they weren't 'devout' enough, but for Little Judy, it had been like one big tea party! Only the adults were playing with her! And she got to eat those delicious cookies and drink fruit punch like them!

Which she had later come to realize that she was the only one actually drinking fruit punch while the rest of them were drinking wine, but whatever.

So because of this pang of nostalgic homesickness and a rare memory that she could look back on and not feel, well, awful about, Judy plucked the tokens from the 'Book Club' section and pushed the tray back into the machine with a loud DING, followed by a metallic clicking.

"Uh, what gives Ju-Ju? I thought we were, like, gonna get all dance party in here?" Lindsey whined as she pushed Eugene's fire-engine red face out of her tiny cleavage.

"Yeah, what the hell babe!?" Peter pouted as he continued to rub his hand.

"I'm not in the mood for going clubbing" Was all Judy said, putting on a haughty air, hr nose stuck in the air like she'd seen far too many times from her mom. And her old friends, before they'd show their true colors. She was about to continue her explanation when the Morphmanji machine bellowed:

"MODE RESET. CHOOSE GAMEMODE"

1524332122.content:
The two large black buttons popped out of the top of the game once more, and in a pang of similar selfishness, Judy simply distributed the tokens she had grabbed at random and reached over and pressed the 'Immersive' button, and then quickly distributed the tokens to the rest of the shocked (mainly just annoyed) group of friends.

"Jude, what the hell? You don't even want to vote?" Peter whined as he snatched the token out of the air. He hated when she got like this, one of her rare moods where she put HER needs over that of anyone else. It didn't happen often, but when it did it usually resulted in his wallet getting lighter and a LONG day at the mall while she shopped for clothes or makeup or some other girly stuff and would later break down in a guilty feeling, sobby mess because of the way she acted which then turned into a cry-filled rant about how she WASN'T like the rest of her family but she missed them. A LOT.

"No. I want to play this one" Judy said, leaning forward as the rest of the group (plus Eugene, who was retrieving his piece from the floor after it had bounced off his still-red face and shook him out of his stupor), looked at their pieces.

But before any of them could get a good look, Judy had typed in 'START' and pressed enter on the game's keyboard, and the group felt a collective giddy rush fill their bodies as they began laughing. And laughing. And laughing even more as two voices took on a higher pitch as tears filled their eyes and the world became a blurry mess.

When the laughter subsided and the group cleared the tears from their eyes they realized that they were NOT in the dorm's common room any longer, but instead a rather...frilly looking living room that was covered in throw pillows, doilies on a large coffee table, and the strong smell of incense as some kind of soft music played in the background. And THEY had most definitely changed.

Instead of a overweight male geek, a skinny rainbow haired sorority girl, a big breasted goth and a hulking jock, there now were four women sitting in a loose circle, each of them resembling their token piece.

1524333.content:
"So should we pick these? I'm leaning towards the Casino option..." Peter said hopefully.

"Nah, let's keep lookin'!" Lindsey said after the group looked rather unimpressed with the Casino and Club options.

"UGH!" Peter groaned loudly and gave Judy a rather pleading look as he currently wanted to be anywhere but stuck in what felt like a recursive loop of finding new options and then after a couple minutes of discussing them, just choose to pick something else. His look, however, just earned him a poke in the ribs as the prim and proper goth gave Lindsey a polite smile.

"Yeah, I wasn't really comfortable with those anyway" She said cheerily. In truth she herself was getting a bit tired of the constant back and forth but she was certain that they'd some options that appealed to everyone. Or at least, to Lindsey and Eugene, who she was really sticking it out for. They were so CUTE together! And in her, admittingly limited experience, game nights were ALWAYS a good way to break the ice and get Eugene more comfortable with talking around his crush.

"Yeah I'm not really a card player so that works for me" Eugene said, leaning over the keyboard and typing in the command to load more Simulation options.

The machine made an electronic click as new game modes loaded in, and the group (minus Peter) leaned in to see what the new options were.

"Household? Like what, it's like that 'Life' game or something?" Lindsey said, squinting her blue eyes as she read off the first option.

"Kinda vague, just like that 'Moderation' option was" Judy said as she tapped a purple nail against her lips.

"Well, the other one isn't, at least. It just says 'Party'" Eugene said, looking at the glowing red text and then pulling up the game's box once more, going over the faded text stamped into the interior as he tried to discern if this was really what was supposed to happen.

"Yeah, that's, like, kinda obvious. But how are we supposed to have a party with just four people? We need, like, a bunch of people! Like that party before Christmas Break! Now THAT was fun!" Lindsey grinned, remembering when the sororities and the frats had gotten together and thrown a big holiday bash. That had been fun! But with four people? And with Judy as the only other girl who wasn't into girls? It sounded more lame than anything.

After a moment, Judy opened her mouth to make her suggestion, but was cut off by Peter.

"So are we going to pick these or, big surprise, choose something else?"

Judy shot her boyfriend a glare as the group...
1524333.title: The group looks for more Simulation options.

15243331.content:
"Well what I was GOING to say is that let's just pick the Household one" Judy said as she glared at her boyfriend, who was simply checked out on the couch next to her, staring blankly up at the ceiling in boredom. It wasn't actually true and she WAS going to say what Peter had...But she wasn't going to give him the satisfaction of being right.

"After all, the game of LIFE is fun, right? I always liked picking the different houses..." She said, looking back at Lindsey and Eugene with a small, purple grin.

The blonde and the flabby nerd shared a look, and then a nod.

"Like yeah! Plus it's like kinda quick so we can just play another game after!" Lindsey beamed as Eugene leaned over the keyboard.

"Pete?" The nerd asked his jockular friend, who just gave the group a thumbs-up before letting his hand fall dramatically back onto the arm of the couch.

"Okay...One 'Household' coming right up!" Eugene said as he pecked in the keys and hit enter. There was a sound of mechanical whirling before the game shouted out "CHOOSE GAME MODE" and two large black buttons popped up from the surface of the game console.

"Oh great" Peter groaned, looking up long enough to see the buttons labeled as 'Traditional' and 'Immersive'. He felt like he'd been stuck in a discussion loop for months at this point. "Guys, I honestly do not care, just pick something" The athlete closed his eyes and just hoped the pizza would get here soon. That'd be a good chance to sneak back to his room or get the group to do something else other than just sit here fawning over a hunk of outdated plastic.

"Ugh, SO dramatic!" Judy said, rolling her eyes.

"So, like, what are these modes again Genie?" Lindsey said as she leaned back against Eugene's legs and mentally grinned as the little nerd's body tightened up once more. This was WAY too easy.

"I, uh, they, uh" Eugene stuttered as his words failed him. He finally just grabbed the game box and handed it to Lindsey, pointing a sausage-like finger at the game type descriptions. His crush took the box and nestled further against his legs as she poured over the text.

"So, like, Traditional mode prints out a gameboard based on the choice and we just roll dice and get to the middle and stuff. We gotta do like actions and challenges when we land on different spaces. Immersive mode just sounds like Dungeons and Dragons"

"I've never played that" Judy said apprehensively. She knew it was wrong, but after spending her entire life around highly conservative individuals whose idea of a 'proper' game was basically Sorry! she couldn't help but hear her grandma's voice calling DnD 'satan's game'. "I, um, don't know if we should..." She began, but was cut off by Lindsey's chipper voice.

"Don't worry JR! Like, Eugene and I have played it so we'll help you out! Hey Petey, have you played before?"

"No, but don't care" Was all the rainblonde got from the beached athlete.

"Well then we'll help you too! Right Genie?" Lindsey reached up and gave Eugene's knee a squeeze, and there was just a mumble as the geek buried his head and double chin in his shirt as his face continued to turn red.

"Well...I'm okay with whatever you guys want to do. Just be patient with me if we do the Immersive one okay?"

"Like f'sure! No probs Jude! Ima pick-" Lindsey said, reaching forward to type in her choice when suddenly Eugene found his voice, his eyes locking on a third large, black button on the side.

"Wait! Look! There's another button!" The teen heaved his bulk forward to inspect the worn looking button, "...What is Hybrid Mode?"

"Oooh, new stuff!" Lindsey cooed, eyeing the button and then turning back to the box in her hands, "So, um, Hybrid Mode is like a combination of Traditional AND Immersive modes!"

"Oh wow, it's like the word hybrid doesn't imply a combination of the two" Peter snarked from his location on the couch, but the group ignored him.

"So, like, it looks like we'll be playing in a Immersive mode...But we also role dice to move forward? There's, like, not really alot here..." Lindsey squinted as the text faded away into blank cardboard.

"I guess there's just something for everyone?" Judy said with a hopeful shrug. The friends looked at each other before deciding on...
15243331.title: Simulation Mode: HOUSEHOLD

choices: The offered models: Husband, Wife, Son and Daughter.
The second set: Fridge, Toaster, Vacuum and Phone.
The group chose some different models.
152433312.content:
"I've never heard of something called 'Hybrid Mode'. Not really sure if I want to spend time learning a new ruleset" Eugene said, rubbing his primary chin as he stared at the game console and the three large buttons.

"Aww, but it'll be fuuuun Geeeniiieee!" Lindsey said with a fake pout as she turned and rest her head on Eugene's knee.

"I just, um, if we do um, immersive mode and, uh" The geek sputtered as he looked up at the ceiling. Lindsey bit her lower lip to hide her laughter before turning back towards the game and caught Judy giving her a...look. It looked like....approval? Wait, was this entire setup just to get her and Eugene together?

The blonde DID chuckle that time. Boy, was little miss Goth over there barking up the wrong tree! She quickly stuck a tongue out at Judy, who gave her a 'really?' look, but Lindsey spotted the twinkle in her friend's eye. It was gonna be a real shame if the rainblonde (which she felt had been a TOTAL giveaway but maybe her friends were just that dense) had to let them all know that she wasn't really into the whole 'tall, masculine' thing. But for now it wouldn't hurt to play it up.

"Well it's Eugene's game so I guess...Eugene, you can choose, okay?" Judy said after the moment had passed. She didn't really WANT to play DnD...But she wasn't her grandmother. The whole point of getting away was to see what life really was outside of the hyper-conservative, uber-religious singularity she'd been trapped in her entire life. Plus if it could help Lindsey and Eugene get a little closer...Although clearly there was some kind of attraction, since Lindsey was practically draped across Eugene's bulging form like a blanket. Or maybe a cat.

"Preferably before the pizza gets here" Peter added in from across the common room, and everyone's stomach growled in unison.

"Like, OMG!" Lindsey giggled at the gutteral gurgles and then nodded in agreement, her pigtails bobbed in a cascade of different colored hair, "Uh huh, you paid the money so you pick Genie!"

It took Eugene a moment to regain his composure, taking a breath to steady his...nerves before he leaned forward and pressed the large button that had 'Immersive' stenciled in chipped white text on the top. The button creaked downwards back into the game's yellowed plastic case until there was a loud CLICK and the button locked in place and a loud metallic grinding noise began, along with a harsh, bitter smell that began pouring out of the game's interior.

"Bleh, what stinks?" Peter looked up from his space on the couch, his face wrinkled in disgust as Judy leaned back against her boyfriend, her nostrils pinched shut with two purple topped fingers, and Eugene waved a heavy hand in front of his concerned looking face.

Lindsey, however, was relatively unaffected. "Oh, it's just, like, hot resin! I wonder if this is a 3D printer!"

"Arn't those things new or something? Like didn't they just get invented like ten years ago?" Judy mumbled from behind the small protection her shirt offered.

"Nah, JR, they were actually invented in like 1985! But I've never seen one so small and this one is totes small!" Lindsey's eyes, despite watering, were large and curious as a cat's, the device in front of her having tripped her electrical engineering trigger. Old machines from the 80s and junk were the BEST, they were almost always different on the inside! Even though the rainblonde had only lived through the digital touchscreen era, there was something sad about how analogue technology had largely gone the way of the dinosaur.

The burning smell eventually receded, and with a loud DING, a large tray slid out from the lower section of the game, and the group, minus Peter (who had gotten bored once more and went back to doing his best impression of a motionless log on the couch) leaned forward.

"DISTRIBUTE AVATARS AND PRESS ENTER" The game buzzed loudly.

"Oooh!" Lindsey cooed.

There, in the tray, was a surprisingly deep pile of primary colored plastic figurines, with four sitting in a tiny holder above the rest. There was a tall figure in a business suit and a briefcase, another tall figure that was in a clear, 'classic homemaker' styled dress, and two smaller much smaller figures that were identical in size, but one wore a ballcap while the other clutched tightly at what looked like a stuffed bear. The style they were printed in reminded Judy of the older black and white 1950s sitcoms she'd watch on Nick at Nite with her grandma and grandpa when she was a little girl. It was about the only TV she'd been allowed to watch.

Immediately below those were another set of figurines, though these were vastly different. One was a refrigerator, a toaster, a vacuum cleaner and a old rotary styled telephone. There were more figurines that were associated with the 'Household' theme of the chosen game in the pile below, all jumbled together.

"Well, THESE look stereotypical" Lindsey said with barely contained snark as she poked the four figurines on the stand. The figurines had a LOT of detail, almost better than some modern 3D printers but Lindsey noticed the faces and...Well outside of their apparel and accessories the little plastic people had no real defining details. But still, she couldn't help but feel a little miffed by the fact that once again she felt like she was going to be forced into a set gender role. The figure with the briefcase had to be the Husband, right? So the figure in the dress was the Housewife, and the two smaller figures had to be the Son and Daughter. Sure it was just a game and Lindsey wasn't THAT much of a crusader over gender roles (especially with how she herself dressed most of the time), but she was still coming to terms with her own identity and the fact that she was somewhat of a minority.

'Would it kill this game to have had gender neutral roles?' She thought darkly. Instead she turned her disappointed gaze towards the small plastic appliances. Now THOSE looked a little more interesting, if only because they were so vague. What would a simulation with just appliances be like? Like would it be a DnD game about making a perfect breakfast or something? OH! Or maybe, like, that old movie The Brave Little Toaster?

"It's cool how detailed they are! They look like those little army men toys!" Judy said with a grin, not noticing the frown on her female friend's face. She did, however, notice Eugene eyeing what was clearly the 'man of the house'.

That was when Judy got an awful, wonderful and perfect idea. She glanced at Peter, who was looking at his phone, probably playing some kind of football game or looking at sports news (not that there was much to report, sports having been shut down for the pandemic as well). He'd never notice if she...But the moral part of Judy won out. She couldn't just do it without giving him some kind of warning.

'But you don't just have to tell him everything...' A tiny, giggling little voice said from the more shadowy part of her mind.

"So we just hand out these things and we can play?" She asked quietly, casting a look at Eugene and Lindsey before motioning with her eyes towards Peter, bringing a finger to her dark lips. A grin grew on Lindsey's face, but it took the heavy-set geek a moment to realize what was happening before his eyes widened in realization.

"Uh, yeah we just, uh...We just pick them up and I type in the player order and hit enter, that starts the game" Eugene explained, and tried not to yelp as Lindsey poked him in his Pillsbury Dough-Boy gut and gave him a look as Peter's eyes flickered off the tiny screen of his phone, "Oof! I mean, since it's a simulation I don't think player order means anything. Sims just, uh, you just play until the scenario ends. Or something."

There was a moment of collective breaths being held as Peter glanced sidelong at the group, his eyes flickering towards the machine for a long moment and Judy and Lindsey sincerely hoped the bulk of the machine was blocking the figure choices...Before the athlete yawned and looked back at his phone.

"Well if it doesn't matter then I don't care what I am. I just want to play or we all get some common sense and stop TALKING about playing!"

That was enough to ease Judy's conscience. Her boyfriend, much as she was attracted to him and his muscles, was being enough of a pain that he deserved having some just desserts with his sour apples. Judy and Lindsey shared a grin with a still somewhat confused Eugene as they reached out and picked their pieces, leaving the last one for Peter, since, by his own admission, didn't care what he played.

'Can't complain if he's not paying attention!' Judy giggled.

The three friends reached forward and selected...

With barely hidden snickers, Lindsey and Judy reached forward and selected their game tokens, while Eugene waited until the girls were done with their prank before selecting his own. He eyed the remaining token and cast a glance at Peter, but the jock was too absorbed by his phone to pay attention to what was happening around him.

The geek felt like saying something. He didn't know what but even if Peter was being a little bit of an ass about the game taking too long to set up...The big palooka was Eugene's only actual friend he had on campus. Well, guy friend. There was always the fact that his crush was sitting right next to him (or on him, at points) and Judy...But to be honest Judy felt more like a big sister/cool aunt/group mom than a friend, which was weird given her gothy-punk appearance. But with everything Peter had done to help Eugene out the past few months and helping Eugene get out of the shell that had formed around the flabby teen during his previous years of constant active and passive bullying, he felt like Pete deserved a warning of some kind.

But then Lindsey curled herself around his legs, stared at him with a pair of blue, serious eyes and gave him a rather insistent poke on the top of his knee, and any thought of warning Peter vanished as Eugene began typing in the information and hit enter.

"BEGINNING SIMULATION: A HOUSE MAKES A HOME" The game blared out, cheesy, poorly mixed music that sounded like a blend of black & white comedy and a late 80s/early 90s sitcom coming out of a hidden speaker and WAY too loud. But the sound wasn't the most alarming part, instead it was the prickly feeling that was accompanying the sudden HEAVY wave of disorientation that was washing over Eugene and making the world spin like a bad camera transition. The sound of TV static began to drown out all other noise as the world went black, and the last thing that Eugene heard before the world left him entirely was the game's voice saying;

"FILMED BEFORE A LIVE STUDIO AUDIENCE"

And then there was a pop, like the sound of an old tube-TV turning off, and the world faded to a pinprick...Before rapidly expanding outward to reveal that the dorm's common area had been changed to resemble a well kept living room!

"Ugh, my head" Eugene muttered, and despite the pounding in his skull and the dizziness the geek still felt, his eyes shot open as he realized that not only was he somewhere entirely different, but HE was different as well! He looked down at his arms and realized that he'd become the token he'd chosen!

"Oh fff-POOP" Eugene said in his new voice as the word he wanted to say was forcibly removed and replaced with another word entirely as he looked down and realized that he was now...

1552212.content:
Eugene blinked his eyes and found himself looking at his own reflection in the mirror above the sink in his dorm room. It was as that moment he realized he had been dreaming the whole thing. Buying the game, turning it on, picking options with his friends...everything.

And obviously at some point in the dream, he had sleepwalked and ended up standing in front of the sink.

Rubbing his face, Eugene was just happy he hadn't woken up by walking into the sink.

Eugene suddenly froze, startled by the face looking back at him. The face both belonged to him and didn't belong to him.

Eugene had only just started growing facial hair recently, and really only needed to shave every few days. He was religious about doing so, however, as his facial hair was spotty at best, only showing up in certain places.

The face looking back at him, though, looked as if it hadn't shaved in a couple of days, and if left unchecked, would grow a full beard.

That wasn't the only change.

When Eugene lifted his shirt, it felt like the scene in the first Spiderman movie with Tobey Maguire, where Peter Parker lifts his shirt the first morning after being bitten by the radioactive spider. Eugene's flabby torso and small potbelly had disappeared., replaced with a male gymnast's body.

Eugene looked around and found he wasn't in his dorm room. Well, the room looked like his room, but it wasn't. Eugene's real room was meant for double occupancy, and Eugene only had it to himself because of the pandemic. This room was definitely a single. The sink was in its own little alcove, and had been joined by a toilet and an enclosed shower.

All of Eugene's stuff was still in the room, but there were other things there as well.

Sitting on his desk was an old style coffee can, the inside bottom of which was barely covered with a handful of coins. Next to the can was a plastic cover with holes uniformly cut into it. Next to that was an old style ledger book that looked to be a hundred years old. There was also a model spaceship on the desk, and it took Eugene a few seconds to recognize it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zIIuThdt...

It was the Spindrift, the spaceship from the show Land of the Giants, from the late sixties/early seventies. Eugene only knew the show because at the last Comicon he went to, there was a booth with a couple of guys who were trying to crowdfund a remake of the show on Youtube. Eugene had hunted down the show on the internet, watched a couple of episodes, and sent in five dollars.

To the best of his knowledge, the whole project was still in the "pre-production" phase.

There were also three very realistic looking action figures on the desk, all about six inches high. Two of them were characters from Land of the Giants: one of them the actress or celebrity or heiress or something, the other one the fat middle-aged confidence man. Eugene didn't really remember the show that well:

https://mainstreamspanking.files.wordpre...

The third action figure was an Orion slave girl from Star Trek:

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/memo...

For some reason, the third action figure confounded Eugene more than all the other changes to his dorm room. Eugene had action figures at his home (he was smart enough not to bring them with him to college) of different genres, but he kept them all within their own category. He didn't have any Land of the Giants stuff, but if he did, he would have kept it all together and seperate. He certainly wouldn't mix in any of his Star Trek stuff with it.

And if Eugene did mix them all together, he would have kept things separated by era. The original Star Trek did broadcast about the same time as Land of the Giants, and the animated series came on a few years later, but the Orion Slave Girl action figure was from the Enterprise series, Season Four. So no way would he keep all three of those action figures together.

Eugene was about to see what else was different in this world he found himself in, when something even weirder happened. The action figures were jumping up and down, trying to get his attention.

Even weirder, when he got closer, he found he could hear their voices as if they were full sized. There was nothing tiny or tinny about them.

info.brief_description: A board game experience of adventure, magic and transformation for up to four players!
info.description:
After another boring day of lock-down due to the global pandemic in the town of Gunner's Butte, Colorado, four college friends find themselves out of work, their classes cancelled and one of the lucky handful of students that are too poor or simply unable to go home that get to stay in their campus dorms. With nothing to do and their former party school now anything but, the quartet of geeky Eugene, peppy Lindsey, jockish Peter and gothy Judy spend their days being bored out of their minds until one of them returns from the nearby mall with something interesting and new in his hands...A board game? Or at least, something that looks like a really old computer.

Without anything else to do, the group settles down to spend the evening playing this strange game called Morphmanji, and all of them in for a unexpectedly exciting (and potentially dangerous) ride!

-Rules of the Game-

Morphamanji is a unique game in that it can be programmed to suit almost any form of setting. From fantasy to sci fi and EVERYTHING in between, the game has nearly limitless customization options to give players a unique experience and different scenarios every time the game is played. It also has two modes of play: Traditional and 'Immersive', each with their own rules.

-Traditional Gameplay Rules-


-Each player chooses their avatar and must play as that avatar for the duration of the game or are given the option (or command) to change via an Action Square or a Special Card.
-Players move via dice rolls performed by a single six-sided dice roll. Singles and double rolls get a second turn.
-Players can roll one at a time or simultaneously.
-Players that roll a 6 must always pull a Challenge Card even if they land on an Action Square.
-All players must pull a Challenge Card every three turns.
-Action Squares: Action Squares will generate randomized encounter or challenge for the player that lands on them. The player is not allowed to roll again until they have completed the action or challenge. Action Squares can involve one or all participants.
-Challenge Cards: Challenge Cards act in the same manner as Action Squares. Challenge cards are also randomly generated and are not marked on the game map and can occur at any time. Challenge Cards can be far more specific in action or encounter and can affect one or all players.
-All players much reach the end of the game before the game may end. Players who reach the end of the game map are immune and exempt from all dice, Action Square or Challenge Card effects.
-Any attempts to alter the natural flow of play will result in the offending player being issued a Penalty Card and sent back six spaces. Offending players must follow the instructions or consequences of the Penalty Card before they may roll again.
-All morphs that occur during the game are permanent until the game ends. If any player quits the game voluntarily, they will not be able to revert or otherwise change themselves back (unless they initiate a new game).
-The longer the game, the more complete the change. The longer games last, the more likely that 'personality bleeding' from the chosen avatar on to the player's psyche will occur.
-When all players have reached the end, they must shout 'Morphmanji!', eliminating any and all transformative effects on them.
-The player that reached the end first is the winner and is granted one wish.


-Immersive Mode-

In Immersive Mode, all players will be transported the the game world, taking the form and role of their avatar. Players must follow the prompts and clues in order to progress the scenario's story and be able to exit the game.

-Players are given five lives to be used during the adventure.
-Players can gain additional lives through completing bonus objectives.
-Players that lose lives will adopt more traits of their avatars as punishment.
-Players that lose all lives will become part of the game world and no longer treated as players.
-Players can be transformed through various means, items, events and opposing characters.
-Players can find and equip items to improve their avatar abilities.
-Successfully navigating scenario events can award players with unique items and abilities.
-To end the game, the players must navigate the entire scenario from start to finish and declare 'Morphmanji' upon completion of the scenario.
-Upon completion, all players that have not used up their lives will be returned to their original world. Players that use up all their lives will remain in the game world permanently.
-the player to declare 'Morphmanji' will be given one wish.
